story:
Okula ulaşım konusunda zorluk çeken ve bu masrafı karşılayamayan 6 arkadaş ile karşılaştım. İstanbul'da, okula ulaşmak için sabahları 1 saat, akşam dönüşte de 1 saat yürüyorlar. Araştırdım ve bir öğrenci aylık 70 TL'ye aylık İstanbul Kart yapabiliyor. Ben tek başıma bu yükü kaldıramam. 1 senelik okul masrafları 1800 TL tutuyor. 15 Eylül'e kadar onlara bir sürpriz yapmak, ulaşım masraflarını karşılayabilmek için desteğinize ihtiyacım var.


SIK SORULAN SORULAR

  • Yardım etmek istiyorum fakat burada bile anonimsin. Neden?
Çünkü benim kişisel bilgilerimi biliyor olman, yaptığın yardıma etki etmeyecek. Ya yardım edersin, ya da etmezsin. Ben anonim geldim, anonim gideceğim üzgünüm.
  • Çocuklar nerede? Görebilir miyim?
Üsküdar'da oturuyorlar, Kadıköy'de kağıt topluyorlar. Hayır göremezsin. Yardım sonrası yapacağımız teşekkür videosunda da yüzlerini göremeyeceksin.
  • Neden dolar?
Çünkü burası dolar üzerinden işlem yapmaya izin veriyor.
  • Ben hesapladım 650 Dolar'dan fazlası gerekiyor. Neden 650 Dolar?
Çünkü 650 Dolar sembolik bir destek. Geri kalan masraf 1200 Dolar civarı yanlış hesaplamadıysam. Onları ben cebimden vereceğim. Sizin de katkınız olsun diye bu fon kampanyasını başlattım.

story:
Thousand of migrants are now stuck in Budapest Hungary, they ran away from war zone to get a new life. They are now stuck in Hungary at the Keleti train station and need help.


What they actually need :

  • Food to stay alive and get better
  • Fresh water to stay hydrated
  • Clothes and shoes so they can change themselves after this agony trip
  • sleeping bag as they sleep on concrete
  • diapers for kids 
  • hygiene towels for women

War is the reality in their country they are not immigrant, they are refugees

  • thousands of migrants are coming EVERY DAY to Hungary
  • EU plan a meeting on september 14th which is way too far, they need help before this meeting
  • Germany point at Dublin 3 accord and wants Hungary to take care of all the asylum request 
  • The Hungarian government is not able to handle this problem alone without help of other EU countries

These people are human, lets help them

I am a Canadian living in Hungary, its the first time that I am facing a so big problem, these people are helpless, governments are trying to get rid of them without giving the help they need. Canada and the United States are built on immigration since the beginning. Let's help these men, women and children and prove that we are one world facing the problem. 

How to help

You can help by donating on indigogo, you can join the group "let's help refugee in Hungary"

  • You can ask on the group where to send the actual items needed. 
  • Share this on Facebook, Twitter, news, let's restore our faith in humanity!

story:
NPP Youth Nights 

Trensitas: NPP Youth Nights is a community program blossoming from Nalgona Positivity Pride (NPP). In 2014, Gloria Lucas established NPP as a way to  address the importance of decolonization, historical trauma, eating disorders and body positivity. Trensitas, aims to expand on NPP’s mission by implementing the first comprehensive body-positive  and self love program for youth of color in Los Angeles. 

 Trensitas NPP Youth Nights Her-story 

In the summer of 2016, individuals from various neighborhoods in the Los Angeles area, gathered to design a youth program dedicated to empowering, enriching, and strengthening youth in our communities. Members of the Trensitas collective share varying common experiences in healing from eating disorders, tumultuous relationships with food and deconstructing unhealthy perceptions of body image. Trensitas, aims to break the isolation of youth of color who may also be struggling with eating disorders, food relationships, and unhealthy perceptions of body image.Through our upcoming program youth can expect to learn tools for:

- healing and radical self-care

-challenging the pressures of American beauty ideals

-reclaiming identity, culture, and land.

 

❤  Meet The Trensitas Team  ❤

Ourstorian, Social Media & Outreach Coordinator

Abriana Avila (She/her/they)

Raised in Boyle Heights/East La

My favorite foods would be tortas and Ramen!

What I love about myself? I love how resilient I am; just like my mama!

 

Big Mama & Youth Facilitator

 Vanessa Correa (She/Her)

Carson, CA

Mole Poblano and Cinnabon

I love my smile and my ability to persevere through challenges.

 

Big Mama, Curriculum Developer & Youth Facilitator

Jacqueline Gradilla (She/Her)

East LA, CA

Chicken Pozole

I love that I am a Luchadora, Xingona, and Xillona.

 

Curriculum Developer & Youth Facilitator 

Hola, I am Maria Lozano. My pronouns are she/her/they.

I grew up in Moorpark, Ca- living in LA.

My favorite food is Mediterranean and sushi.

I love that I am always looking to challenge myself mentally or physically to be happy and sharp.

 

Big Mama, Curriculum Developer & Family Advocate

Gloria Lucas (She/Her)

 Riverside

My mom's chiles rellenos.

I love my laugh.

 

Treasurer 

Marina (she/her)

East LA & NELA  

I love yucca frita and agua de fresa!

I love that I talk with my hands when I'm emotional, passionate or nervous.  

 

Curriculum Developer 

Alejandra O. (She, Her)

Hometown? San Diego, CA

Favorite Food? Pineapple - Jalapeno Pizza

What do you love about yourself? That I'm a strong-willed, no-nonsense, cabrona, xingona. 

 

Ourstorian, Social Media & Outreach Coordinator

Scarlett Villacorta (She/Her)

Los Angeles

Thai Food

I love my crazy curly hair.

 

The Negative Effects of Eating Disorders 

According to the National Eating Disorder Association (NEDA), “35-57% of adolescent girls engage in crash dieting, fasting, self-induced vomiting, diet pills, or laxatives.” (“Race, Ethnicity, Culture”, n.d.) Yet, African-American girls between the ages of 11-14, score twice as high on 62 of the 64 Eating Disorder Inventory (EDI) scales, than caucasian girls of the same age. (“Eating Disorders Affect Us All”, n.d.) Another study on body image and weight loss, indicates Latina 5th graders are more likely than caucasian students to have negative perceptions of their bodies and have negative associations with weight loss attempts. (Epperson et al., 2013)                                    

We Need Your Help!!

Due to these alarming statistics afflicting our youth, we need your assistance to help establish Trensitas: NPP Youth Nights. We are currently working with Mendez High School in Boyle Heights to implement our first five-week program for the 2017-2018 school year. Our goal is to raise $6,500 by August 12, 2017!

Program Expenses

Our expenses will cover the following materials, and are not limited to:

Media Literacy & Access to Information and Resources (Videos, Movies, Books, Research Articles)

Technology Resources (Digital Cables, Projectors, Printers)

Curriculum Materials & Construction (Writing Journals, Books, Office Supplies)

Printing Documents & Curriculum Activities

Educational Pamphlets for Parents

Art Supplies

Guest Lecturers

Contributions for Space

Hosting Parent Workshops

& Healthy Snacks!

 

♡   Regalitos  ♡ 

In return for your donation we will be providing some unique Trensitas & NPP merchandise and gifts ♡

  •  $25 Shoutout on Facebook + Emailed Self-Care Tip Sheet + Body Positive E-Zine 
  • $50 Emailed Self-Care Tip Sheet + Body Positive E-Zine + Trensitas Tote-Bag
  • $75 Emailed Self Care Tip + Body Positive E-Zine + Limited Edition Trensitas Mug
  • $100 Emailed Self Care Tip + Body Positive E-Zine + Dreamy Trensitas Pillow
  • $250 Host a Private NPP Workshop in LA County or Sponsor a Private Workshop in a High School or Middle School that is predominately in a community of color such as East LA, South-East LA, South LA, and Central LA... etc. 

 

Our adorable Soy Yo Tote-Bag! Available in our Missy Elliott pack!

 

Our Limited Edition Trensitas Mug! Available in our Queen Latifah pack!

'

Snuggle up with our dreamy Trensitas pillow! Available in our Celia Cruz pack!  

 

If you have any questions regarding the updated incentives please contact us  @ nppyouthnights@gmail.com

 

Thank You Amigx's!!!

Trensitas: NPP Youth Nights greatly appreciates your generosity! If you are interested in providing material donations please email us at nppyouthnights@gmail.com Check us out on Facebook and Instagram for our upcoming Trensitas projects and events!

Sharing is caring, invite all your gente to check out our campaign!

Special gracias from Trensitas NPP Youth Nights Team to our creative contributors!

Our beautiful video was directed by Christina Herrera of La Cleta Films! https://www.lacletafilms.com 

Thank You & Besitos! ♡

 

Resources

https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/race-et...

https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/eating-...  

Epperson, A. , Song, A. , Wallander, J. , Markham, C. , Cuccaro, P. , et al. (2014). Associations among body size, body image perceptions, and weight loss attempts among african american, latino, and white youth: A test of a mediational model. Journal of Pediatric Psychology, 39(4), 394-404.

Eating Disorder Inventory Info: http://river-centre.org/wp-content/uploads/2015...

For personal assistance, please check out the National Eating Disorder Association hotline at (800) 931-2237.                          

 For more information on NEDA's Hotline, please check out the link below!!

https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/help-su...

story:
It is easy for me to believe our ignorance of sex and love lies at the root of many of our social ills.  We are conditioned into a pleasure/procreation paradigm by tactics of warfare. This keeps us in place. 

It is as if we are put in a locked closet with our sex and love lives.  I wish to break the lock and open the door, to our internal power.  This book is for anybody who is sexually active, regardless of how often.  There is something for everybody, even those who disagree with my premises.

“FORBIDDEN:The Alchemy of Sacred Love” is an expansive, comprehensive and integrated overview of sex and love from a different perspective, beginning at the genetic level in our bodies.  It is based on my experience, research and intuition: a narrative text. I certainly do not know everything there is to know about sex and love.  We are all genetically unique, so it is impossible. 

There is far more to sex and love than I was aware of when I began this journey 15 years ago.  I share with you both my experience and that which I have learned from others.  If you consider the perspective suggested in the book, it makes things simpler and could be worth a million dollars in your love life! 

There are many who have contributed to this work.  I began my research into sexual science with Dr. Beverly Whipple.  Dr. Franceen King was a great help, because today’s sexual science did not explain where I have been.  Dr. John Perry also contributed and even those with whom I strongly disagree, had something to offer.  I found much of what I was seeking was hidden from common knowledge, but existed in other areas.

What We Need & What You Get

There are over 30 illustrations. The edited book needs professional artwork.  Much of the artwork I have is from Wikipedia and other sources on the net.  Some is in color and even gaudy.  I believe simple B&W line drawings would more clearly get the message across.  I am a poet and technical writer, not an artist.  Although the current art suffices and some of it is pretty, it is not consistent. A local artist, Ms Julia Bertrand can do this work. This is an estimated $3000. (Phase 1.)

After the artwork, comes the publishing, lay out costs, printing costs, etc.  That can easily be $9000 in today’s economy. (Phase 2.)

I found in my research, everybody has an agenda.  Mine is authentic unity, leading to inter dependence.  Although I am geared for heterosexual monogamy, for all I know it might work with homosexuality or polygamy? 

Thank you for your donation.  I greatly appreciate your helping me get this message out.

The Impact

Your contribution will help me get this book out to the public.  I do not offer a “right” way, simply a different way of perceiving love, sex and life that can be beneficial to those who consider it and those about them.  I offer science, where available, to dispel myth.

This book impacts people.  I have identified only a few sources of our erroneous belief systems, yet it causes those who have read my draft manuscript to see with different eyes.  Their reviews are at www.thesacredfemale.com/alrev.html.

As a guy, I want a “reason” for changing. Before I started this journey, I had only a vague awareness of love and what it did.  In the book, I offer a definition and show what it does.  I laugh, because we don’t need a definition, just the expression.  I give what I believe is a reasonable explanation for how it works and that, too, is immaterial.  It works.  But, for guys, we now have a “reason.”

Risks & Challenges

Because of my experiences, and my research I am a very strong believer in this work.  I have a strong desire to inform the public, at least those willing to listen.  The biggest risk I face is in not being able to financially get the book to market.  After that, I will do what it takes to get the book out.  That includes, If necessary, a book signing in Westboro, TN!  (It is a lot about love and I think they can use some.)

Other Ways You Can Help

I am in the same boat as many out there and would be unable to contribute to my own campaign.  If you cannot contribute, I am asking you to help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  

You can use the Indiegogo share tools if nothing else!

story:
The Manna Healing Learning House

My name is Amy J. I have been a teacher for over 15 years; in the past 4 years, I found my calling as an Instructor of the ThetaHealing® Technique. I currently hold my Masters in ThetaHealing and will be receiving my Certificate of Science from THInK this summer, 2016.  My background, training and interests are diverse and span many arenas;it has been a dream of mine to create a space to house opportunities to share and learn with others.  

I was inspired to use this format to fund  this project to build the Manna Healing Learning House, because the house's mission is to create community through teaching, learning, sharing and supporting one another's dreams. By crowd-funding, each contribution makes the Learning House a project that is made from the collaboration of individuals- strangers made friends- through a common desire to share in an undertaking that advances learning, truth, and love. 

This campaign will fund: the design, construction and launching of a partially enclosed/ open-air learning space in Hawi, Hawaii, Big Island, U.S.A. It will be located on our Macadamia nut orchard and operating farm, where myself and my partner reside. The Learning House will be  a meeting place for people world-wide, to come together and create universal community for the sake of sharing knowledge, information and truth. 

The Learning Houses's intended uses are for teaching: ThetaHealing classes and workshops, yoga, meditation, art, cooking, improvisation, writing, music, dance classes and more. We also plan to continue hosting International teachers with diverse areas of expertise who have the desire to offer workshops, seminars, and classes on a myriad of topics for students who are brave enough to believe in their ability to change the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

BEGINNINGS: To make this project viable, we enlisted an interior designer and master carpenter team, living here on the Big Island, to design a four-hipped 24'x24' covered structure with wrap-around lanai. We want to insure the learning house will last for years to come and that it is strong and sturdy to brave the climate of our beloved Kohala volcano where our classroom will reside. We already have our design drawn up, and estimates for materials are in. 

SOURCING: We plan to source as much of our supplies as possible from local hardwoods and materials that are unaffected by the Hawaii climate and salvage as many materials as possible; as recycling and camp-fire policy of leaving our campsite cleaner than we arrived applies to the entire construction process. Because Hawaii is an island, everything that is not grown here must be imported. Approximately 2/3 of the funds raised through this campaign will be directed towards the costs of materials. We will place our order for materials at the end of March, 2016 and break ground April 1, our one year Hawaii Anniversary. 

CREATING: Island time is a real thing; however, we intend to build this classroom quickly and have it up and running, with the plan to break ground as soon as our materials arrive in mid- late April. The construction itself will take a little over a month to complete. Doing this will require compensating our amazing design and construction team for their time and  efforts constructing the Learning House. 

SHARING: We already have retreats planned for the summer months, and will be adding a section to our website, www.manna-healing.com where you can learn about our retreat offerings and how to bring a retreat or workshop to the island to teach in the learning house. Once construction is complete, we will use a small portion of the remaining funding to apply and get our Learning House and Farm officially LLC licensed, as well as purchase liability insurance. With the remaining funding, we will purchase supplies for the Learning House and to create an advertising campaign, including content pages on our website to open the classroom to the world. 

Every bit of funding raised will go towards each step of this creation. Our funding goal is meant to cover everything from BEGINNINGS TO SHARING. 

OUR PERKS ARE VERY EXCITING and are focused on offering you and your loved ones the opportunity to experience healing, as well as chances to experience gifts of our farm and the Learning House itself.  We want you to know how important your commitment to this project is, so take a peek! 

The Impact Your Contribution Has

 Hawaii, by its nature, is healing. Having a space for people to bring their students with the explicit mission of learning, sharing and growing, here in Hawi- the spiritual center of the islands for native Hawaiians- is an opportunity for each of us to have a large impact on our community- local and world-wide. With your support, you are contributing to providing a safe space for generations of individuals to connect, grow, share and encounter success in their own right. Your contribution provides us with the ability to provide this space. Without you, this project remains a dream. 

Risks & Challenges

I spent a number of years managing projects and have run a number of my own businesses since I was 18 years old. Because the cost of importing supplies is very volatile here on the Big Island, we run the risk of under-budgeting, should importing costs suddenly change due to market changes. This requires ingenuity to locally source as much of our supplies as possible, which will be an opportunity for us to support local businesses and create community.  This classroom is a project that I am putting my energy, love and care towards unflinchingly. 

Other Ways You Can Empower this Project

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can still contribute! Please pass this campaign on to anyone or any business you feel would be interested in contributing and supporting the creation of learning communities world-wide. This is a project meant for all, made by all, so include everyone in this experience! Your prayers, thoughts, and love to create this project are gratefully appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

Oki! My name is Tia Ledesma, a mother of two and ispiring to be a youth advocate from  Calgary, Alberta.

 I, along with other youth and community leaders have collaborated on a project started in 2014, centering on the topic of "Uncovering colonial legacies" : Voices of Indigenous youth in Child Welfare and Impacts of (dis)placement."

This project brought together Calgary youth who wished to tell their story and speak on social issues indigenous youth face, including how child welfare has affected their life and those around them. Youth could contribute to the project in any way they wished whether it be through- story, art, photography, and poetry.

This impactful project has been presented in Calgary and surrounding areas, at the U of C, Mount Royal,  the Child and Youth Advocacy, Treaty 7 Child and Family Health Authority, and Enoch Aboriginal Research Forum.

Youth and the project now have the opportunity to present at the CESA:Sovereignties and Colonialisms: Resisting Racism, Extraction and Dispossession  2015 conference at York University in Toronto, however the only barrier is the funding !

Please help youth continue with their Journey to speak, tell their story, and make an impact for aboriginal youth.

***Funding needed will simply go to Transportation from Calgary to Toronto, Food and Shelter for two nights in Toronto for two youth, which we think will add up to $3000.***

Personally, it has not only been a healing journey to speak of my truths but to also encourage others to speak on their stories, (through spoken word or art and creative medias) and hopefully make an positive impact on a system the seeks to separate us! #Breakingcycles 
Thank you for your interest and your contribution!
*Other ways to help -Press the share button ! :)

story:
Capilla Jesus Hijo De Maria

The design intent proposed by Elisandra Garcia proposes a humble but yet, elegant expression of Catholicism.  Never competing with context, but rather making the art of architecture through spirituality.  arc+E creative plans to build the small church (30’x60’) by the summer of 2015.  This is the beginning to an infrastructure that could aid and sustain socio-economic activities to help underpriviledged communities in Juarez, Mexico.

Our expectation is to build a church that is environmentally friendly and sustainable for future generations. Environmental issues are not merely political or technological but also spiritual, especially in terms of stewardship and social justice. This project is uniquely positioned to effectively model a Creation caretaker’s role in the ways they locate, design, build, and manage their facilities. Green design is a sound investment that makes good sense economically, socially, environmentally, and physically.

As more churches include creation care in congregational life, all ages experience hope and joy. They start to see how God has gifted their church with specific callings and resources to protect the earth so that all may flourish.


MISSION:To create a living, spiritual space of beauty that nurtures, nourishes, and heals.



Ideas


  • Imagine worshipers inhaling the fresh scent of a living green wall—a vertical frame of soil and plants. Seeing and hearing water trickling down the green wall reminds people that they are baptized and have gathered to praise their Creator.  

  • A community garden will give families and individuals plots of healthy earth on which to raise food. The garden will give the church the space to raise fresh produce for the food pantry, providing pantry food recipients with a more balanced, nutritious mix of food products. The garden will also nurture the spiritual side of people with a place to pray and meditate.The garden will give children of all ages the opportunity to revel in the beauty of earth and living plants.The garden will enhance the sense of community among church members and church neighbors and those with a passion for providing sustenance to those in need.

  • Prayer garden is an area where people can gather together for worship.  The focus of the prayer garden area is a spiral constructed of rocks with herbs and flowers planted in all the spaces.  A cross will be displayed in the center of the spiral.  A space will allow for benches in an amphitheater format.  The space is planned to provide space for 15-20 people.

story:
Welcome to Ísafjörður Subarctic Marine Station (ISAMS), a non-profit educational marine research station. Its objective is to contribute to marine and climate change research, provide experiential learning to students, and support sustainable opportunities locally.

As station managers, Michael and Mathilde need a little help to create an ideal platform for visiting marine researchers, scientists and ecologists to work, share their knowledge, and make an impact in arctic ecology.

We would also be able to host local and international students for their field studies, study abroad experiences, or intensive expeditions. 

The station activities and constant stream of researchers and visiting students will help to sustain the local businesses in the small town of Ísafjörður, and create long-term partnerships with schools, universities, and government organisations. 

Adventure in Iceland

We both have been working in marine research in different locations and love Iceland for its magnificent seascapes and marine research opportunities. We would like to create a perfect research oasis for everybody who would benefit from its location as a sentinel site for arctic climate change monitoring. Furthermore, Iceland is centrally located between Europe and the Americas, with cheap airfares and practical travel times from most major cities. 

ISAMS will offer unforgettable experiences to student groups and researchers: they can kayak the fjords with whales and seals (for the brave), hike a glacier (for the adventurous), watch the Northern Lights (for the romantic), or climb into a volcano crater (for the badass). These activities, and many others, will be done in partnership with the experienced local guides and small businesses that will help us make student experiences even more interesting, while also creating employment and sustainable income for the locals.

Impact on the World

We have already received commitments from the local university centre, the economic development agency, study abroad travel agencies, and numerous tour operators in Iceland, allowing us to offer students the best value for their travel budget.

Now we need your help to raise funds for the station facility, lab equipment, station vehicle and start-up operating cost – that’s where we will need you to help us over the finishing line. 

As this enterprise is not-for-profit, all revenues will go back into the business to improve the station, provide improved curricula for visiting students, and better laboratory and field resources for the researchers.

story:
Hello, My name is Christopher Jilley. A very good friend of mine David Burrows and I have visited Thailand, Laos and SE Asia a number of times and have ridden around much of Thailand and Laos by Motorcycle. During our visit's to Laos we have always been overwhelmed by the warmth and love of the Laotian people. Given the hardship and loss the country and its people have and still do endure, the love and friendship the Laos people are so willing to share is so Inspiring.

The children of Laos want so much to learn and some travel long distances to attend schools with very little equipment to assist in their learning other than of course the vital support provided by the devoted families and teachers, many of whom are volunteers.

We realise that we can only do a little, but a little goes a very long way! Over the last few years, through the generosity of others we raised funds through our workplaces, friends, online and our own contributions to raise funds to purchase school equipment to help the children of Laos.

Feel free to check out our Blog http://illyjay.blogspot.com.au/ where you can see for yourself the difference your help can make.

We invite you to join us on our next adventure which begins in October this year where we are again visiting the children of Laos and some of the poorer villages and schools to give them some extra tools to assist in their development. We will be riding around this beautiful country bringing a book party, uniforms and hopefully some electronic learning devices (Tablets) pre loaded with loads of educational content to needy village school(s) as well as giving out books to many others along the way.

Our previous campaigns and friends donations over the past years visits have raised over 1500 USD. This enabled us to purchase books, uniforms, stationary and sports equipment as well as some bicycles and helmets for many children that otherwise have to walk long distances to reach their closest school.

To see what your support can do, below are the rough costs of some of the educational supplies we have and will be purchasing to give you an idea of how such a small amount can do so much!

What we can buy with:

$1 - An ABC or Momosign English learning book (This won't just help one child, it can help a child and their whole family, these kids will share with each other)

$3 - A larger and more indepth A4 size advanced learning book (This can help teachers or advanced students, in turn helping them to share their learning's with others)

$5 - Give a child the basic learning books and some stationary to help them in their studies


$5 - Give a child a new clean uniform (Shirt) to wear at school, something for them to wear proudly being part of something special (Many of these children have NEVER been given a new item of clothing, don't underestimate the pride and sense of belonging to a team that something as simple as a uniform can bring)

$20 to 40 - A tablet PC loaded with heaps of Video and Audio learning books and presentations to help a group of children in a classroom further their learning at their own pace. The potentials are nearly limitless

With the help of many friends we have met, we have visited two schools over the past years to bring book parties with many of the learning resources developed by Martin Momoda of momobooks. Martin is involved in an initiative called Pencils of Promise and is working to create learning resources for many developing countries in their own languages to help them on their learning adventure.


If you are able to help out and support us in this good cause we promise you it will make a significant difference to the lives of many Laotians!

We will of course post receipts for the purchases with 100% of the money raised going directly to the people of Laos in the form of School Equipment.

See the bottom of this page for links to organisations that inspired us that support the Laos people from education to clearing UXO (Unexploded Ordinance).

We would love to be able to help as many children on our journey as we can and with your help we can purchase more equipment for these kids who are so keen to learn. You will get the opportunity to follow us on our motorcycle adventure through these beautiful lands and get to share in the joy of helping many children in their development.

http://illyjay.blogspot.com.au/


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course not everyone can afford to donate, you can still support us by sharing this campaign with as many as you can, a little goes a long way, a little from alot goes a very long way :)

If you are able to, support other charities and good cause organisations working to help others. Use the links below to learn more about some of these organisations in the region.

Momo Books (Language Learning Resources) http://www.momobooks.org/

MAG (Mines Advisory Group) http://www.maginternational.org/

Why not visit Laos or Thailand for your next trip abroad? Such amazing places to see and people to meet. If you would like to do something like what we are doing, please don't hesitate to contact me and i would be happy to provide any help and suggestions I can based on our experience to help you on your way :) Kop Jai Lai Lai or Kop Kuhn Kup (Thank you very much)

“Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.”
story_txt:
Hello, My name is Christopher Jilley. A very good friend of mine David Burrows and I have visited Thailand, Laos and SE Asia a number of times and have ridden around much of Thailand and Laos by Motorcycle. During our visit's to Laos we have always been overwhelmed by the warmth and love of the Laotian people. Given the hardship and loss the country and its people have and still do endure, the love and friendship the Laos people are so willing to share is so Inspiring.The children of Laos want so much to learn and some travel long distances to attend schools with very little equipment to assist in their learning other than of course the vital support provided by the devoted families and teachers, many of whom are volunteers.We realise that we can only do a little, but a little goes a very long way! story:
MyLeanMBA - a fun, flexible & affordable business administration program - finally!

 

Many people have thought about getting an MBA, only to decide against it due to a lack of time or money. MBAs can cost over $100,000! Crazy, right? Luckily, there is an alternative. It's The Lean MBA!

The Lean MBA® is a 1-year, 100% online, Professional Certificate Program in Business Administration. It is the most fun, flexible, and affordable program of its kind.

The Lean MBA’s condensed format features 350 mini-courses that cover the entire typical MBA curriculum through 12 functional areas of business administration. In 1 year, 15-30 minutes per day, and for a regular price of 299€, earn a Professional Certificate of Business Administration with MyLeanMBA.

This program is specially-designed for busy professionals who don't want the high financial investment and time commitment of a traditional MBA. The program offers an easy-to-follow weekly routine for cultivating real, usable business skills.

Led by Program Director Danielle Levi-Feunteun, a Harvard MBA and former adjunct professor at HEC Paris, The Lean MBA offers only the highest-quality coursework created by PhDs and experts in their fields. The full curriculum includes:
  1. Entrepreneurship (4 weeks)
  2. General Management, Strategy & Leadership (6 weeks)
  3. Marketing & Sales (8 weeks)
  4. Economics (4 weeks)
  5. Statistics & Big Data (4 weeks)
  6. Operations Management (4 weeks)
  7. Business Law & Ethics (3 weeks)
  8. Human Resource Management (3 weeks)
  9. Accounting (3 weeks)
  10. Finance (6 weeks)
  11. International Business & Political Analysis (2 weeks)
  12. Project & Quality Management (3 weeks)

The Lean MBA also fosters a worldwide community of like-minded business professionals. More than 4,000 students in 70 countries are already studying with us! Plus, LinkedIn groups and in-person meetups make this program more networking-based than similar online programs. Networking + knowledge, all in one!

 

What do we need?

Educational transformation is hard. There are big barriers to entry (high costs of hiring, long accreditation process), but even bigger and more rewarding opportunities (market size of 100+ million, chance to provide must-needed affordable business training worldwide).

MyLeanMBA will use the funding to:

  • Hire PhDs and experts to write and contribute to our high-quality coursework and lessons.
  • Concentrate on student support and using feedback to further improve our service.
  • Provide scholarships for low-income students who may have no other chance to study.
  • Market & advertise The Lean MBA program worldwide, creating a global network of Lean MBA students.
  • Develop further functionalities to improve the user experience and platform currently used for delivering the courses

 

What do you get?

  • 15€ = appear as a contributor on our website
  • 50€ = PDF download of our Entrepreneurship; Economics; Operations; or Statistics & Big Data modules
  • 75€ = PDF download of our Management module
  • 100€ = PDF download of our Marketing module
  • 250€ = 1-year access to The Lean MBA program
  • 1100€ = 5 Lean MBA accounts for your company/team
  • 2000€ = 10 Lean MBA accounts for your company/team

 

Who is behind MyLeanMBA?

Program Director - Danielle Levi-Feunteun

Danielle Levi-Feunteun began her education in engineering, but ended up earning a Master of Business Administration degree from the prestigious Harvard Business School (International Finance and Project Financing, 1974-1976.) Most notable during her long corporate career is her role as Adjunct Professor of Corporate Finance at HEC Paris (1981-2009).  

Founder & Managing Director - Edouard Blin

Edouard Blin studied engineering at Arts & Métiers ParisTech, afterwards obtaining a Master in Risk Management. Edouard worked in the finance industry for 10+ years as an investment banker (in Tokyo, Japan and Madrid, Spain) before pursuing entrepreneurship - something he felt was more in line with his life goals. In 2014, Edouard left banking to form his own Education Technology company and pivoted the startup to create the Lean MBA. By October 2016, the first online class of The Lean MBA program was launched.

See the full team here.

story:
Hello and welcome to my Indiegogo page! My name is Gabriella Rice and I am a 15 year old incoming sophomore at Hopkins High. I have been interested in oceanography since 5th grade. Recently I found out about a program in Maine called Coastal Studies for Girls. CSG is a program for up to 20 sophomore girls who are looking for an opportunity to study coastal ecosystems. I am really excited because I am one of the lucky young women that was chosen from a national pool of applicants to attend CSG this fall. I am also proud to be only the third Minnesotan to be attending in the history of their school. Even though I received a 50% scholarship, the tuition is still quite costly which is why I have created this campaign. In addition to seeking donations, I will be working as many summer hours as possible!  
If you would like to learn more about Coastal Studies for Girls, click on the link below:
https://www.coastalstudiesforgirls.org/

story:
Short Summary

Hi I’m Melvin El, a four-time National Boxing champion and winner of the Olympic trials in 1988. I have also coached little boys who had never boxed before so well that they won national championships their first year. The secret of rapid success was teaching them to master the basics. After boxing, I started tutoring high school students at my local church. I began tutoring different high school students from various schools that couldn’t read which led me to believe that this could be an epidemic. I realized that by the time the students got to me it was extremely challenging to get them up to grade level. It was obvious that if I was going to attempt to change their reading abilities I would have to start with the younger students; this problem would have to be stopped at the source.

Years later, I became a single father to my 1 year old little girl and I wanted to teach her how to read. One day I noticed that when Michael Jackson’s songs would come on the radio she would sing every single lyric with ease. It was fun for her and she had somehow learned his lyrics verbatim. It was incredible. I began researching the science behind music and learning and discovered that music encourages the brain to pay attention. Armed with this information, I began utilizing music and phonics to ensure that she would master the basics of reading. She went on to skip 3 grades and gain a love for learning. My child had benefitted from this powerful method, therefore I knew it was my job to teach children everywhere how to read.

My company, The Reading Reformation created the program, Read Like A Genius With M.C. Ant Tanna with the help of teachers with more than 30 years of experience. We are dedicated to teaching children how to read using music, phonics and engaging images which ensure that they master the reading basics quickly. We are passionate about our mission to teach children everywhere how to read. Because this is our passion we offered a FREE 7 day study for an inner city school class where children were struggling to read.The principal, Ms. Banky gave us 2 kindergarten classes with students that were not able to read. Seven days later the principal watched the post test take place and was amazed when she saw the children reciting 50-60 words fluently. Ms.Banky went on to say, “One way to ensure that children learn to read before they leave Kindergarten and First grade is by utilizing the program, Read Like a Genius.”

Our Mission 

We have an ambitious, but totally doable mission of teaching children everywhere how to read. This isn’t just about a single child. This is about scary statistics that state, in this current generation of America, 1 out of 4 children are growing up functionally ILLITERATE.

Other states have asked us to help their schools out as we did here in Florida. The first two cities we have targeted to conduct the same 7-day studies at are New York and Atlanta. We plan to teach 100 children to read in these cities where the reading scores are extremely low. The cost to cover all expenses and travel arrangements would be around $5,000.00 per city. However, we simply don’t have the funds. We really do need your help. You have the chance to be part of an amazing story of educational triumph. In fact, in this story, you would become the hero, a hero that helps to save a generation and leaves a legacy that will be remembered for many years. Whether you give just $5, $10 or $20, every single bit helps. If you are able to make a larger contribution of $1,000 or more, it will be much appreciated. But, be assured that we are so grateful for whatever you are willing to do…we believe that it will truly make a significant difference in the lives of our children.

Thank you so much for your time and your attention!

What We Need & What You Get

With your donation we will be able to cover:  

  • Travel Fees
  • Reading Materials for the children ( books, digital audio & video resources, headphones)
  • Venue for the 7 day program
  • 2 Reading coaches/trainers
For your generosity, we are offering some amazing perks! 
  • Volume 1 reading program
  • Volume 2 reading program 
  • Volume 3 reading program 
  • Flashcards, audio component for the reading program
  • Musical Timetables program 
  • Exclusive Autographed M.C. Ant Tanna poster !
  • and more....
With these perks you will be able to teach a child you know how to read at home quickly and efficiently. This deal will only be available here! 

The Impact

We’ve created an amazing reading programs that principals, teachers, and parents absolutely love. We've had an amazing impact on the students in Miami, Florida. However, we know that there are children outside of Florida who can benefit from a reading program that has been proven to work quickly and efficiently. Your support will be put towards getting 2 reading coaches to New York and Atlanta to start teaching children to read who are struggling. 

Some of these children are in danger of being retained and some have been held back multiple times. They need our help to get on the right path and start reading. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your monetary support definitely helps but there are other way that you can make a difference and become a hero for our children. 

  • Spread the word about the #ReadLikeAGenius movement on Facebook and Twitter.

  • Send out an email to your friends and family and let them know about this campaign.

  • Stay connected. Follow Read Like a Genius on Facebook and Instagram to stay up-to-date on the Read Like a Genius movement.

Perks

and much more....

story:
Summary

We are Bulungi Creative, an NGO rooted in creativity, supporting a Creative Thinking Program in Jinja, Uganda within three primary schools in the Walukuba area.  For the past two years we've been working with students and teachers to complement the government education by teaching a purposely disruptive, unconventional and unexpected set of lessons, helping to introduce and develop critical and creative thinking skills lacking in the traditional rote learning style of repeating and memorizing.

With our program, students now are taught vital skills to gather basic information instead of expecting to always have it be given, process what it means to them and then form their own perspectives, points-of-view and begin to question the status quo.

This campaign will help to fund our Creative Thinking Program costs for over 1200 students for 2016 and into the following year.  We hate to put a cost per student, but when you can work with almost 1000 students a year for under $800, that proves the program is not only highly effective in improving students' learning, but also cost-efficient.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what the money goes towards:

  • All funding will go directly to our Creative Thinking Program, first for all in-class materials and transportation to lessons.  This includes any lesson materials, printing or incentives (stickers work wonders).
  • Next up is for our Teacher Training Program, where we introduce the teachers to our curriculum and how they may be able to introduce those same skills within their lessons.  We do at least 3 training sessions per year, with attendees increasing each session.

Now here's what we can give you for your support;

  • The knowledge that every penny you donate is used effectively and responsibly.  You are quite literally improving the life of a new student with each dollar you donate.
  • Not enough?  Any donation over $20 will also get a personal hand-written thank you letter from the Bulungi Team and a shout-out on our social pages (if you want that).
  • Any donation over $50 gets the same as above, plus a printed photo from our uniquely disruptive Creative Thinking Program classes.
  • For those of you making the big splash of $100 or more, you get the above and a phone call from one of our team to personally thank you (remember to put your number or skype handle in the comments if you'd like us to ring you).

We'd give you more, but it all goes to the program.

The Impact

It's more than just lessons in class.  Supporting Bulungi supports the following as welll:

  • Equipping young students (grades 2 through 7) with skills to question and change everything in their lives will lead to positive change throughout the country.  As you solve for education, you solve for an entire generation of young men and women ready to take on all problems facing the country.
  • Building confidence in students who may not fit within the traditional learning styles.  We often find that some of the weaker students connect best with our lessons because of the unconventional approach.
  • Supporting Walukuba village.  We have an incredible team in country, and that team works with some of the most passionate, dedicated and unselfish teachers, headmistresses and volunteers that we've ever encountered.  By supporting us you're supporting them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to spare a few dollars this holiday season, you can help us immensely by: 

  • Sharing this campaign to your network of donors, friends and family to support the work that Bulungi Creative has been doing with our schools.  (Indiegogo has some pretty great sharing options)
  • Looking into what we do and contacting us to see how you may be able to work with and for us towards raising our fundraising objective.

Instagram: @bulungigrams
story_txt:
Summary We are Bulungi Creative, an NGO rooted in creativity, supporting a Creative Thinking Program in Jinja, Uganda within three primary schools in the Walukuba area.  For the past two years we've been working with students and teachers to complement the government education by teaching a purposely disruptive, unconventional and unexpected set of lessons, helping to introduce and develop critical and creative thinking skills lacking in the traditional rote learning style of repeating and memorizing.
With our program, students now are taught vital skills to gather basic information instead of expecting to always have it be given, process what it means to them and then form their own perspectives, points-of-view and begin to question the status quo.
This campaign will help to fund our Creative Thinking Program costs for over 1200 students for 2016 and into the following year.  We hate to put a cost per student, but when you can work with almost 1000 students a year for under $800, that proves the program is not only highly effective in improving students' learning, but also cost-efficient.
  What We Need & What You Get Here's what the money goes towards:  All funding will go directly to our Creative Thinking Program, first for all in-class materials and transportation to lessons.  This includes any lesson materials, printing or incentives (stickers work wonders).
Next up is for our Teacher Training Program, where we introduce the teachers to our curriculum and how they may be able to introduce those same skills within their lessons.  We do at least 3 training sessions per year, with attendees increasing each session.
 
Now here's what we can give you for your support;
 The knowledge that every penny you donate is used effectively and responsibly.  You are quite literally improving the life of a new student with each dollar you donate.

Not enough?  Any donation over $20 will also get a personal hand-written thank you letter from the Bulungi Team and a shout-out on our social pages (if you want that).

Any donation over $50 gets the same as above, plus a printed photo from our uniquely disruptive Creative Thinking Program classes.

For those of you making the big splash of $100 or more, you get the above and a phone call from one of our team to personally thank you (remember to put your number or skype handle in the comments if you'd like us to ring you).

We'd give you more, but it all goes to the program.
    The Impact It's more than just lessons in class.  Supporting Bulungi supports the following as welll:  Equipping young students (grades 2 through 7) with skills to question and change everything in their lives will lead to positive change throughout the country.  As you solve for education, you solve for an entire generation of young men and women ready to take on all problems facing the country.
Building confidence in students who may not fit within the traditional learning styles.  We often find that some of the weaker students connect best with our lessons because of the unconventional approach.
Supporting Walukuba village.  We have an incredible team in country, and that team works with some of the most passionate, dedicated and unselfish teachers, headmistresses and volunteers that we've ever encountered.  By supporting us you're supporting them.

   Other Ways You Can Help If you're not able to spare a few dollars this holiday season, you can help us immensely by:    Sharing this campaign to your network of donors, friends and family to support the work that Bulungi Creative has been doing with our schools.  (Indiegogo has some pretty great sharing options)

Looking into what we do and contacting us to see how you may be able to work with and for us towards raising our fundraising objective.

Instagram: @bulungigrams

story:
The Farm on Wheels Project

At Prairie Urban Farm we’ve been growing food and teaching people about urban agriculture because we believe that fixing our food system starts with communities.


We love what we do, but it’s tough to grow crops and provide programs in winter. Now is the time to try something radical! 

We think food insecurity is a big deal

Last year we started asking how we could have more impact in Edmonton, and the answer we received was to help schools.

We asked teachers what it would take to get their students growing.  They said they needed training, teaching resources, and inexpensive, classroom-scale technologies that students could build and operate themselves.  So we began designing a program to enable teachers to grow food in their classrooms.

Children are the most vulnerable to food insecurity, and our best hope for change.

Addressing the issue of food insecurity requires a shift in thinking. We need to see ourselves as meaningful contributors, producers, and consumers within our food system.

To do this, we need to make urban agriculture accessible by providing practical solutions that we can use in schools and communities.

Prairie Urban Farm, an urban agriculture education and outreach centre located south of the University of Alberta, is going to take a big step towards tackling these hurdles, and increasing Edmonton’s awareness about urban agriculture, with the Farm on Wheels project.

Recent innovations in food production technologies now make it possible to bring the farm right to schools and communities in the heart of the city. 

That’s why Prairie Urban Farm is creating a hands-on, state-of-the-art teaching and outreach facility to show people how to grow food year-round in Edmonton. And the best part: it's mobile. 

Our Farm on Wheels project will convert a 40’ shipping container into a high intensity indoor farm, education centre, and research laboratory that is completely self-contained and can be moved to where it is needed.  


We will provide hands-on training programs and support for teachers wanting to bring food production experiences into the classroom or cafeteria.

At the heart of the program is a hydroponic vertical growing technology that works as a single standalone unit all the way up to a shipping container and greenhouse.

The ZipGrow technology made by Bright Agrotech LLC provides the ideal platform to integrate agriculture into classrooms and schools. It it is easy to use, and scalable; the knowledge and skills required to successfully grow food can be applied to one tower, or many.

It is possible for a group of motivated high school students to operate a shipping container farm and produce tremendous amounts of food. 

Imagine if each school had its own Farm on Wheels.

With your support we can get this project rolling; purchasing materials, growing crops and transforming a shipping container into a 365-day food factory that works in Edmonton’s short growing season.

The Perks

We have put together a number of Perks for this campaign that you can use to support yourself, your family, and your community grow food and help others join the local food movement. 

We're excited about our plantable Thank You card. We get to show you our appreciation for contributing to the campaign, and when you're done admiring your card, you can plant it into a container or garden.

If you don't have a container or garden planned for this season, we've put together a package of resources to make it easy!

We did some research and developed a great introductory webinar that walks you through a number of online resources to plan, design, and prepare your first or next garden.  Everyone that is registered for the downloadable webinar, will also receive digital copies of example garden designs that they can use in their garden or apartment.

For some, knowing which plants to select and where to buy them can be a daunting task in its own right. That's why we selected a number of traditional and exotic heirloom seed varieties from certified seed distributors and hand-made seed packets for your next garden adventure. 

Each Seed Package will contain enough seeds for a standard 4'x4' garden plot. Everyone that receives a Seed Package will also receive a digital copy of the example garden designs.

At the heart of our Perks are the "Sponsor a teacher" and "Sponsor a school" options. The #1 barrier that teachers struggle with is money, so we wanted to make sure that as many teachers as possible can benefit from this campaign. 

By sponsoring a teacher, you ensure that 30 more children in Edmonton are learning how to grow food and how food affects their health. We think that's a big deal.

Everyone who sponsors a teacher will also receive a half-day training at the Farm on Wheels so they can experience Urban Agriculture for themselves.

When you sponsor a school, up to five teachers can participate in our training program and Farm on Wheels will create a beautiful commemorative sign to display at the school.

Every dollar raised goes towards building the Farm on Wheels and developing the teaching resources for teachers.


Why We Need $100,000

The three biggest expenses are: 

  1. purchasing the trailer ($15,000)
  2. converting the shipping container into a food factory ($35,000)
  3. purchasing the farm infrastructure ($30,000)

There are additional costs to: 

  • Produce open-source training materials, lesson plans, and educational resources for teachers that align with existing provincial curricula
  • Deliver teacher training workshops lead by knowledgeable University of Alberta staff and bringing University expertise to schools across Edmonton
  • Create our digital and print marketing so that we can continue to share our message, and
  • Use the IndieGoGo platform.




Our goal is to have the Farm on Wheels ready for production by September 2016.  This pilot project will serve as a template for future farms, an open-source template that others can use and modify to suit their needs.

Join us in fixing the food system in Edmonton by sharing our story and supporting Edmonton teachers who want to get growing in their classrooms. It is time to activate urban agriculture in Edmonton.

If you can contribute through business relationships or skill sets, please contact us to let us know how you’d like to get involved. We are dreaming big and need your passion and interest to make this a reality.


prairieurbanfarm@gmail.com

Farm on Wheels Project page

Make Something Edmonton

Facebook Group

story:
FINAL THANK YOU TO THE WONDERFUL BACKERS OF THE JMK WRITINGS PROJECT

Well, the campaign has ended, and I thank you all for your generosity.  Donations ranged from $1000 to $5 from people around the world.  By country, from highest to lowest, donations came from 15 countries  -- Australia, Japan, UK, USA, Germany, Italy, Brazil, India, Canada, Switzerland, Austria, New Zealand, Belgium, France and South Africa.  Somewhat unexpectedly, the country with the largest number of economists, and presumably the largest number of these interested in Keynes (the USA) came a distant fourth.  

Clearly the total raised fell well short of the target.  The target was set to fund the work for the next 3 years, and in the prior belief that active commitment to the project would be much stronger than it turned out to be.  There were only 55 backers in all.  Some backers have also kindly volunteered their time in helping with editorial tasks such as word processing documents or organising particular volumes.  Many people offered strong verbal support and encouragement or assisted in various other ways, but only backers went the extra step, put their hands in their pockets and offered their labour.  For that, with great respect, I salute you.

However, although the crowdfunding campaign has closed, it is still possible to donate to the project.  This can be done by emailing me at jmkwritingsproject@gmail.com so that I can send you details of how to do so.  If you know of anyone who wanted to make a donation but missed the deadline, or who didn’t know about the project and would still like to contribute, please ask them to contact me as above.

But the most important thing is that the project will continue, even if less rapidly than was anticipated.  It is far too important to fail, and I remain determined to pursue it.  Your money will be spent on document preparation and research assistance so as to complete the opening volumes as soon as possible, with none disbursed on travel and document collection.

Thank you once again.

Have a safe and happy end to the year, and a wonderful 2017.

Rod

(Rod O’Donnell, Sydney)

 

Help the world gain access to ALL the wisdom of one of the commanding intellectuals of the 20th century and one of our greatest economists.

Scattered across several countries, in archives, libraries, and private holdings, lie the documents and papers of one of the most influential people of the 20th century, John Maynard Keynes. He was an intellectual giant whose theoretical and practical contributions are still enormously relevant in the 21st century.  Right now, nobody in the world has a complete catalogue of his writings, and unless you already know that a document exists, where it is, and can get to it, you have no chance of learning about its relevance to the ideas and wisdom of this fascinating and central figure. Indeed, some documents have been seen by only a handful of people since he wrote them.


This needs to change.  Together we can do it.

My name is Rod O’Donnell, Professor of Economics at the University of Technology Sydney in Australia. With undergraduate degrees in economics, philosophy and engineering, and a PhD on Keynes from Cambridge University, UK, I have spent more than forty years as a close student of Keynes’s ideas and published widely on all aspects of his thought.

During that time it became apparent, to me and other similarly-motivated scholars, that huge quantities of significant writings by Keynes still remain unpublished.  Due to its narrow terms of reference and the very small number of consulted archives, the Royal Economic Society edition of 1971-89 left untouched, unexplored and unpublished vast swathes of academically significant material.  Now scattered across about 60 archives in 6 countries, these writings cover not only Keynes’s myriad activities as an academic, public servant and private person but also his vital contributions to the disciplines of economics, philosophy and politics in which he sought to deepen our understandings of the nature and possibilities of the world.  This is especially the case in economics where he developed a revolutionary new theory which, being based on  realistic rather than fictional assumptions, provided a much better account of the operation of market economies.  This theory remains as a central alternative to modern mainstream economics, the failures of which again became dramatically evident in the 2007-08 crisis and its continuing aftermath.

If we are to understand Keynes’s contributions fully, we need access to all his significant writings.  This is the aim of my JMK Writings Project – to make all his writings accessible to the world.  Without their publication, much of his wisdom will be lost, probably forever, and that would be a tragedy for civilised societies everywhere. 

 

Why I need your help

The project has been underway for several years. Previously it has been largely funded by grants from the Australian Government (as well as one or two much smaller non-government grants).  Such grants are never sufficient, however, and with success rates around 20% cannot provide secure, continuous support.  Further, in recent times, the criteria used in allocating funding for economic research in Australia have moved sharply away from this kind of fundamental research towards journal publications, with the result that no government funding will be available next year and no such funding is likely in subsequent years. An absence of funds will stop the project in its tracks which is why I have turned to crowdfunding to obtain the resources necessary to continue the project in an uninterrupted and timely manner.

 

This Crowdfunding campaign

The present Crowdfunding campaign is for Stage 1 of the project. This stage is concerned with the opening volumes of the edition, those dealing with Keynes's formative years at Eton and his early years at Cambridge University, including his first engagement with philosophy.  It is planned for these to be prepared in two batches of about 3 volumes each, one batch dealing with Eton and the other with early Cambridge.  Once these volumes are completed, a Stage 2 campaign will be launched for the next group of volumes, and so on.

The stipulated target for this campaign is USD$150,000.  Three key considerations have informed this choice.  One is that it keeps the project on track for 18 months to 2 years to finalise the Eton-related batch of volumes; these contain much new, important material that the world has not yet seen.  But this amount is not enough to finalise all the volumes in Stage 1.  The reason a higher amount hasn’t been stipulated lies in the second consideration. Under the Crowdfunding rules applicable to our campaign, donated funds must reach the stipulated target within 60 days from the launch date to enable the campaign to continue receiving funds after the 60 days.  Thus it becomes inadvisable to set too high a stipulated target, even when funds in excess of the stipulated target are actually required. Finally, the target is greater than USD$100,000, the amount that, at no cost to this campaign and with publisher cooperation, will allow one free online subscription for the full edition to a university in a developing country.  For each additional USD$100,000 thereafter, it is intended to donate another free online subscription. For more information on this, see our Questions and Answers document at https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8625ZYgm1ogc0I4QXZ2U1A0OVU.

However, a more realistic amount that will enable completion of both batches (including the second batch of early Cambridge volumes) is USD$250,000. This figure would also allow two universities in developing countries to receive free online subscriptions.  So, assuming we reach the stipulated target within 60 days, please keep making donations beyond this amount and beyond this time so that all the volumes in Stage 1 can be completed.  Our intention is that the campaign will remain open until Stage 1 is finalised.  And it will always be the case that any funds unspent in one stage will carry over to the next.

Also, please note that all payments can be made only by credit card and only in US dollars (USD).  As explained in the Questions and Answers document, this requirement follows from constraints originating in the relevant Crowdfunding rules. 

 

How donated funds will be spent

1. Research Assistance

(a) A chief researcher and project manager, employed on annual contract. This is Kathy Watson’s job.

(b) A junior research assistant, employed on a casual basis. This is Jimmy Bennet’s job.

Research assistance expenditure constitutes about 80-85% of funds.

2. Document collection

This encompasses travel to archives and private holdings to inspect their contents, and copy all relevant and significant documents for the edition.

(a) Travel by myself for inspection and copying of material.  These trips, usually of 14-16 days duration, are very time-intensive and highly focused in exploring, evaluating and collecting as much material as possible in the time. 

(b) Travel by selected Keynes scholars who are geographically closer to the archive in question, possess archival experience, and act under my guidance.

This item, which only includes travel expenses and not salary or wage income, comprises about 15% of funds.

In addition, smaller sums of money will be spent to expedite the preparation of the edition, including photocopying expenses when photography is not permitted in an archive, purchases of any government documents that assist, especially in regard to personal details that might help track down missing or additional papers, and the translation of passages of Latin and Greek.  This item is less than 1% of funding.

 

A multi-disciplinary figure

Keynes’s writings are not just focused on economic and financial matters. Philosophy, politics, history, social policy, the arts, and visions for the future are also important subjects in his writings. The edition will thus facilitate more informed research in all these other disciplines.  He made pioneering contributions to the philosophy of probability, and advanced a political philosophy seeking to combine progressive forces (though not revolutionary ones).  Not only did he help make history, but he was always conscious of its central role in the development of ideas and current events. He also contributed, directly and indirectly, to many social policy advances that promoted greater social justice, and he was passionate about supporting all fields in the arts. 

 

Other ways you can help

There are other ways in which you can help the JMK Writings Project:

·  Everyone −Spread the word.  Tell people you know who might be interested about the project, such as friends, students, colleagues, businesspeople, policy-makers, philanthropists etc.  And like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JMK-Writings-Project-621795491315694/

·  Teachers – whether at university or high school, you might organise a class donation of small individual contributions (with a possible ‘perk’ to be won).

·  Keynes scholars and archivists – please keep an eye out for documents relevant to the edition from any period in Keynes’s life.  I don’t have complete knowledge of the contents of all archives, and there are certainly some holdings of which I am unaware such as any collections in some non-English speaking countries.  If you have come across documents outside the big or relatively well-known archives, please send an email to jmkwritingsproject@gmail.com, even if you think I might already know about them.

·  Academics – if you would like to contribute in some way to the editorial process, please contact me with suggestions.  Such contributions could include being an editor of an individual volume (either alone or in partnership with another person including myself), or assisting in the preparation of a major series of documents for any volume.  These can be future volumes, not necessarily those under current preparation. For this, you don’t necessarily need an economics background.  Your skills as a philosopher, political scientist or historian, for example, might be just what is needed.  All such assistance will be fully acknowledged in the usual ways. 

 

Every donation, of every size, will make a difference

For further information about the edition and campaign, see Questions and Answers at https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8625ZYgm1ogc0I4QXZ2U1A0OVU.

Please help us ensure that:

 

                                             In the long run, JMK lives.

 

 

Notes

1. I thank Andy Diep, one of my former students, for making the campaign video free of charge. 

2. Images used in the campaign video, other than original images, are in the public domain or licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic, Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported, Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivs 2.0 Generic licenses.
