This figure would also allow two universities in developing countries to receive free online subscriptions.  So, assuming we reach the stipulated target within 60 days, please keep making donations beyond this amount and beyond this time so that all the volumes in Stage 1 can be completed.  Our intention is that the campaign will remain open until Stage 1 is finalised.  And it will always be the case that any funds unspent in one stage will carry over to the next.Also, please note that all payments can be made only by credit card and only in US dollars (USD).  As explained in the Questions and Answers document, this requirement follows from constraints originating in the relevant Crowdfunding rules.  How donated funds will be spent 1. Research Assistance(a) A chief researcher and project manager, employed on annual contract. This is Kathy Watson’s job.(b) A junior research assistant, employed on a casual basis. This is Jimmy Bennet’s job.Research assistance expenditure constitutes about 80-85% of funds.2. Document collection This encompasses travel to archives and private holdings to inspect their contents, and copy all relevant and significant documents for the edition.(a) Travel by myself for inspection and copying of material.  These trips, usually of 14-16 days duration, are very time-intensive and highly focused in exploring, evaluating and collecting as much material as possible in the time. (b) Travel by selected Keynes scholars who are geographically closer to the archive in question, possess archival experience, and act under my guidance.This item, which only includes travel expenses and not salary or wage income, comprises about 15% of funds.In addition, smaller sums of money will be spent to expedite the preparation of the edition, including photocopying expenses when photography is not permitted in an archive, purchases of any government documents that assist, especially in regard to personal details that might help track down missing or additional papers, and the translation of passages of Latin and Greek.  This item is less than 1% of funding. A multi-disciplinary figureKeynes’s writings are not just focused on economic and financial matters. Philosophy, politics, history, social policy, the arts, and visions for the future are also important subjects in his writings. The edition will thus facilitate more informed research in all these other disciplines.  He made pioneering contributions to the philosophy of probability, and advanced a political philosophy seeking to combine progressive forces (though not revolutionary ones).  Not only did he help make history, but he was always conscious of its central role in the development of ideas and current events. He also contributed, directly and indirectly, to many social policy advances that promoted greater social justice, and he was passionate about supporting all fields in the arts.  Other ways you can helpThere are other ways in which you can help the JMK Writings Project:·  Everyone −Spread the word.  Tell people you know who might be interested about the project, such as friends, students, colleagues, businesspeople, policy-makers, philanthropists etc.  And like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JMK-Writings-Project-621795491315694/·  Teachers – whether at university or high school, you might organise a class donation of small individual contributions (with a possible ‘perk’ to be won).·  Keynes scholars and archivists – please keep an eye out for documents relevant to the edition from any period in Keynes’s life.  I don’t have complete knowledge of the contents of all archives, and there are certainly some holdings of which I am unaware such as any collections in some non-English speaking countries.  If you have come across documents outside the big or relatively well-known archives, please send an email to jmkwritingsproject@gmail.com, even if you think I might already know about them.·  Academics – if you would like to contribute in some way to the editorial process, please contact me with suggestions.  Such contributions could include being an editor of an individual volume (either alone or in partnership with another person including myself), or assisting in the preparation of a major series of documents for any volume.  These can be future volumes, not necessarily those under current preparation. For this, you don’t necessarily need an economics background.  Your skills as a philosopher, political scientist or historian, for example, might be just what is needed.  All such assistance will be fully acknowledged in the usual ways.  Every donation, of every size, will make a differenceFor further information about the edition and campaign, see Questions and Answers at https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8625ZYgm1ogc0I4QXZ2U1A0OVU.Please help us ensure that:                                              In the long run, JMK lives.  Notes1. I thank Andy Diep, one of my former students, for making the campaign video free of charge. 2. Images used in the campaign video, other than original images, are in the public domain or licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic, Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported, Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivs 2.0 Generic licenses.

story:
Short Summary

Storiboard Nation is an online network that creates an environment that encourages mentoring and social outreach, in a way where young people can tell their stories (and believe that their voices are heard) and hear stories from adult role models and mentors, that they can relate to and learn from. 

Our company was formed by two passionate individuals, Natasha Foreman Bryant and Markeith Wood, who have a shared vision for how technology can be a valuable resource for connecting our young people with each other and with the adults who want to see them succeed. 

We want to develop our network to work seamlessly both online and through a mobile platform. Many people say that they see Storiboard Nation as a blend of Facebook (social, group interactions), LinkedIn (business and networking), and Instagram (social interaction through picture and video sharing)---but realizing that unlike other platforms, Storiboard is built to promote mentoring and access to positive role models worldwide. 

We want to provide a place for mentoring organizations around the world to bring their mentors and young people, to interact in groups and forums within our network. This is also a great way for mentoring organizations to connect with each other, and for role models to align based on a common goal.

We want to be the one place that young people are cool with their parents, teachers, counselors, and coaches interacting with them online. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to make this happen. We need to raise $10,000 to help offset the costs of development. We have a hardworking team of developers and designers who are committed to this buildout, but this project needs financial support. Thanks to Indiegogo we're able to reach out to the world for support. The great thing about Indiegogo is that we get to keep what we raise even if we don't reach our financial goal. If we don't reach our goal, we will give the funds that we did raise to our developers and designers, because we can entice them with food for only so long.

The ability to build a mobile platform so our current and future members can access and interact with each other from their mobile devices, will be an added benefit, and one that members are passionately requesting. We need to meet the needs of the people we serve, and hope to serve. We need to provide them the features that will make their experience worthwhile. We also want to build a safe and secure online platform that allows us to coordinate seamlessly our security efforts with our 3rd party background screen provider, to help screen all adults who are potential Storiboard Nation members.

Here's a quick summary list of the perks that you will receive for supporting our project:

  • Our smaller supporters receive social media shout-outs thanking them on all of our social networks 
  • Beginning at the $100 support level you begin to also receive Storiboard Nation branded merchandise (see our perks section/page for further details).

  • At the $500 support level you receive merchandise (mug and t-shirt: signed by our team or unsigned) and you're also featured on our corporate website and our network (see our perks section/page for further details)
  • At the $1,000 support level, you will receive merchandise and take part in a video with us, that is shared on all of our social media networks (see our perks section/page for further details).
  • At the $3,000 support level, you receive tons of merchandise that other supporters don't receive (at least not for free), you're permanently featured on our corporate website and network, you're automatically added to our VIP list of insiders who find out what's taking place before the general public, and you will receive an autographed second edition copy of a book written for teens (and adults) by our co-founder, Markeith Wood. (see our perks section/page for further details) 

  • At the $5,000 support level, you far-surpass the other supporters perks, receiving 2 of every piece of merchandise that we have, and to top that off you're listed and acknowledged as one of our Founding Members, AND you will join us via LiveStream when we officially launch so that you're taking part in the celebration in real-time. Lastly, as we roll out new merchandise, you will receive be the first to receive a shipment, and it will be FREE!

The Impact

This project matters because our children and young people matter. For those who don't have a mentor or positive role model in their life, they can finally be connected with one. They can gain access to hundreds of mentoring organizations from around the world, or simply gain access to one person who can open doors of opportunity that they only dreamed about. 

For those who already have access to a mentor (through a traditional mentoring organization or other source), now they have a platform to connect with these role models and mentors daily, throughout the year, even during holidays and school vacations. Storiboard Nation can be one more place for outreach. Why have multiple organizations and groups starting "groups" on social media platforms that were never created for mentoring and youth outreach? Why not bring everyone to the one place that was built to help build up and encourage young people?

Life is about stories...help us share yours on Storiboard Nation!

Risks & Challenges

With all projects, movements, and business endeavors, comes risks and challenges. We foresee the following risks and challenges that could potentially delay or derail our plans:
  • Delays getting our platform built if we don't have the necessary funding to cover development and design costs. 
  • Unifying our platform security level to seamlessly tie into our 3rd party background screener
  • Creating the level of security needed to protect our members privacy
  • Gaining enough support for the project
  • The ability to handle a large inflow of new members, and their tech support needs
We believe that we can counter these risks and challenges by doing the following: 
  • Passionately reaching out to potential supporters to help fund our project, and encouraging them to reach out to their personal and professional networks to do the same.
  • Work with our 3rd party screening company to help us continually test out these features
  • Enlist a group of security professionals and volunteer testers to check our security risks on a consistent basis
  • Using various social media platforms, word-of-mouth, online news outlets, and other sources to let the world know about our project and platform; personally contacting the niche groups that we seek to invite to our platform
  • We're currently outlining our tech support requirements for yields of hundreds, thousands, and hundreds of thousands

Our Team

Storiboard Nation is supported by the whiz design and development trio, David Triplet, Trevor Travers, and Vanessa Razo who are also the brains behind Connoisseur Designs, based in Atlanta, GA. You can see David and Trevor in our promo video (featured on our RocketHub campaign page...they are the two in the "Gen Z" shot). Now let us introduce you to Storiboard Nation co-founders, Markeith Wood and Natasha Foreman Bryant, so you can get a better understanding of why we are so passionate about bringing Storiboard Nation to the world...

MARKEITH
In addition to his work and commitment to Storiboard Nation, Markeith Wood is also a Personal Development Director, Coach, and Speaker for Enough Isn't Enough, a youth empowerment organization based in Atlanta, Georgia. 

As the Co-Founder and CVO of Storiboard Nation, Markeith is the Chief Officer over the Vision and Purpose of Storiboard Nation. He is the person who continues to promote and encourage innovative ideas and a team mindset that aims to push beyond the limits of the status quo---seeing beyond the here and now to tomorrow and beyond.

A native of Newport News, Virginia, Markeith has grown through his life experiences as an athlete, entrepreneur, father, husband, and a musician. Through these chapters in his life he has transformed into a teacher of personal development! Throughout his journey, Markeith, has held an undying passion for mentoring young adults. With the love of music, basketball, success and failure... he has created an impactful program to share his own stories, and stories that have changed him along the way. Young adults who are trying to find themselves in this world, learn how to take control of how they think!  

Markeith is also the author of the book Guide 2 Principles of  Success 4 Us. A book tailored to pre-teens and teens, but valuable to all ages. 

NATASHA
Natasha Foreman Bryant is the Co-Founder and Chief Global Strategist for Storiboard Nation. She's also an Adjunct Professor at two colleges.

​Natasha started her first business at the age of 10, and is extremely passionate about youth entrepreneurship. Natasha has been working with various organizations over the past 20 years to help build, nurture, and support future leaders and entrepreneurs. She also dedicated two years to design, pilot, and build youth entrepreneurship program, HOPE Business In A Box, for global non-profit, Operation HOPE. 
Natasha mentors several young women and men ages 14-34, and works to serve as a sponsor for their future endeavors. Throughout the year you can find Natasha in organizations and classrooms speaking about business, entrepreneurship, intrapreneurship, self-esteem and self-empowerment, financial literacy and dignity, her life story and the challenges she had and still overcomes.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't financially contribute, or your funds are limited (so your contribution is less than you had hoped), you can help us reach our goal by sharing our project with your friends, family, colleagues, and neighbors. Share us on your social media networks and let people know why you're supporting our work. Be sure to give us a shout out on Twitter @StoriboardWorld on Instagram @StoriboardNation and on Facebook: StoriboardNation. Like we said earlier, life is about stories...help us share yours on Storiboard Nation!

story:
Short Summary

"Menstrual Education gives girls in rural communities the building blocks to rebuild their lives and, eventually, their country."

MOHCAM is nonprofit organization which promotes the rights of women and girls who are victims of Gender Base Violence. Mohcam advoctes and fights against all abuses faced  by women and girls. Mohcam empowers victims with Leadership silks which Inspires, transforms, Motivates and Promotes  justice. Mohcam also propagates a culture of peace building in homes and communities . Mohcam works with schools and communities in Cameroon.

The Sanitary Pads Campaign for Underprivileged Girls in rural communities seeks to give the girl child an equal chance to compete and lead a fulfilled life.Girls in Cameroon miss 4 days of school per month on average when they are menstruating due to a lack of menstrual hygiene knowledge and resources.They are pulled out of school, married early, and are more likely to be subjected to violence.

They are faced with teenage pregnancies,and are highly  exposed to infectious diseases like HIV/AIDS. 5.7% school girls get pregnant at the age of 15-19. Contraceptive usage among adolescent is 12.2%, Girls in rural communities also have less opportunity to be educated, are more at risk of gender-based violence, breast ironing and they are faced with greater risk of economic and sexual exploitation. These challenges and other obnoxious cultural taboos as concerns menstruation negatively affect the admission and retention of girls in schools.


With your Sanitary Pads donations girls in rural communities will become more confident,will have a  high self-esteem, and this will reduce shame about puberty and their bodies. Mohcam believes that your donations will increase school attendance rates and will improve girls' quality of education, and by effect, their economic opportunities.


The Sanitary pads campaign is aimed at donating sanitary pads to 5Million underprivileged girls by 2020

-  Improve school attendance among rural girls
-Provide rural girls with sustanible sanitary pads and comprehensive menstrual education
- Increase the self-esteem and creativity of rural girls to fight against poverty
The Sanitary Pads Campaign targets school-going girls from rural communities.

Mohcam is raising funds to distribute free sanitary pads and Mohcam's health magazine to all underprivileged girls in rural communities in Cameroon.

story:
The Danish Church in London

Welcome to The Danish Church’s Crowdfunding site.

There has been a Danish Church in London since 1692, and since 1952 the beautiful St Katharine’s Church in Regent’s Park has been the Danish congregation’s home. Today the Church is more in demand than ever. Every year thousands of Danes and all nationals with an interest in Danes and Denmark, gather at St Katharine’s for religious, cultural and social events.

Why

The Danish Church in London is a privately funded church and does not receive funding from the Danish State or the Danish Church. Apart from the pastor’s salary, which is financed by the Danish Church Abroad/Danish Seamen's Church, we rely entirely on the income from membership fees, fundraising, collections and gifts. The number of people who benefit from the Danish Church’s work far exceeds the number of people who are paying members.

We welcome and pay great attention to people from all walks of life.

Your donation will help future generations of Danes in London keep in touch with their Danish language and culture.

The project


The Church urgently needs more space for activities and a comprehensive refurbishment. A project to meet these demands has been designed by C.F. Møller Architects, London. 50 percent of the project cost is being donated by the A.P. Møller Foundation, and in addition, the Danish Church is honoured to have received support from The Queen Margrethe’s and Prince Henrik’s Foundation. We are pleased to announce that Pandora was the first Danish Company in London to
launch their support to the building project.

Check out the Official Fundraising website here about the building project and the various ways we are looking to raise funds. 

We need you and all donations are welcome whether you are Danish or not, whether you live in London or not.

Every Pound Counts

  • We need a total of £2.5m to complete the refurbishment and extension. With the 50% covered through one major pledge by the AP Møller Foundation we in effect are looking for £1.25m - check how far we are here.  
  • All funds will go to this project. Should we not get to our Crowdfunding goal here, we will keep on fundraising directly to get to the goal - your money will not be wasted.
  • You can also donate directly to the Church and we benefit extra from reclaiming the tax. As a UK Registered Charity we can reclaim the tax element on donations through the GiftAid scheme, for UK tax paying individuals. Contact us for details.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with funds, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word and make some noise about our campaign. Why not use the share tools on this site to Facebook, twitter etc.
  • Take part in the Church’s activities.
  • Become a member of the Church

And that's all there is to it.

since 1692, and since 1952 the beautiful St Katharine’s Church in

We need you and all donations are welcome whether you are Danish or not, whether you live in London or not. 
Every Pound Counts 



We need a total of £2.5m to complete the refurbishment and extension. With the 50% covered through one major pledge by the AP Møller Foundation we in effect are looking for £1.25m - check how far we are here.   
All funds will go to this project. Should we not get to our 
Crowdfunding goal here, we will keep on fundraising directly to get to 
the goal - your money will not be wasted. 

You can also donate directly to the Church and we benefit extra from reclaiming the tax. As a UK Registered Charity we can reclaim the tax element on donations through the GiftAid scheme, for UK tax paying individuals. Contact us for details. 



 Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute with funds, that doesn't mean you can't help:  Please spread the word and make some noise about our campaign. Why not use the share tools on this site to Facebook, twitter etc. 

Take part in the Church’s activities.
Become a member of the Church 

  And that's all there is to it.

story:
I am the faculty advisor to the SHSID History Club. We are an international school located on a historical site in SW Shanghai, China/  When I arrived at SHSID in 2008 I had no idea my school’s campus was the former site of the WWII Lunghwa internment camp.  I read ‘Empire of the Sun’ in the US before I came to Asia and briefly met J.G. Ballard in San Francisco at a book signing.  Before coming to China I taught English in Osaka, Japan working on various WWII related research projects in between my day-to-day teaching.

The app began as a student History Club project with two 9th graders Cheryl and Ruby providing much of the content and a programmer they recruited from the school computer club, Brian.  Together we got the app to the level where we realized we needed to give it to a professional app technician in order to publish it.  We also realized that to convert the android files to iOS and make a version for Apple iPads we would need a professional’s expertise as well.  Thus, our appeal to you.

We first asked our school administration for help but we hit a brick wall.  Our institution is a Chinese elite state school with a international division where I work.  All our superiors are members of the ruling CCP which looks upon the history of the Lunghwa with a certain ambivalence.  As it is the story of the Japanese treating colonial era Western residents of Shanghai with a certain amount of humanity, it does not fit into the approved narrative of the Red Army liberating China.  There are a few references to the camp in our official history, but no plaques nor monuments on campus.  There is concern that the remaining original buildings might someday be demolished so we are working on the project with utmost speed.

We need about 13-15 hours of professional programming work to make the app complete in working order, ready to distribute.  The estimate is $1500 USD.  We have a sympathetic programmer ready to give us the lowest possible rate for labor.

By funding our app you would help make the legacy of Lunghwa C.A.C. permanent.  Users of the app would get a virtual tour of the campus, read the inside story of the Dining Hall, Assembly Centre, the guards’ and commandants barracks, and D, E, and F Blocks.  They would hear the sound bites from Ms. Betty Barr, the last surviving internee still living in Shanghai, now nearly 90 years old.  We could also consider being able to fund an Apple iOS version as well as Chinese translated app.

We have received messages of support from other Lunghwa survivors who would like to tell the story of their camp experience to their children and grandchildren and would be happy to use our app to do so.

All contributors would receive a beta version of the app.  Larger contributors over $100 will receive a personal guided tour of the SHSID campus by the faculty advisor and the students in the History Club when they come to Shanghai.

Please help preserve our school’s unique and make history yourself!  Share our Indygogo appeal with any interested person you know.  Thank you.

Sven A.Serrano

story:
Think Bill Nye, but a lady.

It’s time we gave girls a female science role model in mainstream science media.

Hi, I’m Sophie. I am a science educator, actor, comedian, and general goofball. I hold degrees in Behavioral Neuroscience and Theatre, and have spent about half of my life blending the two fields. I’ve worked in research labs, clinical research hospitals, autism spectrum integrated classrooms, and some of the best science museums in the country (looking at you, Museum of Science, Boston, and Museum of Science and Industry, Chicago). As a performer, I’ve played on stages and screens in Chicago and Boston, including the Second City Training Center’s Musical House Ensemble.

Now I’ve combined these fields to create Science with Sophie, a science comedy show for girls.

 

Working in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math), there’s a clear problem: We don’t have enough women. The National Science Foundation reports that women make up only 30% of STEM professionals in the United States.

Not only is this true in the lab, the hospital, or the science museum, it’s reflected in the media we watch every day. I’ve noticed it since I was a child, and it hasn’t changed. If I notice it, other women and girls notice too.

When I was growing up, I had some really stellar children’s programming to enjoy and learn from. The problem: the hosts of these science shows were all men. The closest thing I had to a female role model in science was Miss Frizzle from The Magic School Bus, and she was a cartoon.

 

It’s been more than two decades since the wonderful show Bill Nye the Science Guy first aired. In over twenty years of stellar educational television, we have yet to see a strong female science role model with substantial reach. Together, we can change that.

Science with Sophie is my solution to this serious problem. It’s a fun, fast-paced, upbeat science show that uses comedy and a female host to inspire girls to do science every day.

A little more about the show

Sophie Science hosts the series. She is bright, fun, and ready for anything. The audience will join her on adventures around the city, showing girls that there is science all around them; whether they’re on a street, in a park, at home, or on a bus, science is everywhere! Together, Sophie and the girls watching do experiments that use materials found around the house, so anyone and everyone can try something new. Episodes include experiments, recurring segments, different genres, songs, behind-the-scenes peeks at cool science jobs, and more!

Along the way, we meet Sophie’s wacky cast of characters: a super-buff water molecule, a skeptical microscope, a loving Mother Earth, and a rapping brain, to name a few. The whole gang will encourage girls that they can be anything they want to be.

Sophie Science also interviews experts in all kinds of surprising science careers. The show highlights how diverse STEM careers can be: the jobs, and the incredible women doing them. Science with Sophie also features field-report-style interviews with kids about all kinds of science topics. It’s a fast-paced, fun-filled, joyful exploration of the world around us, with every discovery leading to a new question, a new idea, and a new episode.

The Creative Team

The all-female writing team is comprised of scientists, educators, child development specialists, and comedians. The team spans Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, Boston and Alaska.

We have a talented crew ready to go: a production company, musicians, sets, designers and more. Now we need YOU!

Funding the Fun

Our immediate goal is to raise enough money to get this series off the ground. One year of funding will support the show’s pilot season and help get Science With Sophie in front of girls across the country.

Here are some of the things we need money for:

  • Equipment  rentals
  • Locations and sets
  • Transportation
  • Travel costs to interview STEM experts
  • Lighting
  • Sound
  • Props and wardrobe
  • Insurance and legal
  • Pre-production
  • Actually filming the episodes
  • Stipends for the writing team and crew - it’s important to pay artists for their work!
  • Food for hungry staff during 12-hour shoots
  • Post-production

But the show is just the beginning. With enough support, Science with Sophie can expand to curriculum development, after-school programs, online resources, and so much more.

“When can I see the show?”

Early 2017! Stay tuned for channel/internet release updates.

Material Science (...the perks)

We're excited about all the perks offered, but I want to call out a few:

Want a personalized science song, or an answer to a science question you’ve always had? Get them made-to-order by Sophie Science! I, Sophie, will write you (or a kid you know) a mini song about a science topic of your choice, or make a customized video just for you.

I work at the largest science center in the Western Hemisphere: the Museum of Science and Industry in Chicago, Illinois. You and five guests can explore the over 14 acres of exhibits and get a behind-the-scenes tour with Sophie Science.

Science with Sophie is all about showcasing amazing women. We commissioned a campaign-exclusive poster from registered nurse and artist Bridget Maley. The poster features a quote from the show and looks stunning on any wall.

Even More Evidence

Educational television has the power to create memories, foster relationships, inspire, and set examples for millions of people across the globe. I want to use that scope to show girls people who look and sound like them, and ignite their internal fire to become the future female scientists we need.

Girls are naturally curious, inquisitive, brave, and thoughtful. Science With Sophie is designed to remind them that they are all of those things, even when they might hear otherwise. Girls are everything they need to be, and they are scientists.

Exposure to scientific thought and engineering practices can help girls be more responsible and productive global citizens, no matter what career path they choose. How would the world be different if politicians solved problems like engineers? How would society change if businesses thought like scientists? How would a girl be inspired if she saw a smart, strong, fun woman doing science on TV?

Let's Make It Happen

The time is now, the place is here, the support is you.  Every donation helps make Science with Sophie a reality. Let’s give today’s girls a platform to flourish as tomorrow’s scientists, engineers, and world changers.

Check out the perks to find the one that’s right for you. If you aren’t able to contribute dollars, you can help tremendously by sharing this page with your own network! Spread the word on Facebook, Instagram, email, with actual face-to-face conversations, through sidewalk chalk… feel free to get creative, scientist. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary.

We are a husband and wife couple.

We introduced aquaponics in Uganda more than 4 years ago and have trained > 800 Ugandans on our demo hands on system. 

We need < $1,500 to start a podcast.  This will be used to propagate the knowledge of enterprise of different projects.  Commercial Aquaponics as a solution to Food Security, urban farming and green jobs in urban areas is one such project.

What is Aquaponics?

Aquaponics is the marriage of aquaculture (raising fish) and hydroponics (soil-less growing of plants) that grows fish and plants together in one integrated symbiotic relationship.  The fish waste provides an organic food source for the growing plants and the plants provide a natural filter to give clean water to the fish to live in.  This is a recirculating system aided by gravity. There are also microbes (nutrifying bacteria) and composting red worms that thrive in the growing media. They do the job of converting the ammonia from the fish waste first into nitrites, then into nitrates and the solids into vermicompost that are food for the plants.


In combining both systems aquaponics capitalizes on the benefits and eliminates the drawbacks of each.

Aquaponics is the ideal answer to a fish farmers problem of disposing of nutrient rich water and a hydroponic growers need for nutrient rich water.  


Some Aquaponic systems advantages

  • Crops grow 2-3 times faster than traditional soil based agriculture.
  • Fish and plants can be grown year-round to provide a healthy food.
  • As a sustainable agriculture, aquaponics can grow fish and produce using less than 2 % of the water, and 70-90% less energy than traditional farming,
  • Organic, tasty, nutrient dense, flavor.
  • Saves labor
  • Produces booth fish, vegetables and organic fish fertilizer
  •  Urban farming in your backyard
  • Can construct system using readily available local materials
  • Knowledge available locally
  • No pesticide, No GMO.
  • Ideal Retirement opportunity
  • Green jobs created
  • High market demand
  • Secure systems

Why we need this technology

Developing countries, especially those with large population growth, need aquaponics because It is sustainable, environmentally friendly, provides the cheapest source of high quality, nutritious food - proteins (Fish) and vegetables which reduces malnutrition.  Traditional agriculture is not sustainable.  Urban migration, unemployment, pollution of pesticides, ocean grabbing, reduced arable land, depleted fish stocks, desertification, deforestation etc are some of the problems this technology solves.

The podcast will be about prosperity in various enterprises mainly focusing on agriculture especially aquaponics.

This will help attract entrepreneurs to invest in domestic and commercial aquaponics.

Episodes

Each episodes will be on average 15  -20 min and max 30 Min.  We intend to start with once a week then we become more organized and confident,2 or 3 times a week. 

Art4Prosperity maiden Podcast

This is a sample podcast from our existing equipment.  The sounds need improving for a better presentation.  and of course as i get more experience.

We will be holding one topic per episode and answer questions or conduct interviews live and on skype.  We will discuss a major topic each episode with subtopics to support it.  We will have Q/A part at the end.  At a later date we will conduct interviews with stake holders.   A podcast will help realize the goal of expanding aquaponics in Uganda.

Serious Fish Business

Aquaponics / Fish farming is very lucrative.  The major reason of poor adoption is lack of knowledge.  This is the gap we plan to bridge.  providing complete and comprehensive knowledge about the technical, practical aspect of aquaponics both commercial and hobby.  We will also project commercial viability.

A podcast will do better at spreading aquaponics technology because of wide spread use of mobiles phones.  In the podcast the customer can access the information at any time.  "the infinite dial" unlike a radio or a tv program which once missed may not be telecast again.

A podcast can educate, on aquaponics, DIY courses, exchange between groups of similar interests and have one on one interaction.

Our target audience

  • Urban dwellers,
  • Cooperate community,
  • Young entrepreneurs,
  • Women
  • Elderly.
  • Those planning and already in retirement
  • People with disability
  • Other disadvantaged groups.

Why listed to us

These groups of people will choose to  listed to us because the unique advantage a podcast affords a listener.  Aquaponics is a uniqueness business.  We have >5 years experience on the ground with practical hands-on aquaponics,  We have won 2 CITI bank awards,  We are offering our whole experience with technical training.  Installation service and after sales support especially in marketing of produce are offered.  Africa aquaponics association with more than 300 members and growing is the voice of aquaponics farmers.  This security and assurance of applicability of the technology will encourage entrepreneurs to invest in the business.


Art4Prosperity Podcast.

Information Is key

Information dissemination is a problem with start up and small enterprises.  We believe that podcasting can be used to give the needed information to the community.  This can greatly determine success or failure of an enterprise.  Podcasting is the key and the future. 

The Opportunity.

A pod offers a lot of opportunity in various niches for successful podcast especially for under served industries like fish farming in general and aquaponics in particular.  With podcasting we position ourselves as experts and an authority in the topic under review so that the audience can benefit from our vast experience and that of guests we host on these shows.  This allows us to offer leadership and guidance to upcoming enterprises using our vast experience and the enormous knowledge that such facility can access.

The Impact

Podcast listenership continues to grow worldwide.  Podcasting is the future, with observed migration from AM/FM.  Podcasting is easy to access, you can listed to what you want at any time as you go about your other business and on any devise. 

Risks & Challenges

This is a new technology which has not picked up but many people can adopt if and listed on androids phones, tablets, and their computers. 

We have actually started with a very simple system set up and will grow it as we receive your support.  We will also gain experience and expand listenership.  There is also a lot of information nowadays on the net on the same subject.  Pat Flynn is our role model.   With good equipment, hard work and dedication we are confident we will succeed.

As early adapters we will be able to set the trend and believe we have a good chance.

We can do this with your help.

All we need

If we can get 30 people to donate only $50 each, that is all it would take to improve our internet radio so as to bring about prosperity to under-served communities.


You can help other ways too!

  • Subscribe to the Pod on iTunes
  • Subscribe to our feed on SoundCloudb
  • Subscribe to our Pod on Stitcher
  • Like Our Facebook page
  • Visit our website Art4Prosperity
  • Share this campaign on your favorite social media network

Expected Income is $1,000 per month

This will come from Affiliate marketing, online courses, sale of eBooks, Program sponsorship, advertising and other activities.
story_txt:
Short Summary.We are a husband and wife couple.We introduced aquaponics in Uganda more than 4 years ago and have trained > 800 Ugandans on our demo hands on system. We need < $1,500 to start a podcast.  This will be used to propagate the knowledge of enterprise of different projects.  Commercial Aquaponics as a solution to Food Security, urban farming and green jobs in urban areas is one such project.
What is Aquaponics?
Aquaponics is the marriage of aquaculture (raising fish) and hydroponics (soil-less growing of plants) that grows fish and plants together in one integrated symbiotic relationship.  The fish waste provides an organic food source for the growing plants and the plants provide a natural filter to give clean water to the fish to live in.  This is a recirculating system aided by gravity. There are also microbes (nutrifying bacteria) and composting red worms that thrive in the growing media. They do the job of converting the ammonia from the fish waste first into nitrites, then into nitrates and the solids into vermicompost that are food for the plants.In combining both systems aquaponics capitalizes on the benefits and eliminates the drawbacks of each.Aquaponics is the ideal answer to a fish farmers problem of disposing of nutrient rich water and a hydroponic growers need for nutrient rich water.  Some Aquaponic systems advantages
Crops grow 2-3 times faster than traditional soil based agriculture.

Fish and plants can be grown year-round to provide a healthy food.
As a sustainable agriculture, aquaponics can grow fish and produce using less than 2 % of the water, and 70-90% less energy than traditional farming,
Organic, tasty, nutrient dense, flavor.

Saves labor

Produces booth fish, vegetables and organic fish fertilizer
 Urban farming in your backyard
Can construct system using readily available local materials
Knowledge available locally
No pesticide, No GMO.
Ideal Retirement opportunity
Green jobs created
High market demand
Secure systems

Why we need this technologyDeveloping countries, especially those with large population growth, need aquaponics because It is sustainable, environmentally friendly, provides the cheapest source of high quality, nutritious food - proteins (Fish) and vegetables which reduces malnutrition.  Traditional agriculture is not sustainable.  Urban migration, unemployment, pollution of pesticides, ocean grabbing, reduced arable land, depleted fish stocks, desertification, deforestation etc are some of the problems this technology solves. The podcast will be about prosperity in various enterprises mainly focusing on agriculture especially aquaponics.This will help attract entrepreneurs to invest in domestic and commercial aquaponics.EpisodesEach episodes will be on average 15  -20 min and max 30 Min.  We intend to start with once a week then we become more organized and confident,2 or 3 times a week.  Art4Prosperity maiden PodcastThis is a sample podcast from our existing equipment.  The sounds need improving for a better presentation.  and of course as i get more experience.We will be holding one topic per episode and answer questions or conduct interviews live and on skype.  We will discuss a major topic each episode with subtopics to support it.  We will have Q/A part at the end.  At a later date we will conduct interviews with stake holders.   A podcast will help realize the goal of expanding aquaponics in Uganda.Serious Fish BusinessAquaponics / Fish farming is very lucrative.  The major reason of poor adoption is lack of knowledge.  This is the gap we plan to bridge.  providing complete and comprehensive knowledge about the technical, practical aspect of aquaponics both commercial and hobby.  We will also project commercial viability.A podcast will do better at spreading aquaponics technology because of wide spread use of mobiles phones.  In the podcast the customer can access the information at any time.  "the infinite dial" unlike a radio or a tv program which once missed may not be telecast again.A podcast can educate, on aquaponics, DIY courses, exchange between groups of similar interests and have one on one interaction.Our target audience

Young entrepreneurs,

Elderly. 

Those planning and already in retirement 

People with disability 

Other disadvantaged groups.

story:
My sister and I have a school inherited from our late mother. She created it in 1995 as she was found of teaching and really wanted to give the opportunity to the kids from our local community – kids from poor families – to be able to receive good education.

Our mother passed away in 2008 and my sister and I decided to continue running the school to pursue our mother’s dream and above all, to keep on offering good education to those poor children. Our problem is we are renting the location. And since 2013, we had to move because the owner of the place wanted their land and house back. We now face the same problem as the current owner also wants us to leave.We have looked for another place in the surrounding area to rent but there is any available.

The children really need the school. Their parents were devastated when we announced them that we may have to close the school if we cannot find a solution.

We have to tell you that the parents of these kids pay scholar fees each month. But they can only afford a very small amount of money. This money is mainly used to pay the rent of the location, the salary of the teachers and the electricity bill. There is almost no enough remaining.

As we could not find a place for rent, the solution for us now if we really want to be able to keep on schooling those poor children is to buy a land. But we cannot afford it. That is why we call on you to assist us. Please, help us buy a land so we can keep the school open for those poor kids. Furthermore, if the school owns a land, no-one will be able to kick us out again. 

Thank you so much for your support and please, we would really appreciate if you share this campaign across your social networks and encourage your friends and family to donate.

story:
Short Summary 

Hope for Education and Leadership in Afghanistan (HELA) is the first and only organization in Afghanistan which enhances youth leadership skills through Model United Nations. It’s a non-political and non-profit registered organization in Ministry of Economy I.R.A.

HELA has partnered with THIMUN Qatar, TASMUN Taiwan, the John Boroughs School of America, Online Model United Nations, and Best Delegate, to develop Model United Nations in Afghanistan. Its goals are:

  • Develop Afghan youth leadership skills
  • Enable Afghan youth to think creatively and passionately about the future
  • Create problems-solvers for Afghanistan
  • Provide equal opportunity for males and females in Afghanistan
  • To introduce Afghan talented youth to the world
  • To introduce global culture and issues to Afghan youth
  • To engage Afghan in national and international leadership conferences
  • Finally to create the future leaders of Afghanistan

Through partnership with many international organizations, HELA has been able to engage:

  • Three of our young students in TASMUN conference - March - 2015 
  • One of our young leaders in the  Qatar Leadership Conference (QLC) – October – 2015
  • One of young leaders in THIMUN Qatar Northwestern Film Festival – March – 2015
  • Six Male and Six Female Students leaders in THIMUN Qatar international conference – January – 2016
  • Recently two of our young leaders will attend QLC as presenters – October – 2016
  • Scholarships of THIMUN Qatar international conference – January – 2017

And many more opportunities inside the country, as since establishment of the organization we have promoted Model United Nations in Afghanistan:

  • SKATEISTAN international organization with 20 male and 20 female students
  • Youth union organization with 40 Male and 35 Female students
  • Dawodzai Center – HELA’s main office with 30 Male and 30 Female students

Additionally, we have spread Model United Nation to many other organizations and schools.

Our aim is to take Afghanistan Model United Nations program to each part/corner of Afghanistan and engage Afghan youth from each place of Afghanistan in this project.

The only way to achieve this goal is to hold our first-ever Afghanistan Model United Nations conference for 100 University level students with 50/50 gender representation. This is not possible without financial backing which should cover all expenses for the conference.

Every dollar you donate will help us achieve this goal!

What We Need & What You Get

Please refer to the budget sheet bellow and get to know how your money will be spent:

 

The outcomes of this conference are extremely significant and valuable:

  • 100 Afghan youth will engage in such exciting projects such as MUN, public speaking, and leadership training.
  • We will deliver 100 new male and female youth leaders to Afghanistan and the world
  • Afghan youth will experience for the first time a conference
  • Will enhance their leadership, problem solving, public speaking and debating skills

Impact of the Project:

Model United Nations, also known as Model UN, Mock UN or MUN, is an educational simulation and/or academic competition in which students can learn about diplomacy, international relations, and the United Nations. MUN involves and teaches the indispensable skills of researching, public speaking, debating, and writing, in addition to critical thinking, teamwork, and leadership abilities. Usually an extracurricular activity, some schools also offer MUN as a class. Participants in Model UN conferences, known as delegates, are placed in committees and assigned countries, or occasionally other organizations or political figures, where they represent members of that body. They are presented with their assignments in advance, along with a topic or topics that their committee will discuss. Delegates conduct research before conferences and formulate positions that they will then debate with their fellow delegates in the committee, staying true to the actual position of the member they represent. At the end of a conference, the best-performing delegates in each committee, as well as delegations, are sometimes recognized with awards. MUN exists in more than 100 countries around the world.

AFMUN, or Afghanistan Model United Nations, is the first MUN program in Afghanistan, which was started by HELA. Now HELA is committed to prepare first ever Afghanistan Model United Nations Conference on 26th - 28th October - 2016 in one of the largest universities of Afghanistan. A hundred participants with 50/50 gender representation will attend this conference. 

Our aim is to:

  • Introduce UN procedure to able them to create solutions for problems which currently facing the globe
  • Establish a society free of poverty and discrimination, where there is equality among citizens, citizens’ rights are respected, and they actively participate in the democratic process for establishing those rights
  • Empower youth by providing Model United Nations conference on international level, enhance their awareness on rights, and provide access to resources for their socio-economic benefit
  • Our programs contribute to improve the social, economic and physical resources available to and controlled by a community
  • Advertise STOP illegal Immigration to Afghan youth
  • Create the future leaders of Afghanistan

We believe:

  • In the power of education and the collaborative process of problem solving and consensus building, and seek to foster leadership and positive engagement through discussion and debate of the world’s most pressing problems
  • That there is intrinsic worth in bringing together young people of different backgrounds and ethnicities to lay a foundation for trust and mutual respect
  • That debate, discussion and online collaborative projects are all creative and educationally strong methods to enhance the educational opportunities for Afghan youth.
  • It can best serve youth through a non-political, student led organization that is inclusive of all ethnicities, political views, socio-economic status and genders.  

Risks & Challenges

There are only two challenges to which we need to have a proactive action as bellow:

  1. Financial:

This conference has some costs as (food, transportation, venue, training supplies etc.) which are well explained in the budget sheet above.

Our solution for this was to start an online campaign and ask people from around the globe to help us in this regard and to contribute some money to make this happen!

  1. Security:

The global community is well aware of the current security situation in Afghanistan that; Afghanistan is currently suffering in insecurity and everyday a suicide bombing and side street bombing is happening.

Our solution for this is to:

  • Hold the conference in a very well established university which has tight security.
  • Provide transportation for female students.
  • Provide safe and healthy food for all the participants.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are two other ways besides contributing money:

You can share our campaign link to your friends and relatives

Like our Facebook page and share it with others:

https://www.facebook.com/HELAORG/

story:
Fragmented Reality

The school I'm working at has no extracurricular activities or outlets for the students. They have no sports teams or cheerleading squads, no band or art club, no drama team or any way to express themselves in a healthy way. The school system has very little money, and way less interest in investing in these kinds of things, and the handful teachers who are willing to spend their own time to start these programs face an uphill battle against apathy and degredation, but the worst part of it all is that because of the great distances most kids would have to travel to get to school, many of them stay in on-campus dorms from Monday to Friday. Which means they have a lot of down time, with almost nothing to do.

I want to start an extra curricular art program, I have the teacher support, and necessary skillset, but I need your help to do it. I want to introduce the students to mosaics and provide them with the basic necessities to make their own works of art; something that they can not only be proud of making, but also a healthy outlet of self-expression that they can possibly even sell in the summer when tourists from Santiago and Argentina flood the region.

Hello, my name is Bradley, I'm an aspiring travel writer, and semi professional vagabond. Throughout my travels, I've been constantly astounded, and often left speechless as to the selflessness that many of these people demonstrate by accepting me into their homes, and into their hearts. I have been making mosaic table art by upcycling plastics for almost two years, but I have just recently taken my projects on the road with me. During this time I've been able to share a lot of memories with a lot of fellow world travelers and made some cool stuff with world citizens, now I'm ready to tell the world about it. 

I have been hooked on mosaic artwork ever since I saw the impact Antoni Gaudí had on the landscape and skyline of Barcelona. I dream that one day, my mosaic work will evoke in others the same feelings I felt while staring at La Casa Batlló, or sitting at La Parque Güell. I truly believe that, just like mosaics, we are all differently shaped fragments of reality, and if you are ever able to take a step back, you can truly see the beauty of the bigger picture. 

I am currently working as a volunteer English teacher in a small pueblecito in southern Chile. Teaching has undoubtedly been an incredible experience, and I spend most of my days getting my students to yell, jump around, throw things, and laugh, all within the structure of practicing English. I've thoroughly enjoyed investing my time and energy into these kids and encouraging them to explore a whole new world beyond their customary language boundaries, but the end of the semester will soon be upon us, and much like Mary Poppins, I must leave when the wind changes.

Before I go I want to leave a lasting impact on my students, and I want to introduce to them the beauty of mosaic art, which I hope will not only equip them with an alternate form of artistic expression and income, but will also inspire them to hit the road, and see these works of art for themselves.

What I Need and What You Get

First off, since I am creating my own website, I will only need about one third of the goal amount in order to purchase and construct my web domain. I wasn't planning on asking for this much, but Indiegogo's minimum amount is $500, so I hope to use whatever I have left over after finishing the project I'm currently working on to buy mosaic materials for my students.

Like I said I'm in the middle of another project here in Llifén, but considering how isolated this town is from the rest of the region, it is slightly more difficult to procure the proper materials, and requires a lot of time traveling. I plan on using any remaining funds I have left over to buy the necessary materials and create instructions for students here at Liceo Rural Llifén, so that they can also learn about Gaudí, and continue exploring worlds apart from their own.

The Impact

Contributing to my campaign is about more than upcycling plastic into artwork, or posting long and strange trips written by a wandering vagabond. It's about providing kids from another side of the world with the opportunity to explore an art form that up until now, has previously only existed as an abstraction. When I first heard about Antoni Gaudí, I too was just a high school student, and he was a strange man who made crazy mosaics in a faraway place. Traveling and making something like that was simply an abstract thought in the back of my mind, but years later, when I was standing in front of buildings I had only seen in pictures, I discovered that it was a true passion of mine to travel, and continue exploring mosaic art.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge comes from collecting the materials needed to complete my work. I have discovered that regardless of which country I'm in, none of them use quite the same words, and Chileno is of course no exception, but with each day, I learn a little bit more, and my work still continues. 

Apart from knowing what to ask for, my only other challenge has been the distance traveled to find these materials. Since much of Chile, outside of Santiago, has a much smaller, rural population, some materials are slightly more expensive than expected, but I'm learning where to look, and what to ask for, and so far, I've successfully completed one project, and am halfway through another one. I believe that with your help I can complete the project at hand, as well as finish one or two other pieces before I continue on.

Other ways that you can help

You can also help by spreading the word about this campaign. Share this link with your friends and family to help me get the word out, as well as keep in touch with me through my web site once it's created. I will be accepting all serious commissioned offers, and will continue to plan my future travels accordingly.

Thank you so much for your time, help and consideration!

I truly believe that, just like mosaics, we are all differently shaped fragments of reality, and if you are ever able to take a step back, you can truly see the beauty of the bigger picture. 
I am currently working as a volunteer English teacher in a small pueblecito in southern Chile. Teaching has undoubtedly been an incredible experience, and I spend most of my days getting my students to yell, jump around, throw things, and laugh, all within the structure of practicing English. I've thoroughly enjoyed investing my time and energy into these kids and encouraging them to explore a whole new world beyond their customary language boundaries, but the end of the semester will soon be upon us, and much like Mary Poppins, I must leave when the wind changes.
Before I go I want to leave a lasting impact on my students, and I want to introduce to them the beauty of mosaic art, which I hope will not only equip them with an alternate form of artistic expression and income, but will also inspire them to hit the road, and see these works of art for themselves.

What I Need and What You Get
First off, since I am creating my own website, I will only need about one third of the goal amount in order to purchase and construct my web domain. I wasn't planning on asking for this much, but Indiegogo's minimum amount is $500, so I hope to use whatever I have left over after finishing the project I'm currently working on to buy mosaic materials for my students.
Like I said I'm in the middle of another project here in Llifén, but considering how isolated this town is from the rest of the region, it is slightly more difficult to procure the proper materials, and requires a lot of time traveling. I plan on using any remaining funds I have left over to buy the necessary materials and create instructions for students here at Liceo Rural Llifén, so that they can also learn about Gaudí, and continue exploring worlds apart from their own.

The Impact
Contributing to my campaign is about more than upcycling plastic into artwork, or posting long and strange trips written by a wandering vagabond. It's about providing kids from another side of the world with the opportunity to explore an art form that up until now, has previously only existed as an abstraction. When I first heard about Antoni Gaudí, I too was just a high school student, and he was a strange man who made crazy mosaics in a faraway place. Traveling and making something like that was simply an abstract thought in the back of my mind, but years later, when I was standing in front of buildings I had only seen in pictures, I discovered that it was a true passion of mine to travel, and continue exploring mosaic art.

Risks & Challenges
My biggest challenge comes from collecting the materials needed to complete my work. I have discovered that regardless of which country I'm in, none of them use quite the same words, and Chileno is of course no exception, but with each day, I learn a little bit more, and my work still continues. 
Apart from knowing what to ask for, my only other challenge has been the distance traveled to find these materials. Since much of Chile, outside of Santiago, has a much smaller, rural population, some materials are slightly more expensive than expected, but I'm learning where to look, and what to ask for, and so far, I've successfully completed one project, and am halfway through another one. I believe that with your help I can complete the project at hand, as well as finish one or two other pieces before I continue on.

Other ways that you can help
You can also help by spreading the word about this campaign. Share this link with your friends and family to help me get the word out, as well as keep in touch with me through my web site once it's created. I will be accepting all serious commissioned offers, and will continue to plan my future travels accordingly.
Thank you so much for your time, help and consideration!

story:
My life experiences coupled with the deep compassion I have for people has constantly directed me towards people service. I am passionate about poverty reduction and development issues in Africa. I could easily say that I have occupied many positions within the university (Rhodes University, South Africa) space, such that can be listed as follows:

  1. 2012:      Served at the Rhodes University career and counselling center as a wellness leader.
  2. 2013:      House Committee member in Adamson house at Rhodes University.
  3. 2014:      Employed as a waiter by the Rhodes University Functions Kitchen.
  4. 2014-2015: Sub-warden in Adamson House.
  5. 2015: Law Libriry student assistant
  6. 2015: Registration Assistant, Highway Africa Conference.
  7. 2016: Venue Manager, South African National Science Festival.
  8. 2016: Technical assistant, Rhodes Facilities office.

I could go on but this is not at all important to me. Below is a small description of each activity that I hold dear to my heart solely because of the impact it had on the life of others.

2013: Cite Launch Manager for Galela Amanzi, a community engagement society at Rhodes University. The society seeks to provide rain water tanks to the Grahamstown community that struggles to get clean water, if any at all.

2013: Grade 5 English Language Tutor at Good Shepherd Primary School, Grahamstown. An initiative that sought to help, the grade four pupils at this school, comprehend English language. The subject had proved to be a problem for students at this school, most of whom were either Afrikaans or Xhosa speaking.

2013: Co-founder of a Society at Rhodes University. The society attracts close to 100 students each week. Personal development is an everyday topic within the society and many members up to date have responded to this call. Those who testify have looked for student jobs around campus and use money obtained for diverse development undertakings that range from starting a small business, helping build a home with their parents or take a driver’s licence. Whilst this might seem to be a small impact, it is great for many that partake in this because many of them attest never imagining the person that they have become today.

2015: Jan Smuts Hall Basic need initiative. I am the founder of this Initiative that recognised that many students at Rhodes University did not have a monthly allowance that would afford them basics like toiletry and sanitary used by women. I therefore actively gathered such basics and redistributed them to the needy. 471 students have access to these basic needs and utilise them as anticipated. The initiative was put into place last year but continues to run up to this day in my absence.

2015: The Jan Smuts Hall Mentoring Programme. As founder of the programme I realised that many students at Rhodes University came from public rural school and for most of the time did not understand how university worked. Whilst education was the key to their success, their past disqualified them and many where excluded on academic basis at the end of the year. The Mentoring Programme brought together mentors to mentor and guide first year students who needed help so as to counter academic exclusion. Last Year 116 students signed up for this programme and by end of year we managed to retain 72 students within the programme, a grateful lot some of which became mentors themselves for this year.

2015: HIV and AIDS Peer Educator. Trained and certified by the Rhodes HIV and AIDS office. Work towards creating awareness around this pandemic disease and bust the stigma attached to it.

 2016: Trust Fund: A Trust Fund Through selling cupcakes and sweets, I am founder of a trust fund that hopes to afford pocket money to less privileged students and support entrepreneurial ideals where capital is a strain. The fund is still far off from being financially liquid but a testimony is that we were able to support one student who was in need for 2 months on a weekly basis. I do hope that one day the fund grows and supports many people because the need is great. As a person: I am a motivational speaker, often using my life as evidence to communicate that there is no boundary upon any life that cannot be moved by determination and action towards a brighter day. My conduct in motivation has inspired many to do admirable things that under normal circumstances are impossible given their background.

2016: Student Leader for the 9tenths Mentoring Programme. I lead a team of 14 mentors assigned to mentor grade 12 learners at Marry Waters High School. The programme is Dr Mabizela’s (Rhodes University Vice Chancellor) initiative that seeks to forester academic awareness that will breed excellence and hopefully increase the number of grade 12 pupils that qualify for university at the end of the year in two selected public schools around Grahamstown.

I belief it is these acts that have invited recognition from diverse organization, such including the inclusion in the Investec Rhodes Top 100 in years 2014 and 2015 for general excellence and student leadership respectively, the Mandela Rhodes Scholarship award last year, the recent selection to attend the Brightest Young Minds Summit held in Johannesburg and finally selection to represent my generation at the One Young World Summit in Ottawa Canada, end of September this year.

Attending this summit affords me a chance to meet bright young minds from across the world purposed towards the same goals of creating better societies. I seek to draw inspiration and connect with people furthering the same goal. Because I am a people centred person, my development is a great investment to any community that I may find myself in. 

It is by this that I seek sponsorship for this trip. Whilst many times I am the helper seeking to enhance others, at this time I  the one in search of help.

story:
Mi Gente,

This project supports my travel to participate in a ground breaking conference, http://www.uni-bielefeld.de/ias/blackamericas/ to share and learn and connect with other writers, scholars, activists and artists. As a Black Puerto Rican woman, as a feminist writer, as an educator, as an on the ground activist and community organizer who stands for social justice and for the right to resist and heal from oppression, both individually and collectively, I am keenly aware of the importance of my writing, my voice and the difference I make for people. This project serves the expansion of my writing, performance art and pedagogy; what I have been working on for over 20 years. 

My goal is to raise $1,250.00 to cover expenses. If this amount is exceeded, the surplus will be applied to the completion of my album. (Stay tuned!)

When I was 25 years old, I choose the name Mariposa as my pen and stage name, mostly to remind myself that, no matter what the circumstances, it is possible for us to transform our lives and social condition.

I am on a quest to fulfill my dreams and make a difference with my work, for my community and the world. Your generous contribution is the wind beneath my wings!

    Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • You can help me spread the word! You can also send me love and LIGHT!
    • You can share the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank you so much for your love, encouragement and support and for being a part of my journey!

story:
A Short Summary

As the parents of a teen with ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) we know how difficult it can be to find a place where our kids can have fun with peers with similar interests. A place where they can feel secure, build long-term friendships, and work on social skills at the same time. We think Art is a great vehicle to bring the kids and families together on a regular basis to work on projects, to learn and to interact.  Signing up for a Perk will help us keep Art Club going for the next six months at no cost to the families. And most importantly, it will help make a bunch of kids smile – Thanks for your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Picking a Perk will help cover our location costs, for things like, heat, light, power and insurance; will cover costs incurred to create and produce our funding campaign; help cover modest Instructor & Assistant costs; pay for Art Supplies and other needs ranging from paint, canvas, paper, tools, pencils, markers, drinks, snacks, and more. In addition, your Perk will help pay for Indiegogo fees, processing fees, and finally costs for the Perks themselves!

Here’s how we see it:

Location Costs                                                                $    120

Marketing & Production Costs                                  $    350

Art Supplies                                                                     $    600

Other Supplies                                                                $     180

Instructor & Assistant Costs (6 months)              $  1,200

Perk Costs, Indiegogo & Processing Fees             $     550

CAMPAIGN TOTAL                                                        $ 3,000

We would love to get you one our Perks! 

Everyone getting a Perk will receive a loud  Thank You recording via email from the whole group.  I know you’ll be able to hear the kids and parents’ enthusiasm!! We’ll create a great looking post card featuring some of our art, or a picture of a class and send it to you with a personalized thank you, along with a jpeg art file for you to enjoy, print out, or turn it into a wallpaper background for your computer. 

At higher levels, we’ll create and ship one or more high quality signed prints of an original Art Club work; and at the highest level you’ll get a professionally framed signed original Giclée print that will use fade-resistant, archival inks and archival substrates to ensure that your Art Club original will last.  Please check out the details for each Perk, and again, Thanks!

The Impact

The impact of your Perk really can’t be understated.  Your participation will help give us and the families of Art Club the peace of mind knowing that the program will be there for our kids for at least the next six months without stretching already tight budgets for all of us.  Raising a son or daughter with ASD costs on average $ 11,000 more per year than raising a neuro-typical child; so, every Perk truly helps.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, we really understand watching your finances!  And, we know not everyone can Pick a Perk Today, so if you can’t - Please share the Art Club Campaign with those who you think might want to participate.  In any case, thanks for spreading our story.

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Come back and visit to see how we’re doing!
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Finally, a heart-felt Thank You for taking a few minutes of your time to hear our story and to help us help kids with autism…

Sincerely,

The Art Club Team
