Finally, a heart-felt Thank You for taking a few minutes of your time to hear our story and to help us help kids with autism…
Sincerely,
The Art Club Team

story:
English: https://alaiba.wordpress.com/2018/02/06/we-deci...

Mașinăria de răspândit minciuni în internetul moldovenesc (comentatori, pagini de ”satiră”, bloggeri plătiți, situri de știri false, anonime, etc) a atins dimensiuni periculoase. Această rețea vastă de activiști online, plătiți din corupție și coordonați vizibil, distruge spiritul sănătos al unei dezbateri. Pentru a-și promova stăpânul și partidul care îi plătește, ei atacă, denigrează, divizează și creează ură.

Pe când apar investigații despre ferma de troli a Kremlinului, nu știm mai nimic despre fermele locale de troli.

Prin această campanie, colectăm fonduri să plătim pentru informație oricui o deține (inclusiv, dar nu doar oamenilor din interior), să ne povestească cum funcționează o fermă de troli în Moldova. Vrem să aflăm adresa unde se află, în câte ture lucrează, câți sunt, cum se dau indicații, cum se stabilesc teme, cum se coordonează munca trolilor și a site-urilor false, cum bloggerii „de elită” vânduți primesc ordine despre când și ce informație să publice, cine dă indicații, cum se evaluează munca postacilor, câți trolli sunt în industria asta din Moldova, cât lucrează pe zi, ce salarii primesc, etc. Publicul merită să știe asta.

Ce vrem să facem?

Adunăm o sumă impunătoare de bani și competitivă pe piața onorariilor trolilor. De exemplu, 4000 de dolari. Așteptăm să ne contacteze informatorii. Apoi evaluăm, împreună cu un grup de jurnaliști de investigație, informația pe care ne-o propun și decidem cu ce sumă să îi plătim. Noi doar facem oferta, decizia de a plăti sau nu va fi luată de un grup mai larg.

Informația oferită va fi răspândită de toate instituțiile media independente. Pentru ca oamenii să înțeleagă de ce se fac știri false, de ce sunt răspândite și cine este responsabil de acestea. Trollii sunt plătiți. De aceea vrem să creăm o motivație pentru ei - o confesiune și o recompensă financiară.

De ce?

Să plătești sursele nu este abordare tocmai standard. Este o metodă la care se poate recurge atunci, când interesul public este unul mare, iar alt mod de a obține informația nu există. Informația pe care o căutăm este de interes public major și este un secret foarte bine păzit. O redacție independentă și bine finanțată ar fi extrem de tentată să plătească pentru așa informație. Din păcate, presa noastră abia de are bani pentru chiria oficiului, uneori. De aceea, haideți să îi ajutăm.
Da, în țara noastră sunt multe probleme, mai importante chiar. Dar atunci când există o întreagă industrie a cărei unică misiune este de a ne face să trăim în minciună, primul pas spre rezolvarea acestor probleme este lupta pentru adevăr.
La prima vedere s-ar pare că asta este o mișcare greșită. Realitatea este că această industrie a trollilor se hrănește din bani murdari. Din corupție, delapidări și spălări de bani publici — care sunt cauzele pentru atâtea probleme sociale și de sistem. Este important să dăm o lovitură dureroasă acestei industrii. Împreună. 
Până la urmă, nu este vina acelor copii că au fost atrași într-o rețea ce îi educă să urască. Este vina șefilor lor. Nu trebuie să fim orbiți de ura față de ei. Copiii sunt atrași contra voinței lor, în rețele mult mai periculoase de traficanți de droguri, bande stradale, etc. Ei nu primesc cine știe ce mulți bani, spre deosebire de șefii lor. 


Cum asta va funcționa? 
Noi colectăm banii și așteptăm cineva să ia legătura cu noi. Și ne imaginăm două lucruri:
Cum șefii apasă refresh și devin tot mai paranoici că în curând fermele lor vor fi subiect de știri în momentul ce măcar unul din angajați, cât de mic și neimportant, povestește ceva;
Cum orice trol, remunerat cu câteva mii de lei pe lună, se uită câți bani se acumulează de la oamenii care pun mână de la mână și se gândește, că dacă nu e el, atunci vecinul s-ar putea să ne contacteze azi sau poate mâine. 

Ce informație vrem? 
Nume - cine sunt șefii, cine sunt liderii, cât de sus asta ajunge?
Informație despre structura de management - cum funcționează, cum se coordonează, cum se raportează? 
Date concrete - adrese (unde sunt oficiile - au, nu cumva prin instituții de stat?), cifre (câți oameni sunt, cât primesc, cât timp funcționează, etc)
Multimedia - fotografii din interior, video, audio, orice ar putea fi interesant
Dovezi - acces la adrese de mail cu corespondența despre coordonare și stabilire a agendelor. 
Mărturisiri - oameni reali ce ies public în fața camerelor și povestesc cu ce s-au ocupat. 

În funcție de informația oferită ne angajăm să oferim o recompensă în limita banilor disponibili (informație ce va fi publică)

Ce facem cu informația? 
Toată informația o să o publicăm deschis pentru ca orice jurnalist de investigație să o poată folosi și pentru a depăși granițele Chișinăului și a ajunge la oamenii care sunt afectați de știrile false și de minciuni. 

Dacă ești potențială sursă.
Dacă acum lucrezi, sau ai lucrat ceva timp în urmă în această industrie, contactează-ne. Nu primești cine știe ce bani și te ocupi cu căcaturi. Ajută-ne să aflăm mai multe despre ce se întâmplă în interior. Dacă vrei poți să păstrezi anonimatul, însă vei ajuta mai mult dacă vei face numele public. Tu nu ești vinovat pentru această alegere. Tu pur și simplu căutai să ai un venit. 

Dacă ești potențial donator.
Donează. Vrem să strângem cât mai mulți bani. Probabilitatea că o să reușim să deschidem cuiva gura e cu atât mai mare, cu cât suma adunată va fi mai mare. Probabil oamenii dinăuntru își vor începe a pune întrebări dacă trecem peste 2-3 mii de euro. Este o investiție în presa liberă și o tentativă de a lupta cu minciunile și știrile false. Noi promitem să transmitem actualizări despre colectarea de fonduri, sursele care ne contactează, informația ce o răspândim, rețelele de distribuție a informației etc. Totodată, dacă aveți idei despre o colectare mai eficientă de fonduri, de luptă cu minciunile, de metode prin care să ajungem la mințile oamenilor afectați direct de știrile mincinoase, vă îndemnăm să ne scrieți. Această colectare de fonduri este doar un început, într-o luptă îndelungată cu știrile false, minciunile, trolli plătiți care vor să divizeze societatea și să semene ură. Pentru orice contribuție, vă mulțumim! 

Dacă ești jurnalist
Atunci avem mare nevoie de ajutorul tău pentru a răspândi informația despre această campanie. Vrem să ajungem la cât mai mulți potențiali donatori.

Cum ești protejat?
Motivul din care am făcut această campanie pe Indiegogo este pentru a evita rețelele naționale. E o măsură de precauție pentru a oferi posibilitatea anonimatului pentru cei ce doresc să și-l păstreze, dar vor să doneze. Numele vostru nu va fi dat public. Nu este în interesul nostru. 
De asemenea, de această campanie este legat un cont de card dinafara Moldovei, deci sistemul financiar din Moldova nu are absolut nici o legătură. Băgați niște bani. 10, 20, 30 de euro. Este o investiție în viitorul presei libere. 

Și dacă nu cheltuim toți banii? 
Planul nostru este să asigurăm o așa campanie, încât să convingem nu doar un om să vorbească. O să scoatem informația la lumină și o să remunerăm cât mai multe surse. 
Dacă, totuși, ne rămân bani, o să finanțăm o altă idee similară ce are același scop - lupta cu dezinformarea prin intermediul trollilor politici. 
Spre exemplu, un hackathon dedicat exclusiv subiectului dat. O să mai găsim ceva bani, o să arătăm banii adunați ca și cofinanțare și o să anunțăm un concurs de idei la subiectul dat și vom finanța nu una, ci trei. Toate cheltuielile vor fi transparente și fiecare donator va primi informație despre acestea.
Vă îndemnăm să contribuiți și să distribuiți această campanie. 

Inițiatorii campaniei: 

Dumitru Alaiba

Vlada Ciobanu 

Orice susținere pentru această campanie este importantă. Urmează mai multe activități unde avem nevoie de susținerea voastră. Dacă vreți să faceți parte din echipă, vă îndemnăm să ne contactați.
story_txt: English: https://alaiba.wordpress.com/2018/02/06/we-deci...Mașinăria de răspândit minciuni în internetul moldovenesc (comentatori, pagini de ”satiră”, bloggeri plătiți, situri de știri false, anonime, etc) a atins dimensiuni periculoase. Această rețea vastă de activiști online, plătiți din corupție și coordonați vizibil, distruge spiritul sănătos al unei dezbateri. Pentru a-și promova stăpânul și partidul care îi plătește, ei atacă, denigrează, divizează și creează ură.Pe când apar investigații despre ferma de troli a Kremlinului, nu știm mai nimic despre fermele locale de troli.Prin această campanie, colectăm fonduri să plătim pentru informație oricui o deține (inclusiv, dar nu doar oamenilor din interior), să ne povestească cum funcționează o fermă de troli în Moldova. Vrem să aflăm adresa unde se află, în câte ture lucrează, câți sunt, cum se dau indicații, cum se stabilesc teme, cum se coordonează munca trolilor și a site-urilor false, cum bloggerii „de elită” vânduți primesc ordine despre când și ce informație să publice, cine dă indicații, cum se evaluează munca postacilor, câți trolli sunt în industria asta din Moldova, cât lucrează pe zi, ce salarii primesc, etc. Publicul merită să știe asta.Ce vrem să facem?Adunăm o sumă impunătoare de bani și competitivă pe piața onorariilor trolilor. De exemplu, 4000 de dolari. Așteptăm să ne contacteze informatorii. Apoi evaluăm, împreună cu un grup de jurnaliști de investigație, informația pe care ne-o propun și decidem cu ce sumă să îi plătim. Noi doar facem oferta, decizia de a plăti sau nu va fi luată de un grup mai larg.Informația oferită va fi răspândită de toate instituțiile media independente. Pentru ca oamenii să înțeleagă de ce se fac știri false, de ce sunt răspândite și cine este responsabil de acestea. Trollii sunt plătiți. De aceea vrem să creăm o motivație pentru ei - o confesiune și o recompensă financiară.De ce?Să plătești sursele nu este abordare tocmai standard. Este o metodă la care se poate recurge atunci, când interesul public este unul mare, iar alt mod de a obține informația nu există. Informația pe care o căutăm este de interes public major și este un secret foarte bine păzit. O redacție independentă și bine finanțată ar fi extrem de tentată să plătească pentru așa informație. Din păcate, presa noastră abia de are bani pentru chiria oficiului, uneori. De aceea, haideți să îi ajutăm.Da, în țara noastră sunt multe probleme, mai importante chiar. Dar atunci când există o întreagă industrie a cărei unică misiune este de a ne face să trăim în minciună, primul pas spre rezolvarea acestor probleme este lupta pentru adevăr.La prima vedere s-ar pare că asta este o mișcare greșită. Realitatea este că această industrie a trollilor se hrănește din bani murdari. Din corupție, delapidări și spălări de bani publici — care sunt cauzele pentru atâtea probleme sociale și de sistem. Este important să dăm o lovitură dureroasă acestei industrii. Împreună. Până la urmă, nu este vina acelor copii că au fost atrași într-o rețea ce îi educă să urască. Este vina șefilor lor. Nu trebuie să fim orbiți de ura față de ei. Copiii sunt atrași contra voinței lor, în rețele mult mai periculoase de traficanți de droguri, bande stradale, etc. Ei nu primesc cine știe ce mulți bani, spre deosebire de șefii lor. Cum asta va funcționa? Noi colectăm banii și așteptăm cineva să ia legătura cu noi. Și ne imaginăm două lucruri:Cum șefii apasă refresh și devin tot mai paranoici că în curând fermele lor vor fi subiect de știri în momentul ce măcar unul din angajați, cât de mic și neimportant, povestește ceva;Cum orice trol, remunerat cu câteva mii de lei pe lună, se uită câți bani se acumulează de la oamenii care pun mână de la mână și se gândește, că dacă nu e el, atunci vecinul s-ar putea să ne contacteze azi sau poate mâine. Ce informație vrem? Nume - cine sunt șefii, cine sunt liderii, cât de sus asta ajunge?Informație despre structura de management - cum funcționează, cum se coordonează, cum se raportează? Date concrete - adrese (unde sunt oficiile - au, nu cumva prin instituții de stat?), cifre (câți oameni sunt, cât primesc, cât timp funcționează, etc)Multimedia - fotografii din interior, video, audio, orice ar putea fi interesantDovezi - acces la adrese de mail cu corespondența despre coordonare și stabilire a agendelor. Mărturisiri - oameni reali ce ies public în fața camerelor și povestesc cu ce s-au ocupat. În funcție de informația oferită ne angajăm să oferim o recompensă în limita banilor disponibili (informație ce va fi publică)Ce facem cu informația? Toată informația o să o publicăm deschis pentru ca orice jurnalist de investigație să o poată folosi și pentru a depăși granițele Chișinăului și a ajunge la oamenii care sunt afectați de știrile false și de minciuni. Dacă ești potențială sursă.Dacă acum lucrezi, sau ai lucrat ceva timp în urmă în această industrie, contactează-ne. Nu primești cine știe ce bani și te ocupi cu căcaturi. Ajută-ne să aflăm mai multe despre ce se întâmplă în interior. Dacă vrei poți să păstrezi anonimatul, însă vei ajuta mai mult dacă vei face numele public. Tu nu ești vinovat pentru această alegere. Tu pur și simplu căutai să ai un venit. Dacă ești potențial donator.Donează. Vrem să strângem cât mai mulți bani. Noi promitem să transmitem actualizări despre colectarea de fonduri, sursele care ne contactează, informația ce o răspândim, rețelele de distribuție a informației etc. Totodată, dacă aveți idei despre o colectare mai eficientă de fonduri, de luptă cu minciunile, de metode prin care să ajungem la mințile oamenilor afectați direct de știrile mincinoase, vă îndemnăm să ne scrieți. Această colectare de fonduri este doar un început, într-o luptă îndelungată cu știrile false, minciunile, trolli plătiți care vor să divizeze societatea și să semene ură. Pentru orice contribuție, vă mulțumim! Dacă ești jurnalistAtunci avem mare nevoie de ajutorul tău pentru a răspândi informația despre această campanie. Vrem să ajungem la cât mai mulți potențiali donatori.Cum ești protejat?Motivul din care am făcut această campanie pe Indiegogo este pentru a evita rețelele naționale. E o măsură de precauție pentru a oferi posibilitatea anonimatului pentru cei ce doresc să și-l păstreze, dar vor să doneze. Numele vostru nu va fi dat public. Nu este în interesul nostru. De asemenea, de această campanie este legat un cont de card dinafara Moldovei, deci sistemul financiar din Moldova nu are absolut nici o legătură. Băgați niște bani. 10, 20, 30 de euro. Este o investiție în viitorul presei libere. Și dacă nu cheltuim toți banii? Planul nostru este să asigurăm o așa campanie, încât să convingem nu doar un om să vorbească. O să scoatem informația la lumină și o să remunerăm cât mai multe surse. Dacă, totuși, ne rămân bani, o să finanțăm o altă idee similară ce are același scop - lupta cu dezinformarea prin intermediul trollilor politici. Spre exemplu, un hackathon dedicat exclusiv subiectului dat. O să mai găsim ceva bani, o să arătăm banii adunați ca și cofinanțare și o să anunțăm un concurs de idei la subiectul dat și vom finanța nu una, ci trei. Toate cheltuielile vor fi transparente și fiecare donator va primi informație despre acestea.Vă îndemnăm să contribuiți și să distribuiți această campanie. Inițiatorii campaniei: Dumitru AlaibaVlada Ciobanu Orice susținere pentru această campanie este importantă. Urmează mai multe activități unde avem nevoie de susținerea voastră. Dacă vreți să faceți parte din echipă, vă îndemnăm să ne contactați.

story:
HELLO! HALLO! HOLA!

CIAO! BONJOUR! ВІТАЮ!

I'm Dan. I was made in Ukraine and starting from 18 y.o. dedicated my professional life to advertising.

In 2010 I’ve graduated from the university with a Master’s Degree in Advertising Management & PR. Since then I worked as a creative in such agencies as HAVAS, Publicis, TBWA in Ukraine and in 2015 I’ve joined J. Walter Thompson (JWT) in Baltics, Europe.

Currently, I’m living in Riga (Latvia) and working as a creative head in a new agency called “Addicted”.

Throughout my career in advertising, I’ve done more than 50 TV commercials & 100 radio spots, created numerous ideas for outdoors, press, digital, non-standard advertisements. Some of my works were featured in different advertising festivals, media and blogs, like, Ads of The World, Best Ads on TV, Behance, etc.

In 2016 I’ve decided to improve my professional skills and go back to studies. My first achievement in this direction was a win of 50% discount on a tuition at Miami Ad School Europe.

The School

Miami Ad School is the top advertising school with worldwide locations from Buenos Aires to Sydney.

My choice of location is Berlin where I want to start a Copywriting program next April.

My goal

Studying in Miami Ad School is expensive. A tuition and survival costs are hard to cover only by me. That’s pretty much the main reason I’ve decided to start a campaign on Indiegogo.

I will also need extra funds to cover pre-school expenses, e.g. student visa, insurance and fees, room rent in Berlin, equipment for studies etc.

Please check the breakdown below:

As you can see the total is around 17k. And I want to earn them by offering you my professional services. Plus, some perks were created for those of you who don't need it.

How can I help your own start-up or already running businesses?

I want to put my professional experience, my desire to help and all my energy together and produce creative & effective ideas for you. If your start-up needs a name - hire me by purchasing a pledge with this service. If your start-up needs a launch video idea to hit crowdfunding platforms and landing pages - choose this pledge. Non-standard idea? Non-problems.

Imagine you have a personal creative agency with a direct contact, great responsibility and more than affordable fees. 

FREE BONUSES for every backer!

There are also a few nice and completely free offers for each and every generous baker.

For all the backers from Berlin:

I would love to thank every generous backer from this city with a FREE delicious breakfast cooked by myself. Yeap, I love cooking. 

So, Berliners, don’t hesitate to grab your pledge and then just pick the date/time of the future breakfast! Let's have a 'Bon appetite!' thing together!

For all the backers from abroad:

Generosity shouldn't have any borders, so whenever you guys plan to visit Berlin, I would be glad to host you for a weekend at my apartment.

Before applying to this bonus you can check out my Couchsurfing profile references to assure I’m not a maniac or something :)

https://www.couchsurfing.com/people/abroadan/re...

“Dan, seriously, you want us to help you to learn how to make more annoying s*itty ads?”

No way, guys.

The main reason I want to join the school is to learn how to make BETTER ads. The ads you’ll LOVE. And make this world a little bit better by that.

I’m not talking about “selling it more clever”. I’m talking about TVCs that will make you LOL or OMG and you can’t stand with not to share them with your friends and followers. The Youtube pre-rolls you won’t skip. The prints you’ll snap with your phone. The digital and mobile experiences you will add to your bookmarks and try out again and again. I’m talking about the better advertising that will step into your life.

Wait! What the heck is copywriting anyway?

Copywriters in ad agencies are responsible for creating ideas and writing the advertising texts called a ’copy’. The main task of a copywriter is to tell the story.

Watch this episode from a legendary “The Shawshank Redemption” movie to see the difference between a random copy and a copy with a strong storytelling.

Here’s also an example of a good storytelling in advertising spot.

Storytelling in ads could also be funny, like these series of ads (one of my all time favorites):

So copywriting is an ability to tell stories.

And as you can judge from my post so far, I’m not really good in that. But I want to learn.

Wow! You’re still here?!

I guess that's the end of the story.

Now it's time to pick pledges or make contributions without any purpose.

Hope to hear from you soon and don't hesitate to share this project with your friends - they may need my services as well!

THANK YOU! DANKE! GRACIAS!

GRAZIE! MERCI! ДЯКУЮ!

story:
I found myself in my writing. WBS is like a family… a forever family.

— Bryonna (WBS Alum)

The love of reading -- and writing -- is an incredible gift! Reading is the gateway to deeper understanding and the exploration of new worlds. Learning to express oneself in writing is a profound, life changing experience. Together they have the power to make a student’s life better, both personally and academically.

This holiday season, you can give this precious gift by supporting Writers in Baltimore Schools (WBS). In 2016, generous donations from backers like you helped 200 students, at 5 schools, fall in love with the written word.

Who We Are

Since 2008, WBS has been on a mission to provide Baltimore students with something many of them have never experienced -- a vibrant environment for literary development. WBS engages students through in-school, after-school, and summer creative writing workshops, taught by local writers. Check us out online: facebook.com/WritersinBaltimoreSchools/ and follow us on Twitter: twitter.com/writersinbmore

Why Literature Still Matters (a lot!)

These days everyone is talking about STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math). We agree, STEM is important. But it can’t replace the thought provoking richness of literature. Plus, there is a strong correlation between studying literature and literacy (a big issue in Baltimore, where 38% of residents are functionally illiterate). The National Center for Educational Statistics found that factors improving reading test scores include: home reading encouragement; reading for fun; and analysis and appreciation of literature.

Studies show that the reading assessment scores of low-income Baltimore students drop significantly between grades 5-8. Many low-income students fall further behind in middle school because they lack an environment that values and encourages the development of literacy skills.

But WBS students are bucking this trend!

After one year of instruction, WBS students were 33% more likely to earn “Advanced” scores on reading tests, compared to their peers. WBS students also have had their work published by the Poetry Foundation, Baltimore Sun, the Washington Post, Seltzer Zine, and Real Pants. And WBS students have received full scholarships to attend the prestigious Iowa Young Writers’ Studio and Kenyon Review Young Writers Studio.

Based on our experience of working with more than 700 low-income students in Baltimore, WBS believes that by providing an intensive, participatory program in literary reading and creative writing, our students hone their language skills and enter high school with a renewed interest in literature.

How You Can Help

WBS seeks $10,000 to kick off our 2017 programs at Margaret Brent, Barclay, and Calverton middle schools. All three schools have limited resources and students from primarily  low-income families. With your help, WBS will bring the joy of reading and writing to 150 middle school students, ensuring that they have a strong foundation in these essential skills and a genuine appreciation for literature. These program will get some of our youngest students off to a great start!

Your Donation Will Make a Difference.

By supporting WBS, you join an elite group of backers who are helping to improve the chances of success for many young readers and writers in Baltimore.

WBS has touched the lives of more than 700 low-income students in Baltimore, through 46 in-school courses, 45 after school writing clubs, and 8 multi-day summer programs. WBS has expanded to serve our alumni who are now attending BCPS high schools. Our robust alumni program includes: a student led program called Black Words Matter; the College Bridge Program, which supports students' transition to college through scholarships and college prep seminars; and the Teaching Writing Fellowship, in which promising alumni attend an intensive writing pedagogy seminar. After completion of the seminar, these students are  intern as WBS instructors.

Expanding our programming in 2017 will give the chance to improve the lives of even more young people. 

Visit us online:

Facebook: facebook.com/WritersinBaltimoreSchools

Twitter: twitter.com/writersinbmore

In the news:

Open Society Institute | “Notebooks Full of Beautiful Ideas” (photo essay)

Baltimore Sun | Write-In coverage 

Baltimore Sun | Write-In video coverage

Washington Post | “Why Poor Kids Don’t Stay in College” featuring WBS student Terrell Kellam

National Poetry Foundation | Poem by Jaida Griffin

Washington Post | Black Words Matter poems by Baltimore Students

Many low-income students fall further behind in middle school because they lack an environment that values and encourages the development of literacy skills.But WBS students are bucking this trend!After one year of instruction, WBS students were 33% more likely to earn “Advanced” scores on reading tests, compared to their peers. WBS students also have had their work published by the Poetry Foundation, Baltimore Sun, the Washington Post, Seltzer Zine, and Real Pants. And WBS students have received full scholarships to attend the prestigious Iowa Young Writers’ Studio and Kenyon Review Young Writers Studio.Based on our experience of working with more than 700 low-income students in Baltimore, WBS believes that by providing an intensive, participatory program in literary reading and creative writing, our students hone their language skills and enter high school with a renewed interest in literature.How You Can HelpWBS seeks $10,000 to kick off our 2017 programs at Margaret Brent, Barclay, and Calverton middle schools. All three schools have limited resources and students from primarily  low-income families. With your help, WBS will bring the joy of reading and writing to 150 middle school students, ensuring that they have a strong foundation in these essential skills and a genuine appreciation for literature. These program will get some of our youngest students off to a great start!Your Donation Will Make a Difference.By supporting WBS, you join an elite group of backers who are helping to improve the chances of success for many young readers and writers in Baltimore.WBS has touched the lives of more than 700 low-income students in Baltimore, through 46 in-school courses, 45 after school writing clubs, and 8 multi-day summer programs. WBS has expanded to serve our alumni who are now attending BCPS high schools. Our robust alumni program includes: a student led program called Black Words Matter; the College Bridge Program, which supports students' transition to college through scholarships and college prep seminars; and the Teaching Writing Fellowship, in which promising alumni attend an intensive writing pedagogy seminar. After completion of the seminar, these students are  intern as WBS instructors.Expanding our programming in 2017 will give the chance to improve the lives of even more young people. Visit us online:Facebook: facebook.com/WritersinBaltimoreSchoolsTwitter: twitter.com/writersinbmoreIn the news:Open Society Institute | “Notebooks Full of Beautiful Ideas” (photo essay)Baltimore Sun | Write-In coverage Baltimore Sun | Write-In video coverageWashington Post | “Why Poor Kids Don’t Stay in College” featuring WBS student Terrell KellamNational Poetry Foundation | Poem by Jaida GriffinWashington Post | Black Words Matter poems by Baltimore Students

story:
We're sending 4 inner city youth leaders up the tallest mountain in Africa. 

 
WHAT WE DO. 

Kilimanjaro Initiative USA (KI-USA), is a non-profit providing underserved youth with the opportunities, guidance and tools to reach NEW HEIGHTS.  Every year we sponsor 3-4  NYC youth leaders between the ages of 18-25 on a 3 week leadership program in Africa where the peak activity is to climb Mt. Kilimanjaro.Those selected have demonstrated a commitment to social change and the advancement of themselves and their communities. We seek to expose, challenge and equip them with life lessons that will only serve to amplify their greatness.

WHO WE ARE. 

People who care about advancing talent and igniting hope - one adventure at a time. For 5 years we have made this opportunity accessible to a total of 14 young people. Our dedicated Chairman, Board, their friends, family and colleagues have been supporting KI-USA's efforts since Day One. This year KI-USA is taking it to the next level!  In our first year with nonprofit status we have been working closely with a handful of our former sponsored youth. We hope to continue to expand on our commitment to support them in their growth - both personal and professional.

Meet the board.

For a full history click here.

WHY WE DO THIS.

4 New Heights

4 Hopes

4 Dreams

4 Opportunity

HELP US RAISE $30K! 

4 NEW Youth Leaders | #4NewHeights 

This year we have 4 young people already selected for the 2017 climb and they are extraordinary individuals with amazing promise. Let’s help them reach their full potential.  Every dollar supports each young person, every step of the way. 

Here's Where Your Money is Going....

$10 Fund Snacks for 1 Day!

Starting the climb the right way helps ensure that the team is successful all throughout the trip. With $10, you can sponsor snacks for one young person on one of the seven days that they are journeying up Mount Kilimanjaro!

$25 Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner!

Hey, trainers need to eat too! With $25, you can help provide one full day's worth of food to a trainer or staff member. Our trainers fuel our youth!

$100 Prep and Maintenance!

Each participant receives a year-long membership to the YMCA, to help enhance and build on their current skill set. Additionally, you will be supporting local training opportunities for our participants in broader New York City.

$500 Gear 'em up!

Our youth experience all four seasons while traveling to the top! Your $500 makes sure that they are well prepared for each season. With this contribution, all KI-gear will be provided so that our youth can have the most robust experience possible.

$1,000 Get 'em there!

Many youths who join our program have never even left the country before! Will you help turn their dream of an international trip into a reality? $1000 will support us with flights for at least one young person

$5,000 Get em' to the top!

This level of sponsorship ensures that one young person is fully funded on their 3 weeks in Africa. This covers flights, gear, room and board and everything in between. 

Spread the word

Here are some sample posts to use on social media

  • 4 resilient youth leaders will meet #MtKilimanjaro in March 2017 - with your help. Give #4NewHeights: http://ow.ly/g0cJ306DxFz
  • I support advancing talented and driven #nyc youth - I give for #4NewHeights on #GivingTuesday: http://ow.ly/g0cJ306DxFz
  • Give #4NewHeights on #GivingTuesday and take #nyc youth leaders on a trip of a lifetime: http://ow.ly/g0cJ306DxFz

** ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE* *

story:
MY SELF DESCRIPTION AND BACK GROUND

  My name is Pastor Joshua Laizer, I am 44 years old, born in Naisinyai village, Simanjiro district in Tanzania. I got chance to join evangelical college for four years and served as an evangelist for seven years. Later on I joined the university of Makumira for theology, after my graduation, I was blessed installed  to be a pastor among Maasai society. I have been a pastor for the Maasai in Lutheran church Northern diocese constituency of Siha in Karansi Kilimanjaro.


Co-founder: Pastor Joshua Laiser (Karansi Lutheran Parish in Moshi Tanzania)  

 

Co-founder: Frank Swai

Frank Swai is a co-founder of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting this school came after seen Maasai chidren lacks nearest school where they can attend. Also many Maasai families don't take their children to school as they send them to keep their cows and goats. So we are having a big challenge to educate their parents so that they can allow their children to attend school. We want to help Maasai children to have better education so we hope that you will support these children.

 

MY CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT IS IMPORTANT

I, as pastor of Maasai society where education is of low standard and inadequate, I decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL. Already my school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils and grade two with 35 pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Pupils with their teachers when we started under the tree

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

Pupils with their teachers

 

 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

My future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground;

Seven (7) more classes @ $5000 x 7 =    $35000

Computer room 1......................................= $5000

Thirty (30) computers @ $500 x 30.....=$15000

One office for teachers ..........................=$5000

Kitchen....................................................= $5000

Toilet........................................................= $5000

Library & books......................................= $9000

Well for keeping water(waterhole)........= $3000

Lunch for 100 students  $1000 per month * 12 months =$12,000

Salaries for 4 teachers @ $300 x 12 x 4 = $14400

Tuition fees for 25 students who their parents can not afford to pay for them @ $700 x 25  =$17500

Total Expansions Costs.......................... $125,900

 

THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.

 

 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

story:
About two years ago, Joana faced the story of a young woman left in a wheelchair after falling off a horse. The woman shares in her story all difficulties she faces in her new life, and the biggest one is finding a job that meets her qualifications and abilities before the fall.

After that experience Joana started looking for a place that supports people with different abilities, but unfortunately, there was no specialized organization in Bulgaria dealing with this challenge as a major activity.

Iva Tsolova is the other co-founder of JAMBA - Career for all.

Her story is very similar to Joana's one. Two years ago, Iva started working on a project with a similar idea with a friend, but it was frozen. Shortly thereafter, fate meets the two girls in a non-governmental organization dedicated to providing equal access to information and communication for deaf people. Since then, the two young women have been inseparable, finishing their sentences, supporting themselves, and sharing a common vision of everything they have taken.

A year later, they started the development of JAMBA - an online platform that educates people with different abilities, gives them key competencies and skills and connects them with employers. JAMBA is the supportive and connecting party that gives the candidates (their JAMBA heroes) confidence and also successfully prepares them for the future professional realization.

The platform is a specialized online environment that contains information on various trainings, career opportunities and mass events. In the beginning, JAMBA was an online market place between employers and candidates with different abilities, but after the launch it became clear that all employers insist to have a preliminary meeting with the JAMBA team and this feedback predetermines the shifting focus from an online platform and a dedicated website to offering / looking for job opportunities to a specialized information portal and consultancy services.

story:
Who is Lipa Learning?

Lipa Learning is a passionate international team of educators, researchers, developers and loving parents that dedicates our lives to developing learning apps, games, and interactive books for children, which we design according to our early childhood development program.

Here at Lipa Learning, our mission is to bring quality education to every child around the world. Our educational program promotes harmony between physical and digital learning, while giving children a solid foundation in all areas of life.

 

 

How are we different?

Unlike our competitors, who mostly teach cognitive skills only with their apps, we spent 5 years of research identifying the most widespread educational approaches as points of reference for our own system, which enables us to draw inspiration from truly the best. We even looked at traditional learning methods for insightful approaches.

The backbone of our system is our Curriculum, which consists of 8 comprehensive learning areas divided into several developmental categories that we want every single child to use in their daily life.

 

 

Not only do we translate our program and content into different languages, but we also change it according to different regions to make it culturally inclusive.

We also want to promote a healthy balance between both the digital and physical world. To create this harmony we encourage every child to use the device to get out of the device and become motivated, independent little learners!

 

 

We aim to reach as many children as possible which is why we have translated our learning materials into 22 languages thus far and plan on reaching 50 languages in the long-haul and eventually achieve a worldwide reach.

For little ones who need an extra helping-hand, we’ve created a badge to signify which of our learning materials are suitable for children with Special Needs. Because we believe all kids deserve the opportunity to learn and succeed!

Our Curriculum Design is already in practice in international schools. In 2013, we opened our own Lipa Preschool where we implement our whole system and get feedback directly from the children, who let us know what they need and want.

 

 

 

Why are we here?

 

A child’s early years play a critical role in predicting their future success. But while 38% of kids around the world can’t read, write, or do math (UNICEF 2016), other kids are spending these early years playing apps that have no educational value.

We’re addressing both these issues by creating an app that kids will not only love to play, but that will teach them skills for a better life.

Smart devices are exciting to kids and can be delivered to even the most rural areas, giving kids the chance to improve their future while they’re still waiting for schools to be built and teachers to be trained.

 

What is our solution for children's education?

 

Lipa Land!

 

Lipa Land's home screen and themes

 

We are currently working on an all-in-one application, Lipa Land, which is designed for children as well as everyone involved in children’s education and development.

With Lipa Land, access to quality education is provided through a system of both digital and physical activities that will send children on an adventure of growth and exploration.

The most unique aspect of Lipa Land is how each game adapts to a child's learning ability and offers parents/caretakers progress tracking along the way.

 

Child's progress tracking and real-world activities

 

 

Lipa Land will enable children to have an individualized experience, thus creating a learning pathway based on their own level and pace of learning.

In this app, parents, caretakers and teachers also have a dedicated section where they will have access to daily parenting information and personalized content based on their child’s performance.

 

Lipa Land's bedtime stories

 

Lipa Land has been carefully evaluated by a team of educational experts who designed the app for a proper balance of digital engagement: a 45 minute session per day for kids, and a 15 minute session for parents. This means kids and parents are only learning directly with the device for 1 hour, while the rest of the activities are completed outside the app.

The pilot app is also being tested in 17 international preschools. This way, kids themselves show us exactly what they need and want from their learning experience and we can inspire them towards an ongoing pursuit of knowledge.

 

Activities for children
  • Exploring games and activities using a virtual avatar
  • Educational games
  • Tips for outdoor activities and home crafts
Activities for families
  • Daily content (exploring activities, quizzes, tips for parents)
  • Themed Content Packs
  • Bedtime stories
  • Parenting information (health, safety, social skills…)
  • Progress tracking of their children
 

What is needed & how you can help

 

 

In order to reach all children, we need to implement an effective but costly system, which is why we need you!

 

Perfecting our early-childhood educational program

  • Lipa Land

Lipa Land is nearing the final stage of completion and we need your help bringing it from a prototype to a full product. To continuously create good educational value, we want to constantly add content to Lipa Land based on the feedback received by users.

  • Our Curriculum

Research and development for improving our Curriculum is also needed to stay up to date with the evolving environment that children are in.

 

Children in Tilonia village in Rajasthan, India learning with Lipa

 

Creating a personalized learning experience

  • Translation

We need to translate our learning materials and Lipa apps from 22 to 50+ languages, especially to reach children in less privileged communities.

  • Customization

Not only do we plan on simply translating Lipa Land, but also on customizing it according to the norms and culture in different countries/communities.

 

 

 

Narrowing educational disparity worldwide

  • Deployment and distribution

The most challenging step is getting the product to the doorstep of all families worldwide, most of those living in developing regions.

To bring Lipa Land to children worldwide, we need to create partnerships with preschools around the world, app publishers and device manufacturers to pre-install our content on their devices.

We also want to partner with nonprofit organizations that have access to children at the bottom of the pyramid like we are currently doing with Curious Learning.

 

All of those above steps need to be carried out simultaneously and that is why we need your help!

 

Lipa’s apps reaching children in South Africa with the help of Curious Learning

 

Where does your contribution go?

Product development

You will help our educational team constantly improve Lipa Land and our Curriculum.

One year of content creation would cost at least $4,500,000 USD (real world activities; games; bedtime stories; information for parents, caretakers, teachers; curriculum development…).

Language translation

You will help the translation team translate and culturally customize our learning materials and Lipa apps from 22 to 50+ languages especially to reach children in less privileged communities.

Translating and customizing Lipa Land into one language costs at least $36,000 USD.

Deployment and distribution

Your contribution would help us narrow the existing educational disparity and bring education as well as healthy and strong development to all children.

With your generosity, we will find the right distribution channels (partnerships with preschools, app publishers, device manufacturers, nonprofit organizations...) to get Lipa Land into the hands of children all around the world.

 

Join us in building a kinder, safer, and more educated world!

 

Where is Lipa Learning from?

Lipa is located at the heart of Europe, in Prague, Czech Republic, which was the home of the 17th-century revolutionary philosopher, J. A. Komenský. Known as the Father of Modern Education, Komenský was the first to create the “learn through play” concept; an inspiration for us!

 

Other ways you can help

Even if you are on a tight budget, there are other important ways you can support too!

  • Share our campaign video on Facebook
  • Share our campaign link with your friends and family
  • Make a tweet about our campaign on Twitter
  • Follow us on Facebook , YouTube and Instagram to stay updated about our campaign

We give you our thanks and deeply appreciate your kind support.

Every share, like or tweet counts. Together, we are making a greater impact on the lives of young children!

 

Lipa Learning’s Distinctions

 

* Disclaimer: inappropriate, racist, offensive, obscene, vulgar or profane names will not be accepted.
story_txt:
Who is Lipa Learning?Lipa Learning is a passionate international team of educators, researchers, developers and loving parents  that dedicates our lives to developing learning apps, games, and interactive books for children, which we design according to our early childhood development program.Here at  Lipa Learning, our mission is to bring quality education to every child around the world. Our educational program promotes harmony between physical and digital learning, while giving children a solid foundation in all areas of life.  How are we different?Unlike our competitors, who mostly teach cognitive skills only with their apps, we spent 5 years of research identifying the most widespread educational approaches as points of reference for our own system, which enables us to draw inspiration from truly the best. We even looked at traditional learning methods for insightful approaches.The backbone of our system is our  Curriculum, which consists of 8 comprehensive learning areas divided into several developmental categories that we want every single child to use in their daily life.  Not only do  we translate our program and content into different languages, but we also change it according to different regions to make it culturally inclusive.We also want to  promote a healthy balance between both the digital and physical world. To create this harmony we encourage every child to use the device to get out of the device and become motivated, independent little learners!  We aim to reach as many children as possible which is why we have translated our learning materials into 22 languages thus far and plan on reaching 50 languages in the long-haul and eventually achieve a worldwide reach.For little ones who need an extra helping-hand, we’ve created a badge to signify which of our learning materials are suitable for children with Special Needs. Because we believe all kids deserve the opportunity to learn and succeed!Our Curriculum Design is already in practice in international schools. In 2013, we opened our own Lipa Preschool where we implement our whole system and get feedback directly from the children, who let us know what they need and want.   Why are we here? A child’s early years play a critical role in predicting their future success. But while 38% of kids around the world can’t read, write, or do math (UNICEF 2016), other kids are spending these early years playing apps that have no educational value.We’re addressing both these issues by creating an app that kids will not only love to play, but that will teach them skills for a better life.Smart devices are exciting to kids and can be delivered to even the most rural areas, giving kids the chance to improve their future while they’re still waiting for schools to be built and teachers to be trained.  What is our solution for children's education? Lipa Land!  Lipa Land's home screen and themes We are currently working on an  all-in-one application, Lipa Land, which is designed for children as well as everyone involved in children’s education and development.With Lipa Land, access to quality education is provided through a system of both digital and physical activities that will send children on an adventure of growth and exploration.The most unique aspect of Lipa Land is how  each game adapts to a child's learning ability and offers parents/caretakers progress tracking along the way.  Child's progress tracking and real-world activities  Lipa Land will enable children to have an individualized experience, thus creating a learning pathway based on their own level and pace of learning.In this app, parents, caretakers and teachers also have a dedicated section where they will have access to daily parenting information and personalized content based on their child’s performance.  Lipa Land's bedtime stories Lipa Land has been carefully evaluated by a team of educational experts who designed the app for a proper balance of digital engagement: a 45 minute session per day for kids, and a 15 minute session for parents. This means kids and parents are only learning directly with the device for 1 hour, while the rest of the activities are completed outside the app.The pilot app is also being tested in 17 international preschools. This way,  kids themselves show us exactly what they need and want from their learning experience and we can inspire them towards an ongoing pursuit of knowledge.  Activities for children 
Exploring games and activities using a virtual avatar
Educational games
Tips for outdoor activities and home crafts
 Activities for families 
Daily content (exploring activities, quizzes, tips for parents)
Themed Content Packs
Bedtime stories
Parenting information (health, safety, social skills…)
Progress tracking of their children
 What is needed & how you can help  In order to reach all children, we need to implement an effective but costly system, which is why we need you! Perfecting our early-childhood educational program
Lipa Land
Lipa Land is nearing the final stage of completion and we need your help bringing it from a prototype to a full product. To continuously create good educational value, we want to  constantly add content to Lipa Land based on the feedback received by users.
Our Curriculum
Research and development for improving our Curriculum is also needed to stay up to date with the evolving environment that children are in.
 Children in Tilonia village in Rajasthan, India learning with Lipa Creating a personalized learning experience
Translation
We need to translate our learning materials and Lipa apps from 22 to 50+ languages, especially to reach children in less privileged communities.
Customization
Not only do we plan on simply translating Lipa Land, but also on customizing it according to the norms and culture in different countries/communities.
   Narrowing educational disparity worldwide
Deployment and distribution
The most challenging step is getting the product to the doorstep of all families worldwide, most of those living in developing regions.
To bring Lipa Land to children worldwide, we need to create partnerships with preschools around the world, app publishers and device manufacturers to pre-install our content on their devices.
We also want to partner with nonprofit organizations that have access to children at the bottom of the pyramid like we are currently doing with  Curious Learning. 
 All of those above steps need to be carried out simultaneously and that is why we need your help! Lipa’s apps reaching children in South Africa with the help of  Curious Learning   Where does your contribution go? Product development 
You will help our educational team constantly improve Lipa Land and our Curriculum.
One year of content creation would cost at least $4,500,000 USD (real world activities; games; bedtime stories; information for parents, caretakers, teachers; curriculum development…).
 Language translation 
You will help the translation team translate and culturally customize our learning materials and Lipa apps from 22 to 50+ languages especially to reach children in less privileged communities.
Translating and customizing Lipa Land into one language costs at least $36,000 USD.
 Deployment and distribution 
Your contribution would help us  narrow the existing educational disparity and bring education as well as healthy and strong development to all children.
With your generosity, we will find the right distribution channels (partnerships with preschools, app publishers, device manufacturers, nonprofit organizations...)  to get Lipa Land into the hands of children all around the world.
 Join us in building a kinder, safer, and more educated world! Where is Lipa Learning from?Lipa is located at the heart of Europe, in Prague, Czech Republic, which was the home of the 17th-century revolutionary philosopher, J. A. Komenský. Known as the Father of Modern Education, Komenský was the first to create the “learn through play” concept; an inspiration for us! Other ways you can helpEven if you are on a tight budget, there are other important ways you can support too!
Share our campaign video on  Facebook 

Share our  campaign link  with your friends and family
Make a tweet about our campaign on  Twitter 

Follow us on  Facebook ,  YouTube and  Instagram  to stay updated about our campaign
We give you our thanks and deeply appreciate your kind support.Every share, like or tweet counts. Together, we are making a greater impact on the lives of young children! Lipa Learning’s Distinctions  * Disclaimer: inappropriate, racist, offensive, obscene, vulgar or profane names will not be accepted.

story:
WHY ME?...well, why not?

I am a highly passionate award-winning Malaysian actor, singer, musician, writer and creative artist, active in the Malaysian and Singapore performing arts industry for over 9 years. I am a highly sought after performer, averaging 4 major theatre productions a year and countless smaller projects time permitting. I have been fully committed to the arts, this year alone I am involved in at least 7 theatre, music and creative productions before I leave for the UK in September 2017.  

More info on me on my website: http://www.sfastage.com/

PRESS REVIEWS:

“The beautiful vocalist and well- known theatre actress Stephanie Van Driesen sang Memoro de la Stono... Van Driesen joined mid-song... sounding just as powerful with clear and strong vocals, singing “Distant worlds together... to sing to you this song...the MPO performed Suteki Da Ne... Van Driesen’s voice was hauntingly beautiful and it suited the video that accompanied it perfectly.”

~ The New Straits Times - Showbiz: Final Ecstasy (2012) 

(when I sang with the MPO for "Distant Worlds: The Music from Final Fantasy x)

 

“Van Driesen’s varied expressions, casting aspersions with a simple nod or indicating her disgust with a pointed glance is incredible, and the way she masks her emotions — expected of women at the time — is simply amazing. Emma is polished yet akin to the occasional swig of vodka straight from the bottle, and Van Driesen captures that duality very well.”

- The Edge, Live it! "Dual Benefit" 30/05/2017  

(on my portrayal as Emma in Harold Pinter's "Betrayal" May/June 2017)  http://www.sfastagecrafts.com

 

[Pic: Myself as Dorothy in "The Wizard of Oz" (2012) PAN Productions]

 

SO WITH ALL THIS GOING WELL, WHY UK?

I feel at this time after having been a theatre artiste and performer in Malaysia for 9 years and having seen the state of the industry - the current level of standards across the board, the current rate of progress towards being a thriving arts community that is economically viable, and having myself contributed to increasing the standards as high as I can through my ongoing work and commitment to excellence - the only way I foresee that I can assist in growing the performing arts here is by improving my skill, practice and connections in the company of experts in one of the world’s leading and thriving performing arts hubs; London - and in particular East 15 Acting School. http://www.east15.ac.uk/about/

On March 4, 2017, at a live audition that was held at the Kuala Lumpur Performing Arts Centre (KLPac), I was offered a place to become a full-time student of the MFA (International) Acting programme at the established East 15 Acting School, under the University of Essex....And here's proof that I got in!

 

 

TO DREAM THE "I'M POSSIBLE" DREAM

So, immediately after I got accepted I asked myself, "How the hell are you gonna raise all that money in 6 months?"  I do not come from a privileged background and my funds are limited.

At this point I could have given up, but something inside me told me all this is part of a greater plan, that I must do all I can in order to make this happen. 

 

SO, HERE'S WHAT HAPPENED: I started asking, and out of the blue, miracles started happening...

My Fundraising so far:

April - June 13, 2017:

I put together a detailed appeal for education funding document & launched a funding drive: tirelessly approaching individuals, corporations, foundations, scholarships, and am in the midst of producing a  self-producing a fundraising concert on August 10, on top of being fully immersed in Harold Pinter's Betrayal (May/June), alongside working on my debut album (to be released end of the year) and working as an actor, singer, arts educator, voice over artist & event producer. Whew.

As of June 13, 2017: 

I kept going and I managed to receive pledges and donations from individual private sponsors (thank you SAS '76 alumni) in my home country of Malaysia amounting to RM55,000 (£9,000 or USD 12,000) ! Holy Wow! 

With this upfront amount, I felt encouraged and I immediate already paid for my first semester fees. Talk about faith!

Plus, a very generous donor heard about my case through a friend, watched me in Harold Pinter's "Betrayal" - a play I performed in recently - was so impressed by my performance as the central character of Emma, and seeing my potential has pledged to pay for my 2nd year tuition fees, once I complete my first year! Amounting to RM50,000...(Why second year? To see if I'm really serious!) ...Plus plus, I also received sponsorship by MAS for my flight to London! YAY!

So now I have a total in value of RM105,000 out of the RM280,000 I need for the 2 years.

So that's already almost half of the value of what I'll need for the 2 years!

Onwards: I'm continuing my efforts in my home country, on social media, with the help of the press and media, to highlight this amazing journey and unorthodox way of opening a path towards success.... and now with the opportunity to crowd-fund, I am excited that this will indeed come true, with your help :D 

Any amount that you are able to give would mean the world to me.

 

How much more to go: RM175,000 (or approx. $40,000)

 

BIG PLANS... #HUSTLE !

I have already put plans into motion that while I am studying, I will still be actively contributing to the arts scene in Malaysia via articles, collaborations, and online content, which will document and broadcast my UK journey on social media in real time, with the intention of forming greater ties between the UK and Malaysian performing arts scenes, where the exchange of technologies, information and cultural differences can enrich and contribute to the growing global industry which is becoming increasingly borderless. I will be working closely with industry professionals in the UK on content, marketing and securing future work post East 15.

 

THE BIGGER PICTURE - SOCIAL IMPACT

I wrote an article a few years back that was published in Calibre magazine about Courage, and how the performing arts impacts kids and adults to be more fearless, compassionate, and self-reliable. 

I believe I was that everyone is put on this earth to do something big, and to fulfil their potential in what they are naturally amazing at. 

As someone who has gone through low self-esteem and anxiety most of my life, where I would spend most of my teens huddled, afraid in a corner, when I was performing i.e. Singing, Dancing, Acting or expressing myself through art, I was a completely different person.

Singing has always been a way to release pent up anxiety and emotions, writing expressed my inner thoughts, and as I discovered later, taking up Acting enabled me to come out of my shell and explore what being human is all about and connect with people on a deeper level, with Trust, Honesty and Presence that is so lacking in everyday interactions. This is why I'm passionate about Acting. I believe that my success is a shared one, it belongs to me as much as it does everyone who has touched my life, climbing the ladder with me.

My intention is to create and nurture global initiatives through the unifying nature of the arts within education, international business relations, and unleash unlimited creativity through storytelling. 

 

THE REALITY IS...

I know it is hard to "make it" in this industry, globally, and only the toughest thrive. Based on my track record and ambition I have the drive, talent and vision to succeed as a performing artist, social impact engineer, and global businesswoman. I ask that you share in my vision and support me in this stepping stone. Every little bit counts, and I've got some very personal pieces of creativity that I'd like to share with you - PERKS - that will hopefully be as meaningful for you as they have been for me.

If you can't contribute financially, I would very much appreciate it if you could SHARE this with anyone you know who you think can. You can use the sharing tools provided by Indiegogo here.

I'm just so grateful to be on this journey of miracles that just keeps getting better!

With much Love,

Stephanie Van Driesen

http://www.sfastage.com

story:
We’re on a mission to inspire girls everywhere to live happier and healthier by promoting physical activity as a path to lifelong success. Please donate.



The Pop-Up Play Day Tour is a powerful yet simple way to help girls get active, enjoy the outdoors and realize their full potential easier than ever thought possible.

WHY POP-UP PLAY DAY? 

The idea for the Pop-Up Play Day Tour was sparked when we realized that girls in our after-school programs seldom ride bikes or play old-fashioned games like hopscotch and Double Dutch. Like so many others, these girls spend more time playing on digital devices than they do playing outdoors.

We quickly realized that our girls aren’t the only ones who have stopped playing. In fact, Nike’s “Designed to Move” report suggests that physical activity in the U.S. has declined 32% since 1968 and is on track for a 46% drop by 2030. Consequently, 1 in 3 American girls (that 12.5 million) are overweight and obese.

This must change. To do our part, we researched the most successful intervention programs in the world to figure out what our girls are missing. We read a ton of research articles and talked to a lot of girls...

Watch Victoria's #PlayLikeAGirl Story 

For instance, we learned that a girl who plays sports also:

  • Is less likely to get pregnant and engage in risky sexual behavior

  • Has reduced risk of breast cancer, heart disease and other chronic illnesses

  • Gains confidence, positive body image, resilience and key leadership skills

Among many other things, we learned that girls need a daily ritual of play: an established pattern of getting outside and playing every day. So we decided to bring back play by delivering early, positive experiences for girls in active play, physical activity and sports. Your donation makes this possible for more girls. Donate here.


Play Like A Girl!®


What started in 2004 as a few annual events hosted by sorority girls in Alabama has become the source of inspiration for several thousand girls and young women across the United States and Canada. At Play Like A Girl, our mission is to inspire girls everywhere to live happier and healthier by promoting physical activity as a path to lifelong success. So we created girl-focused health education programs that make physical activity accessible, easy and fun.

Read more about what we, and our partners, are doing to bring back play here.

A LOOK INSIDE POP-UP PLAY DAY 

We envision a future where girls are running, jumping and kicking to reach their greatest potential. 

As a first step in that direction, we are launching the Pop-Up Play Day Tour — an unprecedented collaboration to bring play back to America’s most inactive communities, beginning in the South where the burden of overweight and obesity is greatest. The tour is designed to provide simple steps and tools to help girls and their families get back outdoors to play again.

The schedule on the Pop-Up Play Day Tour is equal parts information and fun. We make every effort to deliver a healthy dose of education and entertainment that keeps girls excited about and committed to active play, physical activity and sports long after we’ve left their communities.



Girls of all ages are invited to attend these free events, which offer an entire day of activities and games for girls and their families, including sports clinics and drills, cheer, dance, and old-school games, as well as a 5K walk/run, arts and entertainment to encourage active and healthy lifestyles.

We will make 10 stops across the South, kicking off Memorial Day weekend with stops in new cities every 2-3 weeks until Labor Day 2016 (tentative list by state below). Exact location in each state is TBD with our nonprofit and educational partners who will help kids warm up for Pop-Up Play Day by hosting pre-event activities and training for teachers, parents and administrators at dozens of schools and recreational centers in tour cities.

Alabama   ✪  Arkansas   ✪  Florida   ✪  Georgia   ✪  Louisiana   ✪  Mississippi ✪  North Carolina   ✪  South Carolina   ✪  Tennessee   ✪  Texas 

Hear Isa's story. She likes to #PlayLikeAGirl too.

The first and final stops will also feature a concert with popular artists from Hip Hop Public Health and the Partnership for a Healthier America. Contributing artists include legendary rap icons Doug E. Fresh, VP of Entertainment for Hip Hop Public Health, and DMC of Run DMC. Other artists include Jordin Sparks, Matisyahu, Travis Barker, Ryan Beatty, Ashanti, Ariana Grande, Paul Burch and Brady Rymer among others.

In addition, there will be opportunities for schools to apply for grants like the GO! Grant that support physical activity before, during and after school. Schools will be given free access to GoNoodle and Hip Hop Public Health's digital platforms for incorporation into existing curricula. And, teachers will be offered SPARK teacher training aimed at integrating physical activity/education in the classroom. Plus, girls who attend will also access online tools, enter to win a box of free play equipment, and take home a free KIDS in the GAME PASS to cover up to $50 in pay-to-play registration fees for recreational sports. 

We can't imagine a future for girls without play! 

Our big dream is to help every girl we can lace up and get outside to enjoy the timeless pleasures of outdoor play, physical activity and sports. With your contribution, the possibilities for this generation’s girls are endless.

#GivingTuesday is just around the corner, but perks are available now. Click here to give the gift of play to girls in your community.


We Need Your Help!

Our goal is to bring back play to 10,000 girls in 2016. This means supporters (you!) backing us today on Indiegogo to make the Pop-Up Play Day Tour happen. Sharing stories, online and in-person, using fun and inspiring pics of girls from our gallery to help spread the word. Purchasing gear in our e-store to support our stops. Giving time or donations to start local Play Like A Girl councils. Doing good, spreading love!

This is going to take some serious cash. More than $250,000 to be exact. Our initial $50,000 Indiegogo goal will be offset by corporate sponsorships and the in-kind donations of our partners. The more we raise together on Indiegogo, the less we have to rely on outside investments.

It takes a village, people...LET’S DO THIS! 


Donate to #bringbackplay.

families, including sports clinics and drills, cheer, dance, and old-school

healthy lifestyles.We will make 10 stops across the South, kicking off Memorial
Day weekend with stops in new cities every 2-3 weeks until Labor Day 2016 (tentative list by state below). Exact location in each state is TBD with our nonprofit and educational
partners who will help kids warm up for Pop-Up Play Day by hosting pre-event
activities and training for teachers, parents and
administrators at dozens of schools and recreational centers
in tour cities.Alabama   ✪  Arkansas   ✪  Florida   ✪  Georgia   ✪  Louisiana   ✪  Mississippi 
✪  North Carolina   ✪  South Carolina   ✪  Tennessee   ✪  Texas 
Hear Isa's story. She likes to #PlayLikeAGirl too.
The first and final stops will also feature a concert with popular artists from Hip Hop Public Health and the Partnership for a Healthier America. Contributing artists
include legendary rap icons Doug E. Fresh, VP of Entertainment for Hip Hop
Public Health, and DMC of Run DMC. Other artists include Jordin Sparks,
Matisyahu, Travis Barker, Ryan Beatty, Ashanti, Ariana Grande, Paul Burch and
Brady Rymer among others.

In addition, there will be opportunities
for schools to apply for grants like the GO! Grant
that support physical activity before, during and after school. Schools will be
given free access to GoNoodle and
Hip Hop Public Health's digital platforms for incorporation into existing
curricula. And, teachers will be offered SPARK
teacher training aimed at integrating physical activity/education in the
classroom. Plus, girls who attend will also access online tools, enter to win a
box of free play equipment, and take home a free KIDS in the GAME PASS
to cover up to $50 in pay-to-play registration fees for recreational
sports. 
We can't imagine a future for girls without play! 
Our big dream is to help every girl we can lace up and get outside to enjoy the timeless pleasures of outdoor play, physical activity and sports. With your contribution, the possibilities for this generation’s girls are endless. 
#GivingTuesday is just around the corner, but perks are available now. Click here to give the gift of play to girls in your community. 
We Need Your Help!
Our goal is to bring back play to 10,000 girls in 2016. This means supporters (you!) backing us today on Indiegogo to
make the Pop-Up Play Day Tour happen. Sharing stories, online and in-person, using fun and inspiring pics of girls from our
gallery to help spread the word. Purchasing gear in our e-store to support our stops. Giving time or donations to
start local Play Like A Girl councils. Doing good, spreading love! This is going to take some serious
cash. More than $250,000 to be exact. Our initial $50,000 Indiegogo goal will be
offset by corporate sponsorships and the in-kind donations of our partners. The
more we raise together on Indiegogo, the less we have to rely on outside
investments. 

It takes a village, people...LET’S
DO THIS! 
Donate to #bringbackplay.

story:
Who we are & What we do: Touching lives around the world!!

  • Spirit of Atlanta Drum and Bugle Corps, founded in 1976, is a nonprofit youth performing arts education organization based in Atlanta, GA. The primary objective of Spirit of Atlanta is to provide challenging, high-quality programs for youth through a positive environment that emphasizes character and social development, leadership, self-discipline, and the pursuit of excellence.

    The corps comprises 150 brass, percussion, and color guard members, ages 15 to 22, who perform an 11-minute show that integrates artistic and athletic skill in an entertaining display of outdoor pageantry. Although most of its members are from the Southeast, the popularity of Spirit of Atlanta has attracted members from all over the United States, Canada, and even Great Britain and Japan. Members are selected by audition based on their musical ability, movement skills, and attitude.

  • Drum Corps International delivers the message of “excellence in performance and in life” to more than 7.2 million young people, ages 13-22 involved in performing arts in the United States
  • Active participants in U.S.-based drum and bugle corps hail from more than 15 countries
  • The annual Drum Corps International Tour is made up of more than 100 events throughout North America
  • Each summer, some 400,000 fans attend live drum corps even

What We Need

Each year it costs in excess of $700,000 to field the corps. Expenses are bus rentals, driver salaries, gas, food, lots of food, housing expense, insurance, staff, and medical. 

The Alumni Association plays a key role in helping the organization by holding various fundraisers throughout the year.  

YOUR donation helps!!

The Impact

From modest beginnings more than three decades ago, Drum Corps International (DCI) has developed into a powerful, nonprofit, global youth activity with far-reaching artistic, educational and organizational influence. Through the annual DCI Tour and more than 35 World Championships in 17 North American cities, Drum Corps International provides entertainment to millions through live performances and nationally-televised events. Drum Corps International is Marching Music’s Major League™.

Showcasing the best of the best: 

  • Each year, more than 8,000 students audition for the fewer than 3,500 positions available in top-tier DCI member corps
  • More than 5,000 members directly participate annually
  • Average age is 19.4
  • 72 percent are full-time college students
  • 59.6 percent of the current college students are pursuing music education degrees, while 65 percent of those that indicated they are high school students intend to major in music education

Challenges

As a 501(c)3 non profit, finding funding is THE challenge, each and every year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Go to www.soaaa.org and join the Delta Group! This is a monthly recurring revenue generation model to help sustain the corps for long term success. Best of all, we only ask for a $20.00 recurring donation.
