story:
What is a Cavalcade of Authors?

Cavalcade of Authors is a literary event for students made up of two components: 1) students reading novels from 15 featured authors, and 2) writer's workshops led by these authors. On April 30, 2016, we are collaborating with Pacific Lutheran University to present a literary/writing conference for 400 middle level and high school students Washington state. COA West is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

Cavalcade of Authors West is in its second year, modeled after the Cavalcade of Authors established in the Tri Cities of Washington in 2009. In our first year, we saw 250 students working in an intimate setting of a 15:1 ratio with award-winning, popular young adult authors from around the country. Feedback from students, authors, teachers and librarians was overwhelmingly positive, encouraging the continuation and growth of our program. Many commented they couldn't believe it was our first year! 

Adolescent literacy is a significant need in our community and this program promotes reading and writing skills in an engaging and unique way.  In our first year, we saw students from schools with a free/reduced lunch range of 24% - 86%. Not only are we meeting literacy needs, but also providing an opportunity for those in our community who wouldn't normally have access to world class authors in such a personalized setting. This experience encourages reading, writing, and demonstrates to students that every one of them can find success through their own creativity. 

Our four founding board members have a vast amount of teaching and literacy experience as classroom teachers and librarians. We have each contributed to a number of boards, conferences and events of various sizes and scope. Above all, we all have a passion for students, authors and literacy; this conference will allow us to combine all of those pieces to deliver a unique and meaningful experience to the students of our own community.

What We Need & What You Get

To operate a program of this magnitude for our students, we are looking to raise nearly $18,000. To reach as many students and schools as possible, donations of any value are welcome and appreciated.

The funds will go directly to pay author honorariums, travel and lodging expenses, and meals, as well as for marketing and school outreach. We have worked hard to negotiate discounts and donations when possible; for instance, conference fees have been donated by PLU and many authors are donating travel expenses and autographed books.

Perks:

  • $500 - Author Social invitation April 29, 2016

  • $100 - Autographed book by the author of your choice

  • $25 - Poster autographed by all participating authors

The Impact

We are committed to promoting literacy in our community. We want to pass on the love for books in our world that is slowly beginning to devalue the wonder of reading. As educators, we know that reading is the number one indicator of student success in school and in determining their earning power in the workplace. The Cavalcade of Authors West is the experience of a lifetime for students, bringing together world-class authors and their young adult readers.

Risks & Challenges

We know you have a number of options to support student education and literacy projects. Cavalcade of Authors West is not a festival, it is not a convention, but is unique in that we offer workshops in a intimate classroom setting with world-renowned authors. We are the first event of this kind in the Puget Sound. In our second year, we are confident in the continued success of this project. Our biggest challenge is having the money to support our commitments to both authors and students. We will continue to reach out to our corporate community as partners in this project, but we need to count on our friends and supporters to continue this unique program.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not, please help us spread the word about this very worthwhile cause. We can be found on Twitter and Instagram (@cavalcadewest), and on Facebook (Cavalcade of Authors West). Please refer to our website for updates and information about this campaign and this project that is so important to us.

story:
CouponReport.org has helped thousands of families save money on their grocery bills. By combining the latest coupons with the latest sales in both grocery stores and drugstores, readers are able to save up to 50% on groceries and other household items.

Couponreport.org recently added the "couponing for charity" category to the website. As regular readers have already realized, the abundance of cheap or even free groceries eventually results in more food and household items than their immediate family needs. "Couponing for Charity" allows us to pass on this abundance by giving to local food banks and needy families.

Coupon Report is all about saving money. Everything from free printable grocery coupons to a guide to receiving free and discounted Amazon products in exchange for honest reviews helps our readers save money and share with their community.

story:
Hello, my name is Kyle Ursino and one of my biggest passions is to travel. Your donation will help me get closer to embark on this amazing and very likely life changing experience for me.

Over the course of 6 weeks, I will learn to carry my own sleeping bag, shelter, and personal gear while also walking up to 10 miles per day. How to cook a simple meal from scratch on the trail and gain the skills necessary to plan my own long-term travel adventure. While experiencing the New Zealand culture. This trip is called Simply New Zealand 2016  and the emphasis of this trip is to unplug from electronics and immerse myself into a different culture. 

I have done a lot of babysitting and other odd jobs to save up as much as possible for this trip but it is just not enough. Here's the breakdown of the trip expenses, program Fee: $5000 (includes all accommodations, breakfasts, dinners, transport, and activities within New Zealand), international airfare: in the neighborhood of $1900, six weeks' lunches at $5/day: $210, All this adds up to $7,110. Your donations are much appreciated, wish me luck!

story:
HOW DO YOU CREATE INNOVATION? 

We are Walnut St. Labs. We're an "innovation lab" -- that's a fancy pants way of saying we cultivate innovation in our community. We're in West Chester, PA. This is the way we do it: 

  1. We raise awareness of innovation. Sometimes that means inviting a local innovator or entrepreneur to come in and talk about his/her company or by doing a round-table on a new technology like Oculus Rift, Go, Particle.io or...
  2. Then we get people to experience innovation first hand. We do this a few different ways: it could be at one of our 3D Printer Bootcamps or the time those guys came in with Oculus Rifts!
  3. Then we get out of the way and let stuff happen! And having a clubhouse is key. First it was Clay and Brandon making a new Twitter app in like 6 weeks. Then it was Peter throwing down the gauntlet and becoming a developer with the help of a bunch of Night Owls and crushing dev on his new calendar app, and then it was...


\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\
From One of Our 150 Events! Raising Awareness of New Technology From Those That Are Using It
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////



WHAT WE NEED AND WHY WE NEED IT

We don't charge for events. And the speakers and professionals donating their time don't get paid. But our team has spent thousands of hours running them and creating videos and distributing content about them... With financial support we can ensure we can keep doing them into 2016.



\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\
From ProtoComp2015 with Unisys!
100 Local People Spent 5 Weeks Innovating!

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


WHAT YOU GET

"An Innovation Lab In Every Community!" That's our motto. We are quite frankly knocked over, on the ground, stunned by what this community of innovators has done in just under 2 years. There's a hunger for innovation. The "clubhouse" is where it all starts. 

But to be concrete, by contributing to this campaign you will:

  • Create more exposure for cutting edge technology
  • Create free education
  • Create opportunity to collaborate -- and to work
  • Create inspiration
  • Create community
  • Create IMPACT!

\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\
TechTours: Behind the Scenes of Our Great Local Companies 
Forging New Technology
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

THE IMPACT WE'RE GONNA HAVE IS THE IMPACT WE'VE HAD. BUT MORE OF IT!

We've been rocking steady for two years. 180 events? Yes, really. 3D Printer Bootcamps, iSchool, product demos... We're going to continue doing these programs and MORE. We're going to continue working with the community to bring the best programs forward. 


\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\ iSchool: Bringing Great Companies Out Of Their Offices to Share Their Technology

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////



What If...?

Yikes. We can't imagine "what if". Because we live here. And we want to live in a community that has an innovation lab. If someone else built this place, we'd be hanging out here, too. But in all reality, we can sustain our programs until the end of this year. After that, the innovation-making-awesomeness can't sustain itself through our self-funding. That's why we want your participation.



\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\
3D Printer Bootcamp: "Making" New Innovators One Day At A Time

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////



WANT TO HELP IN DIFFERENT WAYS?!

  • You can come to one of our events to learn more. 
  • You can cowork with us!
  • Learn More!

story:
Hi all! I'm Yza from the Philippines. I am a programmer by profession but my heart is not in it anymore. I am a creative by heart and would want to pursue a career in graphics design. I know its financial suicide but this is where my heart is and if ever you share the same feeling I have, you know it too well that I can't just drown it out and let the fire in me extinguish. This wish has been burning inside me from sometime and now I am going to follow it.

I am planning to take the April 2016 class for three months and would need almost £10,000 for a Full - Time 2015 Mon - Fri, 8am -5pm class costs about £9,950 to be exact. Living expenses like rent and food not yet included. I am currently saving up but would appreciate any help I could get.

WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT TO ME

Ever since I was a kid, art has always been by my side. I love doing small projects, coloring, drawing on paper, beading, creating bracelets to sell to my classmates and making other whatnots. During High school, I decided to widen my knowledge and delved into Photography.When I was in college,I was forced to take up a course that I did not really like because of financial issues. This did not hinder me from dabbling into the creative field though. I was part of a college organization composed of creatives; the Animation Guild of the Philippines. We had high dreams then; to create the first ever 100% Filipino-made animation! We were so young back then and full of dreams! We have no idea of the sad reality of life. Sadly, we first have to face reality and feed ourselves and pay for basic necessities. Life happened. Our problems suddenly become bigger than our dreams and one by one, the burning flame turned into a flickering flame barely giving off light.. but before dying completely, it hit me hard that we only have one life to live and if we live it, we should make it as best as we could! (please refer to this link for further info and drama. Haha! http://blog.yzamarzan.com/changing-of-seasons/ ) Its time to stop thinking and start doing! Thats when I decided to chase my dreams again no matter the cost.

WHY SHILLINGTON COLLEGE

I did try to study graphics design on my own but I can only do as much. After extensive research across the net, I came across the Shillington College website. Reading the course outline and time frame, this is the exact thing I need to help me kick-start my career in design. One can dream, right? and if you dream, you have to dream big! 

Shillington offers a course that I believe will help equip me with necessary skills to aid me in the transition from one career to another in just a span of 3 months. I believe the teachers are very talented and with years of experience in the industry under their sleeves, the knowledge that they will be able to impart with me is priceless. As stated from their information pack, 

"Our Graphic Design Course will introduce you to the exciting, ever-changing world of design, communication, and problem-solving. Starting with Design Principles, we cover Typography, Branding, Web Design, User Experience, Digital Publishing, and much more."

Within those three months, I will have a glimpse of how a graphic artist works as their learning environment is more like a real studio than a classroom. Due to small classes (25 students maximum), intimate working relationships with teachers will be developed.They'll be able to give regular advice and critiques in my works.

My hope is that after this course, I will be able to find my niche and focus on it more. I hope to streamline my abilities and maximize it in the best way possible.

I am also hoping to amp up my portfolio after the course so that I can start working as soon as possible.

HOW CAN YOU HELP

I am appealing to your generosity to help me fund my studies and living expenses. Any amount you give, no matter how small, lessens my burden greatly. Please also check the perks on the side. For every donation amount you give, there is a little token in return. Please do check from time to time as I may include new perks.

See sample colored vector portrait below for reference of my work.

For black and white portraits, please see below.

 


I know God will find a way to make this happen. :) God bless you as you give. :)

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you do not have the means to support my campaign financially, just getting the word out and sharing this across your network will greatly help me. I will be forever grateful for you.

Thank you so much for your support and it means so much to me for you to take time and read through this post.

“And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.”

― Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

You could also use the airbnb link here if you still do not have an airbnb account. You can have up to $25 discount or the equivalent and I will earn from the referral. The earnings will be used to lessen the cost of my rent once in London.

P.S. Here is my blog URL: http://blog.yzamarzan.com

Disclaimer: that is a banner from their website: http://www.shillingtoncollege.co.uk/why-study-s...

I am a creative by heart and would want to pursue a career in graphics design. I know its financial suicide but this is where my heart is and if ever you share the same feeling I have, you know it too well that I can't just drown it out and let the fire in me extinguish. This wish has been burning inside me from sometime and now I am going to follow it.I am planning to take the April 2016 class for three months and would need almost £10,000 for a Full - Time 2015 Mon - Fri, 8am -5pm class costs about £9,950 to be exact. Living expenses like rent and food not yet included. I am currently saving up but would appreciate any help I could get.WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT TO MEEver since I was a kid, art has always been by my side. I love doing small projects, coloring, drawing on paper, beading, creating bracelets to sell to my classmates and making other whatnots. During High school, I decided to widen my knowledge and delved into Photography.When I was in college,I was forced to take up a course that I did not really like because of financial issues. This did not hinder me from dabbling into the creative field though. I was part of a college organization composed of creatives; the Animation Guild of the Philippines. We had high dreams then; to create the first ever 100% Filipino-made animation! We were so young back then and full of dreams! We have no idea of the sad reality of life. Sadly, we first have to face reality and feed ourselves and pay for basic necessities. Life happened. Our problems suddenly become bigger than our dreams and one by one, the burning flame turned into a flickering flame barely giving off light.. but before dying completely, it hit me hard that we only have one life to live and if we live it, we should make it as best as we could! (please refer to this link for further info and drama. Haha! http://blog.yzamarzan.com/changing-of-seasons/ ) Its time to stop thinking and start doing! Thats when I decided to chase my dreams again no matter the cost.WHY SHILLINGTON COLLEGEI did try to study graphics design on my own but I can only do as much. After extensive research across the net, I came across the Shillington College website. Reading the course outline and time frame, this is the exact thing I need to help me kick-start my career in design. One can dream, right? and if you dream, you have to dream big! Shillington offers a course that I believe will help equip me with necessary skills to aid me in the transition from one career to another in just a span of 3 months. I believe the teachers are very talented and with years of experience in the industry under their sleeves, the knowledge that they will be able to impart with me is priceless. As stated from their information pack, "Our Graphic Design Course will introduce you to the exciting, ever-changing world of design, communication, and problem-solving. Starting with Design Principles, we cover Typography, Branding, Web Design, User Experience, Digital Publishing, and much more."Within those three months, I will have a glimpse of how a graphic artist works as their learning environment is more like a real studio than a classroom. Due to small classes (25 students maximum), intimate working relationships with teachers will be developed.They'll be able to give regular advice and critiques in my works.My hope is that after this course, I will be able to find my niche and focus on it more. I hope to streamline my abilities and maximize it in the best way possible.I am also hoping to amp up my portfolio after the course so that I can start working as soon as possible.HOW CAN YOU HELPI am appealing to your generosity to help me fund my studies and living expenses. Any amount you give, no matter how small, lessens my burden greatly. Please also check the perks on the side. For every donation amount you give, there is a little token in return. Please do check from time to time as I may include new perks.See sample colored vector portrait below for reference of my work.For black and white portraits, please see below. I know God will find a way to make this happen. :) God bless you as you give. :)OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPIf you do not have the means to support my campaign financially, just getting the word out and sharing this across your network will greatly help me. I will be forever grateful for you.Thank you so much for your support and it means so much to me for you to take time and read through this post.“And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.”― Paulo Coelho, The AlchemistYou could also use the airbnb link here if you still do not have an airbnb account. You can have up to $25 discount or the equivalent and I will earn from the referral. The earnings will be used to lessen the cost of my rent once in London.P.S. Here is my blog URL: http://blog.yzamarzan.comDisclaimer: that is a banner from their website: http://www.shillingtoncollege.co.uk/why-study-s...

story:
Summary

We call our Makerspace Invention Dimension and we exist to teach children:

- to become resilient in the face of challenges- to have grit
- to effectively problem-solve and collaborate
- to bolster critical thinking and logic skills

We offer an inclusive space where children can learn through hands-on academic and social skill building- called ‘making’.  

With ‘making’ children:
- develop character and a sense of purpose, 
- tend to persevere
- think creatively 
- and grow up to be independent, thoughtful problem solvers.

We want to stay open in order to serve as many children as possible. We really see the research-based benefit of making and want to ensure children receive these life-long benefits in a fun and engaging way. 

How this all started

HI- My name is Laurie Bloyer, and I am a former classroom teacher turned, Makerspace creator. I moved from the classroom to the Makerspace to give children of all abilities a place to be exceptional.

I fell in love with 'making' when I was researching project-based learning ideas for my classroom. realizing that there was not much time in the day for 'making' I started an after-school club, where we doubled in size to over 40 makers in 2 weeks. All of the makers stayed with the club and we culminated our year in the only MAKE: Magazine branded School Maker Faire in New Mexico. At this same time I was starting our Makerspace in central Abq. I am thrilled that my job now has become a place where I teach vital life skills such as perseverance, critical thinking, problem solving, creativity, grit, cooperation, STEAM skills and so much more- and we get to do it through hands-on activities. How fun! (Interestingly enough these are the top requested skills employers are/and will be looking for - see the World Economic Forum graphic below)

I am seeking your help in order to get the word out about the advantage of making to the families of Abq. I want to educate them as to what is making and why is it so vital for their child to learn. Additionally, I am looking for support to keep our Makerspace running. Thus far, I have used my own savings and loans to pay for this space, but I see I need more time to launch it off the ground, and I don't want to give up yet! I am creating this space for OUR future, to ensure that children have the opportunity for a sure foundation, and to ensure this Makerspace will be here to teach vital life skills and prepare our children for the future, and I need help. (Also of interest- Abq is ON THE VERGE of embracing making big time- a press release JUST announced that the US Dept. Of Education is awarding $7.8 Million to...”schools where students will engage in hands-on, integrated Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics learning experiences.” (http://www.aps.edu/news/aps-gets-7-8m-grant-for...) As you can see we are on to something here!

Your contributions will help spread the word through maker activities, events, marketing about the value of making and about research. This research has proven that the act of tinkering, making, and creating has shown a resurgence in children's desire to learn, that they are better prepared for the workforce, and how children are becoming our next innovators- taking ideas into reality- bettering our society, and our world! By contributing you will help to keep the door open for about 6 months. It is my plan to be self sustaining after this time.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $12,500 to start. Fortunately, we really don't need a lot to keep our doors open! $2,000/month pays for rent, utilities, some supplies, and our marketing. This is only to keep the doors open, and to market the Makerspace. In the future I would love to be able to offer scholarships. My plan is to pay for salaries with enrollment fees.

We are offering great maker perks. (of course!) There will be drawings from one of the makers, and from our ever so popular take apart stations we have jewelry like no other you have seen! Also, inspired by our cardboard challenge we have very unique earrings. Check them all out on the right. --->

We will also have surprise perks for early donors as well as perks coming throughout the campaign.

If our goal is not reached...we wont cry (too much), we will be eternally thankful and will use what we have been given to extend the time we can keep the space and pay for advertising.  We appreciate any and all help we are able to receive!

The Impact

“The benefits of educational Makerspaces are many and varied. Makerspaces can have a significant impact on student learning and development. In fact, Makerspaces were recently identified as one of six important developments in educational technology for K-12 education by the New Media Consortium (NMC) Horizon Report for 2015, which states, “Makerspaces are increasingly being looked to as a method for engaging learners in creative, higher-order problem-solving through hands-on design, construction, and iteration” (p. 38). According to the NMC (2015), Makerspaces have the potential to effectively address the necessary skillsets for students in the 21st Century (p. 38). What follows is an explanation of some of the potential benefits that can be gained through maker learning and well established Makerspaces. *

Makerspaces spark the brain boost that comes from using one’s hands. Research by psychologists Robert and Michele Root Bernstein indicates that tinkerers are thinkers. Arts and crafts—aka, making—develop such skills as observing, visual thinking, and pattern recognition. They develop habits that include practicing, persevering, and trial-and-error problem solving. The common denominator among many noted scientists, including Einstein, is that hand-based hobbies figured significantly into their personal histories. Making and tinkering expand intellect because a disproportionately large part of the brain’s somatosensory cortex is connected to the hands. Studies show that kids who take notes by hand absorb the lecture material in a deeper way. As philosopher Anaxagoras said, “The hand is the window to the mind.”

Studies also show that one key to success is creating an environment that fosters intrinsic motivation. When passion, rather than compliance, drives the task, success is more likely. Inborn talent or a drive to master a shortcoming might determine the choice of a project. Makerspaces are ideal for

They break the habit of wastefulness. One of the perks of making is that by repurposing what’s readily available, we conjure a sense of resourcefulness, creativity, and empowerment. My father-in-law once said, “I love to take some old broken thing and see what I can do with it.” Combining old elements to bring something new into being is psychologist Rollo May’s definition of creativity. Patrons can bring in broken objects, material fragments, abandoned toys, etc. One person’s junk is another’s treasure, after all.”**

*Excerpt from Curiosity Commons blog

**Exert from Seven Suprising Benefits of a School Makerspace blog

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can not contribute there are many other ways to help.

  • Can you please get the word out about our Makerspace and this short campaign?
    • Use your share tools- or use Indigogo's!
  • Do you have other skills to help us?
    • Grant writing, marketing, a workshop to teach...there are several other ways to help

And finally….

THANK YOU! Words can’t express enough how much this means to me and the children and families who will benefit from this Makerspace.

Below are some interesting infographics if you are new to making. I also included a link to our Makerspace in the Albuquerque Journal.

story:
We've transformed from The Permaculture Life School in Sebastopol to an ONLINE PROGRAM!!!

The Permaculture Student Online

  • 3 month course
  • Weekly videos - 1-2hrs
  • Weekly Q&A Video Responses
  • All Ages
  • Teacher’s Guides
  • Differentiated to Elementary, Middle School & High School Levels
  • Download Everything & Use it Over & Over

This course will run from September 15th until December 15th 2016. It is designed for individuals & families with children of all ages to learn permaculture with a professional educator from the comfort of their own home on their own timetable. Parents can lead younger children through the curriculum, or older children, teens & adults can use it to self-teach. It is designed for students to go at their own pace, & everything can be downloaded & reused as many times as your family needs it.

  • Permaculture Design - homes, landscapes, society, businesses & more
  • Pattern Literacy Building Activites
  • Reading the Landscape
  • Seed to Table Cooking
  • Seed Saving
  • Food Preservation & Storage
  • Hands-On Projects with Step-by-Step Directions & Video
For more info:http://www.thepermaculturestudent.com/shop/thepermaculturestudentonline


Check out our family farm on ValleyPBS:

http://video.valleypbs.org/video/2365449822/



CHECK OUT WHAT THE PERMACULTURE STUDENT TEXTBOOK LOOKS LIKE:

www.thepermaculturestudent.com for more!

A look at the Workbook too:



Endorsed by:

story:
LALA'S CHRISTMAS TREE FOUNDATION BRINGS Hope & Happiness to 1,000  FAMILIES through a Christmas tree and this year we are adding to decorate the homes of 7 families with Christmas lights and paying their electricity bill for the month.

Hi, my name is Alejandra Bustos, but you can call me Lala. I was born in beautiful Guadalajara, but I didn't stay there long. My family was fortunate enough to move to the United States in search of the American dream when I was just one year old. Unfortunately, that dream quickly became a nightmare. We could barely afford to stay in a garage, and some nights we even slept in my Dad’s truck. Then my Dad left, and things got even worse. 

We eventually settled in East Los Angeles, where our reality was poverty, and we were constantly surrounded by gangs and drugs. I was fortunate enough to go to magnet schools in the San Fernando Valley, where I saw how the other half lived. But instead of making me jealous, it only made me more ambitious. But no matter how hopeful I got at school, I'd still come home to my harsh reality. And it got even harder around the holidays.

We used to have a tiny, plastic Christmas tree we would take out of a box during the holiday season. I hated it. It reminded me of how poor and broken our family was. I remember locking myself in my room during the holidays, crying every night. It's not that the tree itself mattered so much, but the tree was the perfect representation of love, light and family that I wanted so badly. Which is what made it so emotional when we finally brought home our first real tree.

That tree meant everything. It wasn't just having something nice in our home during the holidays. It was going out and searching for the perfect tree with other happy families, struggling to get it into the house with no male figure to help, and picking out all the decorations for it. But most importantly, it was a way to spend quality time with my family. The tears came back that day, but they were happy ones when we put that shining star on top of our first real tree. 

I want to bring that joy to as many families as possible. Everyone deserves to feel the love and light of the holiday season, regardless of how much they have. So, I want to raise enough money to buy 1,000 Christmas trees and give them to families who have never had one or are in extreme need & decorate 7 homes with Christmas lights and pay their electricity bill for the month. I just want to give them the HOPE and HAPPINESS that tree gave me and my family and give 7 families their first experience to have lights on their home because till this day I have never had Christmas lights on my home so what a better experience but to make that happen for others. So I need YOUR help to make these families' dreams come true. 

Here's how you can help:

1. GIVE! Each 5-foot Douglas fir (with the base) costs about $20. So, for a thousand families we need $20,000. Last year we were at 1 location over the weekend we distributed the trees and we found that it was hard for families to get transportation to pick up their tree. This year we are estimating a budget of $2,000 for transportation of trees to the schools that will be selected and for possible storage. To decorate 7 homes with Christmas lights and pay their electricity bill we have estimated a $5000 budget. 

2. SHARE! Use the Indiegogo share tools and get the word out. The more people know about this, the more families we can help.

3. VOLUNTEER! If you're in the Southern California area (particularly Los Angeles), we're going to be giving these trees away on the first weekend of December, and we could use a lot of help. Giving away the trees, loading them and helping maintain order at the lot are jobs we can always use more people for. And the reward of being able to hand a family their first Christmas tree is absolutely priceless.

4. NOMINATE! If you know a family in the Southern California area who's never had a tree and really deserves one, use the hashtag #lalaschristmastreefoundation and tag @lala7ali. You can also call/text 323-670-1778 or email lalaschristmastreefoundation@gmail.com If we can, we'll give that family one of the trees!

DETAILS

1. We'll be giving away the trees the first weekend of December. That's 500 trees per day. We will decorate the 7 homes in the period of 2-3 days.

2. If we don't reach our stated goal of $27-30,000, the money still gets divided evenly at $20/tree. So, if we raise $10,000, we'll only give away 400 trees and decorate 3 homes with Christmas lights and pay their bill.

3. If we exceed our goal (fingers crossed!), the extra money will go to more trees, decorations, lights and food.

4. We'll be doing the tree giveaway in East Los Angeles area, South Los Angeles and San Bernardino. Three areas ravaged by poverty and crime that could really use this positivity. But the families themselves can come from anywhere, as long as they can take the trees home themselves.

5. Families will be selected with the help of the Healthy Start Programs and coordinators in schools who can identify families that are in high need. Also, through Instagram nominations and if we have extra trees they will be given away on a first come, first serve basis.

WITH HOPE & HAPPINESS,

Lala

But the families themselves can come from anywhere, as long as they can take the trees home themselves.5. Families will be selected with the help of the Healthy Start Programs and coordinators in schools who can identify families that are in high need. Also, through Instagram nominations and if we have extra trees they will be given away on a first come, first serve basis.WITH HOPE & HAPPINESS,Lala

story:
Who we are?

My name is Konstantinos Evangelou. I am 30 years old, married with Panagiota and father of a beautiful boy who is 3 years old.

I come from a small village called Fylakio belonging to the prefecture of Evros near of the banks of the River Ardas.

It is inhabited by about 500 people who are mainly engaged in the cultivation of the earth.

I work as a farmer with my family which is engaged in the cultivation of land about 50 years.
Our main crops are corn, wheat, sunflowers and small amounts of beet and potatoes.

What is Zea?

Zea is probably the oldest cereal of this world and stood for a key component in the diet of Ancient Greeks. It features an undeniable nutritional value and it is no coincidence that the etymology of the ancient Greek word “ζείδωρος” (zeidoros) meaning life giving” comes from this particular cereal.

Zea’s scientific name is “Triticum dicoccum” and although it externally looks similar to wheat, it has a different nutritional composition. It is largely referred to as Zeia, Spelt and Emmer, but it shouldn’t however be confused with the German Dinkel or rye.

Zea is highly nutritious and contains important nutrients, which make it superior to other cereals. Zea is two times richer in dietary fiber, in comparison with other wheat, a fact that makes it a good choice for people suffering from diabetes.

In addition, Zea is two times richer in protein and features a high content of the amino acid lysine and vitamins A, B, C and E. Lysine is that particular component of proteins that increases their digestibility, boosts the immune system and it’s a key element for the brain’s biochemical functioning.

Another key advantage of Zea is its high content in magnesium, up to 40% higher in comparison with other cereals. Zea is also very low in gluten, a fact that makes it highly digestible.

The cultivation of Zea seems to go back for more than 12,000 years, as revealed by excavations in prehistoric settlements throughout Greece, and according to historical texts, Alexander the Great’s soldiers would eat Zea, in order to remain strong and healthy.

It seems that Zea’s production was so widespread in antiquity that it is possible that the Port of Zea in Pireus took its name from this cereal because of the related increased trafficking and transactions that took place there.

Until about a century ago, Zea was one of the most popular wheat in Greece, but over the years it seems that more economically profitable cereal crops such as rice or wheat prevailed.

The year 1928 and progressively banned until 1932 completely abolished the cultivation of Zea in Greece. Indeed until the dictionaries “disappeared” the term Zea! Only in the dictionary “Helios” is a relative description, the later mostly dictionaries the word is analyzed as a feed! Followed by the cultivation of wheat mutant, the purpose of this operation what else? The stupefaction of the Greeks. As one researcher has said in England in the mutant cause shrinkage of the brain in animals.

What We Need

 1.500.000 USD is what we need to start our business.

Τhe money needed to be invested in the purchase of equipment as below:

  • Τractor supply and various machines for it.
  • Combine harvester supply.
  • Processing laboratory creation of Zea flour.
  • Construction drier for drying of Zea.
  • Trucksupply for the transportation of Zea from the field to drying.

Job Creation

The jobs that will be created through our project will amount to 13 and adressed to the villagers.They will be a huge help as the economic crisis in Greece has deprived many people their job, forcing them to live through poverty.

Why you should help us?

The crisis generates ideas and oppurtunities.

With our idea, we have the opportunity to prove that we are not lazy Greeks, that we want to have the right to work an we can share with the world the treasures of the Greek land.

With the Greek goverment absent from innovative ideas this is too difficult.            For this reason we are asking for your help.

Are all this feasible?

Yes!Funding can really help us because it's just a case of getting on and doing it.

What you get

  • Pledge 3 USD and get a big smile and a bigger THANK YOU.
  • Pledge 5 USD and get a e-postcart from the river Ardas.
  • Pledge 20 USD and get a e-cook book with Zea flour recipes.
  • Pledge 50 USD an get a e-photoalbum from Filakio village and surroundings.
  • Pledge 500 USD and your name will be engraved on the bricks of our Zea workshop.

Do you have any link to Indiegogo?

I've never been involved with Indiegogo before.

Do you think that you can reach the target?

I hope very much that the campain will reach the target. I think that the idea of cultivation a crop like Zea that is grown in the depths of time and it is so beneficial to humans, could be implemented.

What will happend if the money exceeded the USD 1.500.000?

There will be foundation to http://www.sos-villages.gr/


Sorry

Forgive me for misspelings!!!

Greetings

Greetings to all of you from this little corner of Grecce called Fylakio.

story:
Pirate Roaming is a mobile app that allows you to make and receive international calls at the same price of local ones, using true voice calls instead of calls via Internet (like Skype and other VoIP services): so you are free to talk, on the go, to your family & friends abroad!

You can also be reachable while abroad, by purchasing a "Pirate Number" inside our app: this revolutionary feature will allow you to receive calls from your country of origin (or any other country), as if you were there.

And it's 100% legal!


1) Install our app: this will raise our ranking in app stores and our visibility will be increased! 

2) Share this campaign with your friends who are abroad and those who have their relatives living in another country: you will help them to keep in touch more often and strengthen their relationships! 

3) Pledge to our project: we need money to advertise our app, improve User Experience and overall reliability. You'll get half of your money back, plus a bonus, in calling credit within the app, the other half in promo codes that you can give to your friend as a gift.




The story starts with one of the first pioneers of mobile Internet: Emanuele Preda, a serial entrepreneur with more than 20 years of Computer Science, TLC and Marketing background.

The app is the result of almost two years of work of four developers, but it’s still nothing compared to the ambitious plans of unlashing expats & travelers freedom to communicate.

The Company is registered in London with headquarters in Malta, and already received a strong validation.


Nowadays our app needs 1 KB of data per each placed call. With your help we can further develop the technology, allowing to place calls even when you don't have any data connection at all!

story:
We're an ancient tribe of many different ages and countries, that have reunited to do this endeavor.  This is our dharma and we feel we have been called to create...

The Star Seeds Center of Pai.   Right now it's an imperative time for humanity to come together. It's time to heal ourselves and the planet. Working internationally with all cultures.  We have the opportunity in Pai to work with people from all over the world coming together to share their gifts.  Everyone is a very important piece to the puzzle of our consciousness.   We are working to open creative outlets to help us in our evolution, healing and transcendence that teaches us to get in touch with our true nature and open the door to a world of possibilities.  Workshops will vary depending on the teachers. Many forms of Meditation, happiness, yoga, dance, music, theater, art, design, reiki, energy work, astrology, raw food and poetry workshops will be offered.  Many more to come! Working to ignite the light and love within us to share with the world.  Transforming the base metals of your pain into the golden light of the universe.  We invite you to open your heart and your mind.  All ages welcome! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for financial support so we can keep the space we have found.  We are in need of more equipment for our workshops and supplies.  Those who donate will be given the opportunity to attend workshops free of charge and other access to the center.  Case by case.   You are helping to support the planetary energy.  What you donate is going towards helping Humanity .  Not only are you doing a good deed but you are helping yourself by helping others to heal and evolve into their best self.  We are one consciousness, one body, and one being.  If one suffers, we all suffer.  

The Impact

Creating strength, love, compassion, knowledge and creativity amongst people from all walks of life and from all over the world.  What is learned and shared here will be given back all over the world and recycled into the interweaving web of knowledge, to help this generation and generations to come.   We are extremely grateful for any help we can get.  We need to come together.  We greatly value the important role you play in this picture. 

 We are always welcoming you to come and share your gifts and ideas in this space.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to help us financially, spreading the word and sharing this with as many people as you can is EXTREMELY helpful.  We also welcome your positive vibes and  energetic support.  Namaste.  Thank you all so much, we are extremely grateful for you all.   We LOVE you

story: .

Short Summary

Hi!  I'm Jai (rhymes with sky).  And I'm a dedicated zen junkie from Calgary, Canada.  

I've taught and facilitated meditation groups for several years but took the past two years to focus on family and to deepen my own personal meditation practices.  And now it's time to rebuild and open a meditation centre, one that is accessible online with daily live stream classes and a catalogue of pre-recorded guided meditations.

Sort of an online ashram, if you will.

A perfect solution for busy people who want the zen life.  Simply log on, tune in, and attend your class within your very own online meditation community.

A little about me... I've studied meditation for the past decade and a half (in its so many forms)  and have been featured in news articles because of my interests and work in meditation, as well as appearances on television.  Recently in Calgary, I was given the opportunity to present  meditation seminars at the public school boards staff convention.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need $ 15,000 to get this project going.  Much of this (approximately $7,000.00) is needed to build a fully interactive membership site where daily scheduled meditation groups and classes are live streamed with unlimited access for members.  There will be regular live streamed meditation groups daily for an individual to participate in, truly becoming part of our meditation community.

The rest of the contributions will be used to secure and maintain a meditation centre location in Calgary where the classes and groups can be facilitated for the website.  This centre will be available to members in the area who prefer to attend live classes instead of logging in through the online meditation centre located in SW Calgary.




With your pre-purchase of a membership for either the online or brick and mortar centre, you can help make this dream a reality!   A perfect solution for those ready to start a dedicated meditation practice but who need the support, encouragement and disciplined schedule to make it happen. 

If only a  portion of the $ 15,000 is raised, the online centre and the Calgary location will still happen with a May 2016 launch.  Just on a smaller scale and with a humble beginning.  :)

The Centre, both location and online, will hold up to 80+ meditation based classes and groups every month.  These classes will include:

  • Daily Zen meditation groups from 6:30 - 7:30 am M-F
  • Kinhin meditation every other day
  • Afternoon classes and groups using a variety of guided meditations, such as, self healing, zero point energy, merkaba, pranic, and 61 point to name just a few. 
  • Emotional transmutation
  • Vapassana
  • Pranayama
  • Meditation over Medication
  • Power of Mind
  • LGBTQ Zen - Evenings for like minded individuals of the lgbtq community to meet and meditate.
  • Kuji In
  • Chant groups - mantra meditation
  • Qi Gong

This is just a small sample of groups and classes that will be available.

The online memberships will have the same access to all classes and groups as the location members.  There will be a live feed for each event, with a forum for people to get to know each other.  Also, Q&A and discussion after each class which includes our online members will further bring our Zen community together.

The centre will be open 7 days a week with some evenings, giving members the flexibility they need to tailor make a meditation schedule that fits them.   If an individual is interested in developing a meditation practice and will be practicing more than twice a week, Zen is the perfect solution to overcoming any obstacles that may be present in fulfilling this.

The Impact

Having an online meditation centre, as well as, a local centre is essential in growing our meditation community worldwide.  It creates a unique and welcoming place for people to meet and develop a sustainable meditation practice to grow and evolve as a group.  While a physical location certainly fills the need of many who enjoy and value personal growth, individuals who are unable to attend a physical location miss out on the aspect of a community of like minded people and growing within it, together.  

I have facilitated meditation groups for several years.  Some of these were, for a period of a few months, in remote areas that were unable to access meditation groups and simply relied on youtube or bought guided meditations.   While these are wonderful resources to have, there was no comparison in coming together to help and nurture each other in our personal evolution.  While I did have to eventually move, many individuals within those groups were able to develop a solid foundation for a continued meditation practice and kept up their gatherings.  There are people all over the world who need this type of support to get themselves going on a path of personal inward success.  An online community provides this for many, whether they live in remote areas, are disabled, elderly, have children or a crazy work schedule that simply makes it impossible to attend a group meditation.  And offering a live stream access point to gather is the perfect space to develop this sense of belonging and community.

Risks & Challenges

Building a community like this requires commitment, dedication and persistence.  Am I up to this challenge?  Absolutely!  I have given much thought and consideration to this over the course of the past year and I am ready to dedicate myself to the centre.  Early mornings?  No problem!  Long days?  Got it covered! 

It also requires continued support through the purchase of memberships.  This will require continued marketing.  It will also require accessibility to the centre to keep interest and momentum going, to make a membership really worth having. 

As the Zen centre and it's community grows, it will enable us to offer a greater variety of services to our members, more classes and groups from a number of instructors and regular and longer hours.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you have read and feel this would be an asset to our global community, there are a few ways you can help make this happen!

  • Choose a perk and contribute!  Every perk gives you something usable and with equal value.  Pre-purchasing a class or membership will fast track our goal of bringing Zen to life.
  • Spread the word and tell your friends!
  • Share this campaign on your social media.

story:
Summary

We are Student Success U, bringing real world expertise and what college doesn’t teach to Student America. We are dedicated to making a genuine and meaningful impact on the lives of today's students. Whether you are a parent, adviser, student mentor, or coach - we greatly value your contribution!

Our founder – TJ Pingitore – has over 20 years’ experience in business ranging from Fortune 500 to startups, and has personally mentored over 1,500 students. As a result, he understands exactly what students are and aren’t getting from their college experiences. Having self-funded his entire education while in college, TJ knew that, for him, missing a tuition or loan repayment wasn’t an option. That not only taught him the value of hard work, it taught him how to be creative in order to network effectively, stand out, and get hired.  

Our team – the SSU Crew – is comprised largely of recent graduates who know first-hand the challenges students face today. Combining backgrounds in higher education, business administration, content creation, video and audio productions, evaluation, public relations, and graphic design, we’re a small team driven by our passion to help students get ahead, get happy, and get hired.

But we cannot do it alone. We’re launching a three-tiered Student Success Engine. It consists of an online platform, on-campus program, and global podcast. We’re raising funds in order to onboard additional team members, further develop our platform (currently in production), and bring awareness of Student Success to 21 million students in the United States.

We aren’t just solving one problem. We’re solving a series of problems students face today. We call this the $1.45 Trillion Gap – the approximate total of student debt in the United States today. That debt is spread between 44 million borrows! Yikes.

We aren’t promising to solve the student debt crisis. But we are your insurance policy on the $200,000 price tag of your son or daughter’s education.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise an initial $50,000 dollars in order to fully get our platform, program, and podcast in front of students. We’re factoring in a conservative budget, but any addition funds we raise will go to further development of our platform and scaling up our marketing efforts during the current academic year.

We’ve all heard today’s students say, “The struggle is real.” We prefer to say the hustle is real. That’s the message we’re going to bring with the help of moms, dads, and contributors like you, who share our vision to get students real world prepared.

For those that do, we have some pretty cool perks. As an early supporter, you will also have the chance to become an early adopter. Pitching in at the $97 mark gets you early access to our What College Doesn’t Teach course, currently under development, and a Success Squad shirt! This is a one-time fee for the first 15,000 students. This package will never be this low again. Once it’s gone, it’s gone. As we grow and build, more will be added, so the price of our course will go up!

See the column to the right for more perks and offers! > > >

Rest assured, we not going to rest until we’ve reached (and exceeded) our goal. Seriously. We will not rest. We have lots of coffee, we’ve thrown away the key to the office, and surrender is not in our vocabulary. Every student in the country needs this now!

If you see any of our moms – please tell them we’ll be home soon, and to kindly feed the cat. Also, if you know any locksmiths, please get in touch.

The Impact

College students today lack relevant, step-by-step direction, focus, and real world perspective. They’re getting a quality education, but as we all know, it comes with a hefty price tag.

We wholeheartedly believe college is still the best way for students to learn, grow, and open doors to their future. Unfortunately, they’re not developing all the critical soft skills they need to be successful from the college experience alone. That changes with us.

That’s what our total student success experience does. It goes where they are, through our podcast in their headphones, our platform online, and our program on campus. We focus on the real world skills your students need to succeed, including branding and marketing themselves, proactive strategies to get ahead, and improving people and soft skills. We’re proven, we’re practical, and we run parallel to what students get in college.

That’s what makes Student Success U the perfect complement to your son or daughter’s education. With your generous help, we can make student success every student’s reality.

What Our Students Say

"Student Success U provides students with the necessary tools needed to successfully stand out. I was able to take strategies right away and use them to further my job preparation upon graduation."

-​Christina Diecidue | Rider University Class of 2016 | Sr. Class President

 

​"When I went through the platform, all I could think was why didn’t I have this when I was getting started. SSU helped me finalize some key things for my new profession following graduation."

​-Michelle Knoeppel | Penn State High Honors Grad 2014 | #1 STEM

 

​"When I started using the SSU platform I realized quickly how much really goes into a job search. From how I can use tech platforms to how I connected with people in my field with their strategies, the process that SSU took me through I would recommend that all students go through it. For me it was eye opening what it takes to get a job today."

-​Colin Murray | Marist College Class of 2014 | 2-year ROTC | Criminal Justice

 

"The earlier you do it the less money and time you will have wasted and the more ahead of the pack you will be."

-Victoria Slinger | Monmouth University Class of 2015 | Honors

 

​"SSU is true real world preparation for whatever the world has in store. Their program and strategies really put my ideas, interests, and personal brand in order with a solid foundation that I can build on; that any student can build on."

-​Dan Malafronte | Brookdale Community College Class of 2017

 

"Working with TJ and SSU helped me build the confidence to start my own empire. SSU is a platform that any student in any major can highly benefit from. We all need to know how to market ourselves for sure."

-Jessica Gannon | Wilkes College Graduate | NCAA Student Athlete

Risks & Challenges

While all startups have risks, we have done our best to mitigate these by extensively validating the market. We did this by speaking with hundreds of recent post grads, current college students, hiring managers, professors, university administrators, and – most of all, you – moms and dads. We’ve taken all that – and combined with our experience – molded it into a clear, step-by-step process that will help students where they need it most.  

There is very little risk in terms of us failing to deliver product or services. The first season of our podcast launched Sept. 27th on iTunes, our platform is in development and beta testing, and our first student ambassadors are already taking their campuses by storm. The only missing ingredient is moms and dads like you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’ve already made a commitment, thank you! If you'd like to help us spread our mission even more, there are a few ways you can do so. Start with one or two people you think this would be relevant for and share the link.

Then, subscribe to The Student Success Podcast on Apple Podcasts (iTunes), Stitcher, and Google Play. Please share with your son, daughter, or a college student you know. We’d be very grateful for anyone who takes a minute and leaves us a short review. Once you’ve subscribed, all you have to do is go to the podcast player of your choice, type in ‘the student success podcast’ into the search box, and click on the review tab.

You can also head to our website (studentsuccessu.com) and have your son or daughter sign up for The 10 Day Student Success Challenge. It’s totally free, and our brief 10 day guide and video series will get them set up with a firm foundation for success.

We’re every parents’ insurance policy for their son or daughter’s education. So don’t forget to share our Indiegogo page with fellow moms and dads using the share tools next to the video player above.

From all of us at the Student Success U Team, we appreciate your support!
story_txt: SummaryWe are Student Success U, bringing real world expertise and what college doesn’t teach to Student America. We are dedicated to making a genuine and meaningful impact on the lives of today's students. Whether you are a parent, adviser, student mentor, or coach - we greatly value your contribution!Our founder – TJ Pingitore – has over 20 years’ experience in business ranging from Fortune 500 to startups, and has personally mentored over 1,500 students. As a result, he understands exactly what students are and aren’t getting from their college experiences. Having self-funded his entire education while in college, TJ knew that, for him, missing a tuition or loan repayment wasn’t an option. That not only taught him the value of hard work, it taught him how to be creative in order to network effectively, stand out, and get hired.  Our team – the SSU Crew – is comprised largely of recent graduates who know first-hand the challenges students face today. Combining backgrounds in higher education, business administration, content creation, video and audio productions, evaluation, public relations, and graphic design, we’re a small team driven by our passion to help students get ahead, get happy, and get hired.But we cannot do it alone. We’re launching a three-tiered Student Success Engine. It consists of an online platform, on-campus program, and global podcast. We’re raising funds in order to onboard additional team members, further develop our platform (currently in production), and bring awareness of Student Success to 21 million students in the United States.We aren’t just solving one problem. We’re solving a series of problems students face today. We call this the $1.45 Trillion Gap – the approximate total of student debt in the United States today. That debt is spread between 44 million borrows! Yikes.We aren’t promising to solve the student debt crisis. But we are your insurance policy on the $200,000 price tag of your son or daughter’s education.What We Need & What You GetWe need to raise an initial $50,000 dollars in order to fully get our platform, program, and podcast in front of students. We’re factoring in a conservative budget, but any addition funds we raise will go to further development of our platform and scaling up our marketing efforts during the current academic year.We’ve all heard today’s students say, “The struggle is real.” We prefer to say the hustle is real. That’s the message we’re going to bring with the help of moms, dads, and contributors like you, who share our vision to get students real world prepared.For those that do, we have some pretty cool perks. story:
UPDATE

Thanks to our generous supporters who contributed through offline donations! 

Your support will help students cover the expenses of their first year of study, take required English language tests or submit university applications!

About us

Al Nayzak for Supportive Education and Scientific Innovation is Palestinian non-profit, non- partisan, Jerusalemite and unique initiative that looks for young talents in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM), and plants an ambitious vision in the hearts of our community:“To develop, root, and reinforce a new culture that embraces science, and to announce this culture among Palestinian youth so that their competence in productive applied sciences could provide them with better economic opportunities that would lead to their future prosperity.

Al Nayzak with a group of Palestinian philanthropists has designed "Horizons" program that aims to support innovative Jerusalemite students in Palestine to achieve distinguished higher education in internationally acclaimed universities through optimizing international networks, skills enhancement and development, and providing preparatory opportunities.

Our Campaign aims to sponsor "Horizons" unique students through providing them with the needed financial support to start their studies in their choice of university. It will be the corner stone for a periodic student fund that will support "Horizons" current and future participants. 

Your SUPPORT means helping innovative students start their first year of university, or complete a foundation year in their prospective universities!

Horizons is currently supporting 37 Jerusalemite students from grades 9-12 through personalized tracks that include mentorship and guidance in life skills, academic excellence, and career orientation. Our students have worked a whole year now, taking steps towards achieving their dreams, they have high ambitions, high grades, and excellent academic records.

 

How You can help students

The average tuition fees cost for one student is 40,000$/ year, and with your HELP two "Horizons" students will be able to enroll in international universities for the next academic year. Our annual target is to support four outstanding  students aiming to study at the world's top universities, and any donations received beyond this target will go to our "Horizons" - Jerusalemite student fund, to support other students. 

 

 

Meet some of our students!

Your contribution will help Jerusalemite students fulfill their ambitions and will shape future Palestinian leaders and Entrepreneurs!

 

 

     

    Pledges are not the only way you can HELP!

    • SPREAD the word.. Help our campaign reach more backers!
    • Share our Indiegogo Campaign page on your social media, we'll make sure to keep all supporters updated!
    • Visit our program page: http://www.alnayzak.org/en-horizons

story:
Short Summary

Imagine waking up in a world where you don't know who your local Mayor is...in fact imagine a world where you don't know who most of your locally elected officials are. That is the world that most Americans live in today. Through Politicking we are able to create transparency between candidate and constituent by demystifying the way users have been traditionally informed about politics.  

  • Politicking is important because millennials represent the second largest generation of this country's electorate, without our votes we willingly allow America's politics to engage in business as usual. In the most recent 2018 elections only 31% of millennials turned out. Surveys say that millennials feel politically disengaged, apathetic and unclear about candidate positions and local issues that are up for referendum. 
  • Politicking solves these issues by providing this information in a way our peers are accustomed to receiving it-- through their mobile devices. 

What We Need & What You Get

But we can't do this without your help:

  • We are looking to raise $200,000 dollars to get this product to market before the 2020 elections. Every single dollar counts so we can bring Politicking to YOUR local city. 
  • In fact the more people donate in your region, the more counties we can cover in that region. So be sure to REPRESENT. 
  • One thing that seems to affect founders of color disproportionately is that oftentimes they can receive a round of applause from their communities, but not a round of funding. We believe we can break that mold TODAY. The funds for Politicking will help with the scalability of our product, UI/UX design, marketing, API development, big data and building a team.  

The Impact

Every single dollar contributed to the Politicking campaign will be spent to bring this project to life. 

  • We are a NON-PARTISAN organization that if more concerned with ensuring that people get out in make an educated and informed vote. We are less concerned about WHO they vote for. 

About the Founders

My name is Wen-kuni Ceant and in 2016, my co-founder Jordan Wilson and I decided to come up with a solution to an issue that challenged Americans throughout the country...by reimagining the way users interface with information about local, state and national candidates, their platforms and the infamous amendments and referendums that confuse us all.

We met at Howard University in 2014. After becoming close friends, we sought out to tackle bigger issues...like dismantling the high rates of voter oppression/illiteracy within their communities.

Our Credentials speak for themselves: I am a Fulbright Scholar that attended both Howard and Drexel University for her Bachelors and Masters degrees respectively and Jordan Wilson is a law school bound Public Service Scholar at Harvard College, where she oversees civic engagement initiatives including the Harvard Votes Challenge that have well prepared us both for the challenges that we will encounter in building Politicking.

Other Ways You Can Help

Although not everyone can contribute FINANCIALLY, you can still help:

  • Send this to at least 5 friends to get the word out about Politicking
  • Post this on your Facebook (facebook.com/Politickingtheapp), Twitter (@politickingapp) , Instagram (@politickingtheapp), Bumble, Tinder...you get the picture
  • Send this to your local media organization 
  • Send this to your Pastor and church friends
  • Send this to your rich uncle/aunt that is a secret political junkie
  • Send this to your boyfriend/girlfriend that you wish paid attention to Politics
  • Send this to an friend or colleague that loves Politics
  • Send this to someone who was super excited about the Presidential debates
  • Send this to someone who had no idea what was going on during the Presidential debate
  • POLITICKING IS FOR EVERYONE, LET'S GET TO IT. 

The time is NOW. 

Feel free to contact Wen-kuni@politickingapp.com or Jordan@politickingapp.com if you are interested in further assisting the project.

story:
Short Summary

  • Music is a passion. You probably already know this, since you’re reading this. I have been sharing this passion through teaching, performing and conducting since I was 18 years old.

  • Over the years, I have collected a number of approaches to help my students solve different playing difficulties. From these, I have designed a teaching method for flute playing that combines the knowledge I received from my own teachers together with the fruits of my own learning process and that of my students. This way MyFlute is born!

  • For my generation, books and recordings were our main sources for learning and expanding our knowledge. Today, with the growth of different internet platforms, a book simply isn’t enough — nor does it have to be. A video can provide students, pupils, teachers, and flute lovers with the clearest and most accessible explanations about what they can do in order to fully enjoy their playing experience and, hopefully, resolve any issues that may arise.

  • You help create a platform for a community sharing a love for playing the flute, and playing it well, to grow.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Countless hours have been spent researching and creating the method, hundreds of hours of recordings and editing, hours and hours spent creating the platform, the website and categorizing the videos. Your contribution makes it possible to bring the platform to life!
  • There are various perks for the amounts you pledge to the campaign, ranging from your name being written down on the platform as a supporter of MyFlute to early access to the content, one-on-one lessons, concerts (both in person and online), custom videos and shout-outs and much more
  • All and each amount you pledge to the campaign bring the platform closer to the goal - spreading the knowledge of flute playing to all those interested worldwide

 

The Impact

  • Whether you are a student, a beginner, a professional flutist or someone who studied it as a child, the MyFlute platform is suited for all levels and keeps the joy and pleasure of playing the flute while allowing you to focus on the different aspects of performing music: sound, breath, position, etc.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Feel free to share the campaign with your friends, family, acquaintances and anyone you believe might be interested in the myFlute platform. By sharing the campaign you are putting the corner stone towards building its community.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word easier ;)

Thank you!
