story:
Cloud computing is redefining how we build applications and businesses, reaping the benefits of economies of scale, leading to the death of traditional data centers.

According to Gartner, 80% of enterprises will no longer use traditional data centers by 2025. Moreover, 68% of cloud services delivered today are being delivered by hyper-scale providers, such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform. 

 

Visionaries such as Elon Musk, leading the transformation towards postmodern technology on the edge of a new industrial revolution perhaps one of the best examples.

A vision as such requires a mountain of resources to execute, and that is where cloud computing shines, and that is how you have an opportunity to create an impact in the next industrial revolution!

  • The key impacts of this change?
  • How does it affect developers & tech experts?
  • Why you should get on the cloud computing bandwagon?

 

 

Hybrid and Multi-Cloud strategies will play a key role!
A plethora of organizations and enterprises are attempting to enable hybrid and multi-cloud strategy transitions, dipping their toes into cloudy waters aiming to be risk-free and cost-optimized.

Industry 4.0: The fourth industrial revolution is transforming how human intellect could ever perform. Imagine how that will change the world and your work in the next 5-10 years! We’re just breaking the ice and getting the ball rolling for what is to come next and how you can be at the forefront and take the next step in your career. Hence, this is absolutely why this brand new course is so highly requested.

In the past 3 years, according to Indeed.com, the demand for cloud computing roles from employers has hiked up to nearly 33%, and job seekers’ interest has surged to a whopping 108%. And yet, in terms of resources and talent, we fail to meet the demand.

 

 

Currently, in the market majority of the cloud-related job hunt and activity relates to the biggest cloud providers such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform. Moreover, cloud expertise is not solely restricted to personnel who are in charge of infrastructure in the organization, these skills are in demand now for many full stack and backend developer roles.

 

 

 

We are here to fast track your expertise in multi-cloud knowledge and grow your career with our extremely requested quality course created by our industry expert(s) so you can build your very own server-less multi-cloud application with several real-life business case scenarios in no time. 

 

 

Cloud engineers are handsomely paid. As per Forbes, Cloud engineer is one of the top 15 high paying jobs today. And with your potential newly acquired multi-cloud expertise, you are bumping yourself to the uppermost percentile of the range.

 

 

We have a whole website with video tutorials dedicated to teaching you from scratch the information you need to start your server-less technology journey on the cloud. 

 

 

Our previous course was a success with over 6000 students! And we have received feedback and improved our way of teaching, we follow a student's first criteria. Thanks to our students we want to do more and make sure we provide the best resources for learning at Cloudship.

 

We hope that you are as excited about this course as we are at Cloudship. Cloud computing will grow even more in the upcoming future. As more organizations adopt cloud computing, the more will be the demand for cloud engineers. So clearly, the cloud engineer job profile will continue to be in high demand and we want to provide you with the best content on cloud technology.

And we need your help to make this a reality.

Welcome aboard!
story_txt:
Cloud computing is redefining how we build applications and businesses, reaping the benefits of economies of scale, leading to the death of traditional data centers.According to Gartner, 80% of enterprises will no longer use traditional data centers by 2025. Moreover, 68% of cloud services delivered today are being delivered by hyper-scale providers, such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform.  Visionaries such as Elon Musk, leading the transformation towards postmodern technology on the edge of a new industrial revolution perhaps one of the best examples.A vision as such requires a mountain of resources to execute, and that is where cloud computing shines, and that is how you have an opportunity to create an impact in the next industrial revolution!
The key impacts of this change?
How does it affect developers & tech experts?
Why you should get on the cloud computing bandwagon?
  Hybrid and Multi-Cloud strategies will play a key role!A plethora of organizations and enterprises are attempting to enable hybrid and multi-cloud strategy transitions, dipping their toes into cloudy waters aiming to be risk-free and cost-optimized.Industry 4.0: The fourth industrial revolution is transforming how human intellect could ever perform. Imagine how that will change the world and your work in the next 5-10 years! We’re just breaking the ice and getting the ball rolling for what is to come next and how you can be at the forefront and take the next step in your career. Hence, this is absolutely why this brand new course is so highly requested.In the past 3 years, according to Indeed.com, the demand for cloud computing roles from employers has hiked up to nearly 33%, and job seekers’ interest has surged to a whopping 108%. And yet, in terms of resources and talent, we fail to meet the demand.  Currently, in the market majority of the cloud-related job hunt and activity relates to the biggest cloud providers such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform. Moreover, cloud expertise is not solely restricted to personnel who are in charge of infrastructure in the organization, these skills are in demand now for many full stack and backend developer roles.  
 We are here to fast track your expertise in multi-cloud knowledge and grow your career with our extremely requested quality course created by our industry expert(s) so you can build your very own server-less multi-cloud application with several real-life business case scenarios in no time.   Cloud engineers are handsomely paid. As per Forbes, Cloud engineer is one of the top 15 high paying jobs today. And with your potential newly acquired multi-cloud expertise, you are bumping yourself to the uppermost percentile of the range.  We have a whole website with video tutorials dedicated to teaching you from scratch the information you need to start your server-less technology journey on the cloud.   Our previous course was a success with over 6000 students! And we have received feedback and improved our way of teaching, we follow a student's first criteria. Thanks to our students we want to do more and make sure we provide the best resources for learning at Cloudship. We hope that you are as excited about this course as we are at Cloudship. Cloud computing will grow even more in the upcoming future. As more organizations adopt cloud computing, the more will be the demand for cloud engineers. So clearly, the cloud engineer job profile will continue to be in high demand and we want to provide you with the best content on cloud technology.And we need your help to make this a reality.Welcome aboard!

story:
Click Here for the English version of our pitch text!


Operación Kino

Queremos cambiar la vida de mas de 100 niños en situación difícil (al año) y mejorar las capacidades de la institución que los alberga. 

"Operación Kino" es un plan de acciones estratégicas con el que buscamos cambiar completamente la situación actual del "Instituto Kino" A.C., que por mas de 50 años se ha dedicado a brindar techo, alimento, educación y por sobre todo una formación digna y humanista a cientos de niños en situaciones difíciles y de abandono. 

Queremos ayudar a que el Instituto Kino pueda formar personas con mayores posibilidades de integrarse a una fuerza laboral cada vez mas demandante, introducirlos a nuevas tecnologías e ideas y al mismo tiempo reducir el gasto corriente de la institución, para que esta pueda seguir ayudando.

Que haremos con el dinero?
Acerca del proyecto
Enfoques Principales
Recompensas


Acciones

Con tu apoyo, haremos lo siguiente:

- Páneles solares por 5 Kw, consumo total de la escuela del instituto Kino.

·  Instalaremos un sistema fotovoltaico equivalente al consumo total de la primaria Instituto Kino, sistema que permitirá a los niños conocer el mundo de las energías renovables y a su vez tener un impacto financiero en la institución. Un ahorro total de más de $24,000 al año. 

- Calentadores de agua solares  por el total de capacidad actual de boilers

· Instalaremos calentadores solares que reemplazaran el total de capacidad actual de boilers (calentadores por quema de gas) para suministrar con agua caliente cocina, baño y dormitorios. Esto tendrá un impacto financiero para la institución y expone a los niños a diferentes tecnologías e introduce una cultura de respeto por los recursos. Un ahorro total de 380 kg de gas LP. 

- Huerto Escolar con el enfoque de permacultura.

· La implementación de un Huerto Escolar de >75m2 con un enfoque de permacultura, así como una serie de pláticas y clases que serán impartidas por nuestros amigos de "Color Tierra, A.C.", expertos en la materia para crear conciencia, educar y aportar diversidad a la educación de los niños. El objetivo de este huerto es que eventualmente sea una fuente de alimentos para su consumo en el instituto. 

- Kits de robótica.

· 5 kits para taller de robótica, además de capacitación a los docentes para que pueda continuar la impartición del curso para futuras generaciones. Aportar a la diversidad y calidad de la educación de los niños internos para transmitirles habilidades y capacidades relevantes para un mercado laboral en constante evolución.

- Mural artístico.

· Embellecer el espacio donde reciben educación. Promover e inspirar las actividades artísticas dentro de la currícula educativa de la institución.

E impulsaremos y organizaremos las siguientes clases:

-Robótica.

-Introducción a la sustentabilidad.

-Introducción a energías renovables.

-Permacultura.

Todo esto lo podemos lograr con un presupuesto de $25,000 dólares, si logramos recaudar esta cantidad con tus aportaciones, la institución se verá beneficiada inmediatamente y serán duraderos.

*En caso de no llegar a la meta, el dinero recaudado será utilizado para completar las acciones de educación, sustentabilidad y embellecimiento, en ese orden. 
** En el video mencionamos que necesitamos solo 1,000 personas que apoyen con $100, nuestro proyecto cambió y creció, por lo que nuestro presupuesto también.



Acerca del proyecto

El proyecto.

"Operación Kino" es elaborado por:

-Luis Ernesto Ortiz Villalón, Lic. en Finanzas y Especialista en Desarrollo Sustentable.

-Omar Acosta Sánchez, Ing. en Mecatrónica y Especialista en Desarrollo Sustentable.

Ambos compartimos un interés especial en el Instituto Kino: Nuestros padres recibieron albergue por parte de la misma institución como estudiantes de escasos recursos. Hoy queremos ayudar a que la institución siga haciendo lo mismo y de una mejor manera por muchas familias futuras

El proyecto nace de la inquietud de contribuir y ayudar a solventar parte de las necesidades actuales de el Instituto Kino, que, siendo éstas muchas y diversas, enfocamos en acciones dirigidas a la sustentabilidad del lugar y mejorar la curricula educativa, buscando causar el mayor impacto posible para elevar la calidad de vida de los niños. 

Buscamos reducir los gastos operativos de la Institución para poder realizar inversiones en lo verdaderamente importante: la educación y el cuidado de los niños que habitan la casa hogar.

"Creemos fielmente que la mejor forma de cambiar el mundo es trabajando de forma activa y acertada."

Operación Kino es un proyecto que consta de 5 acciones que logran un impacto directo y significativo en la vida de los niños que habitan la casa hogar y reducen el gasto corriente del lugar.

Enfoques Principales:

-Sustentabilidad.

-Energías renovables.

-Educación.

-Tecnología.

-Permacultura.

Con tu ayuda vamos a mejorar las condiciones del lugar y principalmente mejorar el nivel educativo: 
Vamos a darles clases de robótica y de permacultura, e introducirlos directamente al mundo de las energías limpias y el desarrollo sustentable. 

Juntos podemos lograr un cambio significativo en la vida de los niños que alberga la institución, al tiempo que buscamos aumentar su capacidad y eficiencia operativa.


Recompensas:
Para lograr nuestra meta, hemos reunido un grupo de artistas, artesanos, emprendedores, activistas y especialistas locales, nacionales, e internacionales, que están convencidos del impacto del proyecto y cooperan al dedicar su tiempo desde el proceso de planeación, operación y ofreciendo su trabajo y conocimientos como recompensa para ti benefactor. 

Las recompensas físicas serán enviadas una semana después de terminada la campaña.

Las recompensas digitales serán enviadas durante la campaña. 


English

Operación Kino

We want to change the lives of over 100 kids a year that are in difficult social situation, by improving the capabilities of the institution that hosts them. 

“Operación Kino” in a strategic action plan devised to completely change the current situation of “Instituto Kino”, which for more than 50 years has been devoted to give house, food and education, but above all, a dignified & humanistic education to hundreds of kids per year that are in abanodonment  and other difficult situations. 

With your help we want to improve the conditions of the place and most importantly, to improve the education: We want to introduce them to robotics & permaculture, to show them first hand the world of clean energies and sustainable development, and hoping to light an interest in arts & culture.

We want to help Instituto Kino to be able to foster and  educate kids that in the future will have a better chance at a competitive job, introducing them to new technologies, new ideas. While we do all this, we will be reducing the operation costs of the place, allowing for expenses & investment in what truly matter: the kids well being.

What are we doing?
 About the project
 Scope of the project
 Rewards

What are we doing?

This is what we'll do with your help:

-Solar Panels for a 5 kwH capacity, totaling the school’s energy bill.

We will install a solar panel array that will cover the total energy bill for Instituto Kino’s elementary school. This will allow the kids to know first hand the world and concepts of renewable energies. At the same time it has a direct financial impact for the institution. Total savings of over $24,000 pesos a year

-Solar Water Heaters for the total boiler capacity of the place.

We will install solar water heaters, replacing the current total capacity installed in boilers (gas) to supply with hot water to the kitchen, restrooms and dorms. This will have a financial impact for the institution and exposes the kids to different technologies and introduces a culture of respect for natural resources. Total Savings of 380 Kg  of LP Gas. 

-School Farm using permaculture  

We will build a school farm, totaling >75 m2 using the scope of permaculture. We will also host a series of talks, and workshop, provided by our friends of “Color Tierra, AC”, who are experts in this matter. With their help we will create conscience, educate and bring to the diversity in the kids education. The goal of this Farm is to eventually be used for self-consumption. 

-Robotics

We will buy 5 robotic kits, and with the help of our friends at Nearsoft, through their “NS community” initiative, we will help finding and training educators so they can continue facilitating the course for future generations. We want to bring diversity and quality to the kids education, to train them in relevant skills for an ever changing & competitive job market. 

-Artistic murals.

To beautify the school. We are looking to promote artistic activities in the school and hopefully within the curricula. 

All of this we can achieve with a budget of $25,000 USD, if  you help us achieve this goal, the institution is going to see the benefits right away, and they will last for long!!

In addition to that we are looking to promote workshops and courses in the following:

-Robotics

-Introduction to Sustainability

-Introduction to Renewable Energies.

-Permaculture

About the project

The Project:

“Operación Kino” is a plan that involves an extensive team and some very talented individuals that believe in the cause and decided to take part, the plan is developed and taken into action by:

-Luis Ernesto Ortiz Encinas, Bachelor in Finances and Specialist in Sustainable Development

-Omar Acosta Sanchez, Mechatronics Engineer and also Specialist in Sustainable Development.

We share an special interest in Instituto Kino: Our parents were helped by this institution when they were foreign students with minimum resources many years ago in this very same city. Today we are looking to help Instituto Kino to continue with their labor and improve the kids chances of making their way in life. We hope for a better future for many families.

This project stems from our concern of contributing and helping solve some of the needs of the Institution, being these many, and very diverse, we decided to focus on actions for the Sustainability of the place, and the improving of the kids education and thus making a positive impact in this kids future.

We are looking to reduce operational costs so that the institute can focus their efforts in expenses and investments that look for what’s really important: the education, care, and future of the kids that inhabit the place. 

THIS IS NO SMALL PROJECT, That's why we are doing it.

We believe that the best way to change the world is actively working for it. 

Operation Kino consists of 5 actions that will make a deep & meaningful impact in the lives of the kids currently living in this place. At the same time we look to improve it’s capacities, capabilities & overall operational efficiency.

Scope

SCOPE OF THE PROJECT:

-Sustainability

-Renewable Energies

-Education

-Technologies

-Permaculture

Rewards

Rewards:

To accomplish our goals, we are working with artists, artisans, entrepeneurs, activists and specialists on a local, national, and international level. All of them are convinced of the projects’ impact, and have decided to cooperate by giving their time and work in the planning and operation, as well as offering their knowledge and talents as a reward for you.

story:
Short Summary

Be part of placing the biggest possible signs with the image of the Man of the Shroud in Downtown, San Antonio. The signs will be given away to registered donors of this campaign. This is an opportunity to win a 12 feet tall image of the Man of the Shroud for your church, school or personal space after the Shroud of Turin Exposition leaves San Antonio, Texas.

What We Need & What You Get

Be part of placing the biggest possible signs with the image of the Man of the Shroud in Downtown, San Antonio. The signs will be given away to registered donors of this campaign. This is an opportunity to win a 10 feet tall image of the Man of the Shroud for your church, school or personal space after the Shroud of Turin Exposition leaves San Antonio, Texas.

Those following us in Facebook or visitors to the Exposition know the problems that we had placing signs on the location in downtown San Antonio. The Shroud of Turin Exposition is located in a historic building right across City Hall and behind the Cathedral of San Fernando, the oldest running Cathedral in the United States. The address is 416 Dolorosa St. The name of the street, which in Spanish means “the way of the pain”, is the street from where Easter processions approached the Cathedral. What can be more fitting than a large image of the “Man of the Shroud” during lent and Easter on Dolorosa Street?

Any historic building needs a permit to place a sign of any kind. We had our share of ups and downs (and fines) getting the permits to have the limited signage that we currently have. This is a call of action to help us go BIG and go beyond administrative rules and regulations. The Shroud of Turin event is temporarily located in San Antonio, and it breaks our hearts when people coming as far as Houston, El Paso or Laredo cannot find the location due to the lack of signage. Our heart goes to the elderly or families with children that walk around downtown looking for us and most of the times have to call us for help finding the Expo.

The Shroud of Turin Expo has requested a special permit from the Office of Historic Preservation to place the largest possible sign on an existing signage frame structure at the building currently unused. The signs will be facing both sides of the street. It will be two different signs, one for each direction. The hearing date with the commission is February 18 at 3:00 pm.

The Shroud of Turin Expo will raffle the signs before leaving town. The raffle will take place 10 to 15 days after closing the Indiegogo campaign and it will be announced in Facebook. Each donor will be receiving a ticket number for each $1 dollar donated for the sign. Multiple Perk purchases will provide donors with multiple chances to win. There will be four sings to be ruffled:

·  Two signs 12.6 feet by 8 of the negative image of the front of the Shroud in blue with black background. See pictures

·  Two signs 10 feet by 2.125 of the negative image of the front of the Shroud in blue with black background. See pictures


Ticket numbers will be sent to each donor within 48 hours of their donation via email. The raffle will be recorded in video and posted in www.shroudexpo.com. Ticket winners will be mentioned on the video, posted in facebook and contacted via email or phone number. Winners will have to pick the signs at 416 Dolorosa St or arrange for shipping.

Help us place the largest signs of the Man of the Shroud possible at Dolorosa Street and win the sign for your church, school or personal space.

The Impact

The special permit should allow the Shroud of Turin Expo to raise a 12 feet sign of the Man of the Shroud.

Our intention with this program is to raise awareness of the Man of the Shroud during lent and Easter and leave a lasting image of him in Texas and assist out of town guest to locate the facility where the Expo is held without wondering around Downtown due to the restrictions imposed on this facility.  Most people younger than 30 do not know what the Shroud of Turin is. Such an image in the street will draw them and others to question what it is.

Four large signs will be ruffled to donors of this project in Texas. The signs will be ready to pick up at the Dolorosa street address when the Shroud of Turin Exposition ends in San Antonio. These images will be a lasting remainder of the Man of the Shroud for those winners. It is our hope and intention that such images are won by folks that will donate them to churches, schools or youth groups and serve the people of Texas.

Risks & Challenges

The Shroud of Turin Exposition is located in downtown San Antonio, Texas. The exhibit is a 10,000 square feet facility located within a short walking distance from the Cathedral of San Fernando in Downtown San Antonio and just across of City Hall. The address is 416 Dolorosa St, just corner with Flores and Market St.

Indiegogo will provide the funds to ShroudExpo, Inc fifteen (15) business days after the end of this program. All perks listed for local pick up, can be picked up at the Expo at 416 Dolorosa St after you receive an email of confirmation of your donation. Such email should be received seven to tendays after your donation has been confirmed by Indiegogo. All Perk listed for mail delivery, will be mailed after the closing of the campaign and receipt of funds by Indiegogo.

There is the risk that the board of Historic Preservation does not grant the permit on the meeting schedule for February 18 for the largest signs. Nonetheless, The Shroud of Turin Expo will create all the signs and pursue additional actions to gain such permit. All supporters of the sign to be at the street are welcome to participate at the hearing(s). Information about the first hearing will be posted in Facebook.

The costs of the signs is $4,800 dollars. We allocated $800 dollars to filing fees, Indiegogo charges and credit card charges. You can take a $2,000 dollar image to your designated place for a perk donation of $1.00.

Other Ways You Can Help

There is always a way to help if funds are short. These are some of our suggestions. I can bet that all of you out there can come out with many more……

·  Share the news. Tell your friends and family about this project

·  Attend the board meeting to support our claims
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Be part of placing the biggest
possible signs with the image of the Man of the Shroud in Downtown, San
Antonio. The signs will be given away to registered donors of this campaign.
This is an opportunity to win a 12 feet tall image of the Man of the Shroud for
your church, school or personal space after the Shroud of Turin Exposition
leaves San Antonio, Texas.
   What We Need & What You Get 
Be part of placing the biggest
possible signs with the image of the Man of the Shroud in Downtown, San
Antonio. The signs will be given away to registered donors of this campaign.
This is an opportunity to win a 10 feet tall image of the Man of the Shroud for
your church, school or personal space after the Shroud of Turin Exposition
leaves San Antonio, Texas.
Those following us in Facebook or
visitors to the Exposition know the problems that we had placing signs on the
location in downtown San Antonio. The Shroud of Turin Exposition is located in
a historic building right across City Hall and behind the Cathedral of San
Fernando, the oldest running Cathedral in the United States. The address is 416
Dolorosa St. The name of the street, which in Spanish means “the way of the pain”,
is the street from where Easter processions approached the Cathedral. What can be
more fitting than a large image of the “Man of the Shroud” during lent and
Easter on Dolorosa Street?
Any historic building needs a permit
to place a sign of any kind. We had our share of ups and downs (and fines) getting
the permits to have the limited signage that we currently have. This is a call
of action to help us go BIG and go beyond administrative rules and regulations.
The Shroud of Turin event is temporarily located in San Antonio, and it breaks
our hearts when people coming as far as Houston, El Paso or Laredo cannot find
the location due to the lack of signage. Our heart goes to the elderly or
families with children that walk around downtown looking for us and most of the
times have to call us for help finding the Expo. 
The Shroud of Turin Expo has
requested a special permit from the Office of Historic Preservation to place the
largest possible sign on an existing signage frame structure at the building
currently unused. The signs will be facing both sides of the street. It will be
two different signs, one for each direction. The hearing date with the
commission is February 18 at 3:00 pm.
The Shroud of Turin Expo will raffle
the signs before leaving town. The raffle will take place 10 to 15 days after
closing the Indiegogo campaign and it will be announced in Facebook. Each donor
will be receiving a ticket number for each $1 dollar donated for the sign.
Multiple Perk purchases will provide donors with multiple chances to win. There
will be four sings to be ruffled:
· 
Two signs 12.6 feet by 8 of the
negative image of the front of the Shroud in blue with black background. See
pictures
· 
Two signs 10 feet by 2.125 of the
negative image of the front of the Shroud in blue with black background. See
pictures

Ticket numbers will be sent to each donor within 48 hours of their donation via
email. The raffle will be recorded in video and posted in www.shroudexpo.com. Ticket winners will be mentioned on the video, posted in
facebook and contacted via email or phone number. Winners will have to pick the
signs at 416 Dolorosa St or arrange for shipping.
Help us place the largest signs of
the Man of the Shroud possible at Dolorosa Street and win the sign for your
church, school or personal space.

 
   The Impact 
The
special permit should allow the Shroud of Turin Expo to raise a 12 feet sign of
the Man of the Shroud. 
Our
intention with this program is to raise awareness of the Man of the Shroud
during lent and Easter and leave a lasting image of him in Texas and assist out
of town guest to locate the facility where the Expo is held without wondering
around Downtown due to the restrictions imposed on this facility.  Most people younger than 30 do not know what the
Shroud of Turin is. Such an image in the street will draw them and others to
question what it is.
Four large
signs will be ruffled to donors of this project in Texas. The signs will be
ready to pick up at the Dolorosa street address when the Shroud of Turin
Exposition ends in San Antonio. These images will be a lasting remainder of the
Man of the Shroud for those winners. It is our hope and intention that such
images are won by folks that will donate them to churches, schools or youth
groups and serve the people of Texas.

end of this program. All perks listed for local pick up, can be picked up at

donation. Such email should be received seven to tendays after your donation
has been confirmed by Indiegogo. All Perk listed for mail delivery, will be
mailed after the closing of the campaign and receipt of funds by Indiegogo.
There
is the risk that the board of Historic Preservation does not grant the permit

gain such permit. All supporters of the sign to be at the street are welcome to
participate at the hearing(s). Information about the first hearing will be
posted in Facebook.
The costs of the signs is $4,800 dollars. We allocated $800 dollars to filing fees, Indiegogo charges and credit card charges. You can take a $2,000 dollar image to your designated place for a perk donation of $1.00.

There is
always a way to help if funds are short. These are some of our suggestions. I
can bet that all of you out there can come out with many more……

about this project

story:
OUR STORY

Woodmont High School opened in 1967, combining two older high schools: Woodside and Piedmont.  Woodmont, a small, rural high school, served the southwestern part of the county, including the area known as Possum Kingdom.  Many of our students lived within ten miles of most of their relatives.  Most had parents and grandparents who had attended the older schools.  Several lived on county roads that bore their family name.

As time passed, Woodmont’s buildings became inadequate, especially to support the demands of new technology.  We moved into our current state-of-the-art facility in 2005.  The school district modified Woodmont’s attendance area to take advantage of the new, larger space, and our student population quickly grew to more than 1600, doubling the student body in a decade.

The attendance area of the new Woodmont High encompasses nearly 150 square miles.  Some new subdivisions have attracted people from other states, but most of our students still live in the former mill towns of Piedmont, Pelzer, and Williamston or out in the undeveloped portions of the county.  While some students live close enough to walk and some drive themselves a few miles, others must travel more than an hour every day on the bus to get to school.

Woodmont’s poverty index is 62% which means that nearly 1000 of our students receive assistance in the form of free or reduced meals, Medicare, and Medicaid.  35% of my IB students are in that category.  Some of our students have never traveled outside of the county.  Some have never seen the ocean or flown in an airplane.  Many of our seniors this year will be the first members of their family to graduate from high school.  Many more will be the first to attend college, including several of my IB kids.

Woodmont offers a dozen Advanced Placement classes, giving students the opportunity to earn college credit in high school.  We are an International Baccalaureate World School, providing challenging classes that prepare students for admission into top colleges and universities.  85% of the class of 2014 enrolled in college and earned scholarship offers worth more than 3.1 million dollars.

HERE’S WHERE I COME IN

I joined the Woodmont English Department in 1986.  In 2001, the International Baccalaureate Organization authorized Woodmont to offer IB classes and to prepare students for the IB diploma.  After two years of training, I became the teacher of IB English, Higher Level, and taught my first class in 2002.

Because of the numerous benefits travel provides, because of the limited opportunities my students had, and because there ought to be something international in an IB school, I began looking into ways to take my students to England and Ireland.

After some fits and starts, I finally took my first group of students abroad in April of 2007.  I took another group in 2009 and my third in 2011.  Despite supportive parents and administrators, economic pressures scuttled trips for 2013 and 2015. 

HERE’S WHERE YOU COME IN

Now, there’s Indiegogo and the power of crowd-funding.  By using Indiegogo’s platform and the multiplying power of social media and social networks, I can help my students travel to Ireland, Wales, and England in Spring 2016.  Even though the economic reality for many of my students remains harsh, you can enable them to see the places from which James Joyce, Frank McCourt, Dylan Thomas, and William Shakespeare drew their inspiration; touch the door of number 7 Eccles Street; take in the breathtaking beauty of Wales; take a seat at the Globe.  Not only will this trip make literature live for these students, 2016 marks the centennial of Ireland’s Easter Rising, the beginning of Irish independence.  Imagine the excitement of being in Dublin for such a historic celebration!  Your donation will give the world to some hard-working students who deserve a little help, students who need to see some of the world beyond their homes, students whose lives will change forever as a result of your generosity.

WHERE YOUR DONATION GOES

After paying expenses, an independent financial advisor will distribute donated funds directly to our travel company on behalf of qualified students.  Students will qualify for different amounts of financial help depending on their demonstrated need.  Demonstrated need will reflect household income and the number of dependents.  One student may need $500, for example, while another needs $2500.  To paraphrase Thomas Paine, we esteem too lightly what we get too easily, so every student will pay at least $1000 toward the trip.  This is still a large financial burden for many of them but a much more attainable one than the full cost of the trip.  By the way, even though Explorica says I can travel for free, I always pay the regular full price for my trip because it is wrong to travel on the backs of my kids.


WHAT PAST STUDENTS SAY

“Visiting the British Museum and the Joyce residence put the things I had been learning into a physical form. Not only for English, the class that went on the trip, but for other subjects as well. I was now not only imagining the cities where scenes took place in classic literature, such as Mrs. Dalloway, but I was walking around there, envisioning it for myself, in person.”

“I think the most rewarding education impact of the trip was simply seeing the origins of what we had studied for so long.”

“I really loved that you had us keep a travel journal while we were there. I had never done anything like that on a trip before, and it taught me to reflect and think about what I was experiencing.”

“Not only was it enriching for my personal experience, it really helped me understand the literature we were studying at the time. Dublin and London were no longer places in the far distance, but cities that I could actually visit. I think everyone deserves the opportunity to visit other countries.”

“I wouldn't trade that experience for anything! It opened my eyes up to new places and started my travel bug!”

“Spending my spring break with my school family in Europe is my favorite memory from high school, and I think everyone deserves (and needs) the opportunity to experience . . . the world beyond South Carolina.”

story:
Hello! This is My Story 

My Name is Faun Naso and I am a practicing Medical Herbalist from Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. I hold a diploma with honors in Phytotherapy from Pacific Rim College and have over ten years experience in the health and wellness field. 
I have been given an opportunity to help a community in Uganda, Africa through herbal medicine, permaculture gardening, nutrition and education. During my internship at Shanti Uganada I will gain valuable life experience and have a chance to give back to a community in need. Shanti Uganda "is a safe birthing center in Kasana, Uganda with a mission to improve infant and maternal health, provide safe women-centered care and support the well-being of birthing mothers and women living with HIV/AIDS". This is an amazing opportunity for me to use my skills and knowledge to facilitate healthy growth on an individual level but also with the whole community in mind.

The Plan

To use the knowledge and passion that I have for herbal medicine, nutrition and permaculture to increase the health and quality of life for the women and children in Kasana, Uganda. I will be building a sustainable herbal dispensary that will provide the necessary tools, medicine and education to help with a myriad of health concerns and issues. I will be focusing on all aspects of pregnancy and birth but I will also have medicines for common conditions like digestive disorders, parasites, bacterial infections and viral conditions.

I will also be reinventing the gardens already there, into a more sustainable permaculture based garden, that will require less water and upkeep but still provide enough food and medicine for the whole community. Proper nutrition could mean the difference between life an death for many people and so with adequate nutrition comes better health.  

I want to create a sustainable difference in the health of families in Uganda, using the knowledge and gifts I have to offer.

.

The Obstacle

The expenses for me to even go to Africa are a lot, my plane ticket alone is almost 2,000 CAD. I just don't have enough money to make the difference I want to achieve. I have asked to raise 5,000 CAD to help with the funds necessary for me to build a herbal dispensary, reinvent the gardens to be more sustainable and permaculture based and my living expenses while staying in Uganda. 

2,000 CAD will go towards buying dried herbs, tinctures, cream bases, dispensary tools (scales, jars/bottles, grinder, capsules, etc) and everything else you would find in a fully stocked dispensary.  

1,000 CAD will go towards new plants and seeds for the garden, compost bins, soil and education. 

1,000 CAD will go to Shanti Uganda for the cost of my room and board while staying in Uganda.

1,000 CAD will go towards a portion of my plane ticket, medical insurance and other personal uses.     


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my campaign! I understand that not everyone can financially help me with my campaign. If you want to help in other ways....Spread the word! please e-mail, facebook, twitter, pinterest, linkedin, snail mail and any other way you can get my campaign out there is a huge help!

story:
For those of you who don't know me, my name is Allie Nichols and I'm currently a senior at Gulfport High. This July, I'm traveling with The Happening of MS (an amazing student-led weekend that teaches you so so much about God & yourself) to Africa in hopes to bring the Happening to Kenya!!! It has been in the works for a long time and our team is so excited.

Above is a picture of my friend Jay Jay and I at Happening #74 last November. He traveled all the way from  Nairobi, Kenya to go through this past Happening to learn about the weekend so that he can help out when we get there! 

As amazing as a bunch of teenagers traveling to Africa sounds, it is incredibly expensive. Any contribution to making this dream a reality is SO very appreciated! I'm asking not only for your monetary donations but for your spiritual donations as well! Please keep our entire team in your prayers as we prepare our hearts for this incredible opportunity.

If you wish to donate with something other than a credit card, please send your donations to:

Cathey Plunkett

The Happening of MS

P.O. Box 1042

Madison, MS 39130


Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

To find out more about this trip, visit mshappening.net



*******please leave t-shrit size in comments!

"For what we preach is not ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus' sake." 2 Corinthians 4:5

story:
A centre for young people to create a healthy, happy and sustainable future in Les Cayes, South Haiti.

South Haiti

Haiti is often cited as the poorest nation in the Western Hemisphere with extreme poverty, high unemployment rates, reliance on food and energy imports, risks of natural disasters and environmental degradations. Despite these challenges, Haiti has within its borders the people and resources necessary to shift the country away from short-term decision making to long-term sustainable development. This is where the children and youth of Haiti have a role to play. In Les Cayes, South Haiti, there is a community of young people under 25 that want the support, resources and space necessary to make this dream a reality. 

The Centre

This youth centre will be the first in the area to provide children and youth with:

1. Education, professional development, leadership and mentorship programs, with a focus on sustainable development and citizenship;

2. A public library with books, computers and high-speed internet;

3. A community garden and meal program to promote skills in and access to sustainable and local food production; and

4. Solar-power, water recycling and a composting toilet to teach about renewable energy and regenerative systems. 

About Us

We Make Foundation, a network of sustainability thinkers and doers based in Vancouver, Canada, is partnered with the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the South (CCI) and La Sale Culturelle Tirailleur, Haitian organizations in Les Cayes, to create this youth centre in their community.

How You Can Help

The total budget for the project launch is $40,450. Local Haitian and international partners are working with us to contribute approximately $25,000, with the community of Les Cayes having already donated $5,000 worth in books and computers. We need your help to close the gap and raise the additional $10,450 needed to cover costs. By backing this project YOU will help retrofit an old building into a new youth centre equipped with solar-powered electricity, clean water, a toilet, furniture, a library with internet, and a kitchen and garden for meals.

This project will be led and owned by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the South and its local partners. Revenue to operate the centre will initially come from local government grants. The longer term goal is to create a social enterprise that offers socially conscious educational programs and donates a portion of its profits to the youth centre. 

Budget Breakdown (0-6 months):

  • Infrastructure retrofit - $14,450
  • Programs and activities - $9,000
  • Part-time local staff salaries - $17,000
Budget Highlights:
  • Clean water system: water catchment, treatment, and pumps - $250
  • Solar Panels - $1,000
  • Building retrofit, kitchen equipment and appliances - $6, 600
  • Meal Program - $5,000
  • Community garden - $1,000
  • Educational supplies - $1,000
  • Educational programming development and pilot - $2,000
You can also help us by:
  • Spreading the word and making some noise about our project; 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this project with your friends and family.

Together we can make this happen!

Before Pictures

Inside the old cultural centre that needs to be retrofitted: 

The current open defecation pit:

The current kitchen area:

Risks & Challenges

We have confirmed Le Sal Culturelle Tiraidelle for our youth centre. Now we need to retrofit the space. There always risks associated with construction but we will mitigate them through partnerships with local builders. One challenge, in our opinion, will be identifying and training local staff to handle operations and finding individuals of accomplishment and integrity who are deeply embedded in the local community. CCI thankfully has decades of experience identifying, training and working with local leaders in Les Cayes.

Thank you for your support!

South Haiti




Haiti is often cited as the poorest nation in the Western Hemisphere with extreme poverty, high unemployment rates, reliance on food and energy imports, risks of natural disasters and environmental degradations. Despite these challenges, Haiti has within its borders the people and resources necessary to shift the country away from short-term decision making to long-term sustainable development. This is where the children and youth of Haiti have a role to play. In Les Cayes, South Haiti, there is a community of young people under 25 that want the support, resources and space necessary to make this dream a reality. 

The Centre


This youth centre will be the first in the area to provide children and youth with:
1. Education, professional development, leadership and mentorship programs, with a focus on sustainable development and citizenship;
2. A public library with books, computers and high-speed internet;
3. A community garden and meal program to promote skills in and access to sustainable and local food production; and
4. Solar-power, water recycling and a composting toilet to teach about renewable energy and regenerative systems. 


About Us

We
Make Foundation, a network of sustainability thinkers and doers based in Vancouver, Canada, is partnered with the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the
South (CCI) and La Sale Culturelle Tirailleur, Haitian organizations in Les Cayes, to create this youth centre in their community.

How You Can Help
The total budget for the project launch is $40,450. Local Haitian and international partners are working with us to contribute approximately $25,000, with the community of Les Cayes having already donated $5,000 worth in books and computers. We need your help to close the gap and raise the additional $10,450 needed to cover costs. By backing this project YOU will help retrofit an old building into a new youth centre equipped with solar-powered electricity, clean water, a toilet, furniture, a library with internet, and a kitchen and garden for meals.
This project will be led and owned by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the South and its local partners. Revenue to operate the centre will initially come from local government grants. The longer term goal is to create a social enterprise that offers socially conscious educational programs and donates a portion of its profits to the youth centre. 

Budget Breakdown (0-6 months):

Infrastructure retrofit - $14,450
Programs and activities - $9,000
Part-time local staff salaries - $17,000

Budget Highlights:



Clean water system: water catchment, treatment, and pumps - $250

Solar Panels - $1,000
Building retrofit, kitchen equipment and appliances - $6, 600
Meal Program - $5,000
Community garden - $1,000
Educational supplies - $1,000
Educational programming development and pilot - $2,000


You can also help us by:

Spreading the word and making some noise about our project; 
Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this project with your friends and family.


Together we can make this happen!
Before Pictures
Inside the old cultural centre that needs to be retrofitted: 




The current open defecation pit:



The current kitchen area:






Risks & Challenges
 

We have confirmed Le Sal Culturelle
Tiraidelle for our youth centre. Now we need to retrofit the space.
There always risks associated with construction but we will mitigate them through partnerships with local builders. One challenge, in our opinion, will be identifying and
training local staff to handle operations and finding individuals of
accomplishment and integrity who are deeply embedded in the local community. CCI thankfully has decades of experience identifying, training and working with local leaders in Les Cayes.
    
Thank you for your support!

story:
OUR INDIEGOGO STORY


Hello, my name is Dwane Boucher and I want to invite you to join our adventure!

As a commercial airline pilot, retired USAF Lt Col, and Eagle Scout; I'm no stranger to adventurous living, however back in May of 2000, a chance encounter with fellow aviator, Bob Morgan, ultimately led me to Israel, an ancient stepped passageway, and an "Indiana Jones" experience in search of King Solomon's Lost Temple Treasures!

What is the Copper Scroll? 

Central to this great adventure is the 1952 discovery of an enigmatic scroll made of copper. The Copper Scroll (as it was ultimately named) was uncovered in the 3rd of 11 caves during the famed Dead Sea Scrolls excavations at Khirbet Qumran; its subsequent 1960 translation, of hammered Mishnaic Hebrew characters, by John Allegro, rocked that era’s archaeological world! Surprisingly, locked away in this thin 99% pure copper sheet was found a nearly two millennia old treasure registry that literally described the whereabouts of 64 separate treasure caches of gold, silver, and other valuables estimated to be worth billions of US dollars.

Are the treasures real?

Dating back to the time of the First Jewish Rebellion in 66 AD, scholars give credence to the theory that priests, facing an impending invasion by Roman troops, removed, buried, and subsequently recorded the whereabouts of Jerusalem's sacred temple treasures onto a specially formed and resilient copper sheet which they secretly hid away, with other sacred biblical scrolls, in hopes of returning to restore them to the temple at a later date. Unfortunately, by 70 AD, the Jewish Rebellion had been quelled, Jerusalem's temple destroyed, and the remnant of the Jewish population (and the treasure secret) erased in a mass suicide in lieu of their impending surrender to the Roman siege at Masada. Until the 1952 Copper Scroll discovery, no other historical record of these lost treasures have existed.

Where are the treasures buried?

Since the 1960 Copper Scroll translation, hosts of archaeologist, scholars, and treasure hunters alike have scoured the Judean Desert searching for the inscribed treasure locations without success, but more recently, new tunnel discoveries have reignited hope. Surprisingly, past difficulties in locating the various Copper Scroll sites, were simply due to the fact that most of the cultural landmarks, used to describe these burial locations, weren't in existence anymore. Nevertheless, Bob Morgan's amateur explorations happened upon Mount Hyrcania and it's mysterious "stepped passageway." Unfortunately, after four years and 360 feet of excavations, the hope of any epic treasure discoveries were dashed when neither Bob, nor lead archaeologist Doctor Oren Gutfeld (of Hebrew University) could locate any such relics or helpful clues. The significance of the find, however, strongly reinforced their belief that any future - similarly constructed - finds would be otherwise well worth the pursuit. Excitingly, this exact type of discovery was made by Dr. Gutfeld through his Bedouin network four years ago; in fact, two of these stepped passageways have been identified, but their whereabouts have been secreted away in order to allow Antiquity Quest an adequate amount of time to prepare and raise funds to begin our next tantalizing archaeological chapter!

What is our quest?

Antiquity Quest, LLC was formed for the purpose of conducting excavations at these new tunnels and to uncover the truth of what lies beneath, but the digs also represent a unique opportunity to tell an important story to the world. Our initial cadre of fellow archaeological adventurers and contributors have since begun the process of official permitting and preparation for upcoming tunnel excavations slated for December, 2015. Of equal significance, as with any modern undertaking as such, is also in capturing the sequence of collaborative human elements and documenting the unfolding story surrounding the enterprise. As was the case at Hyrcania, the uncharacteristic assembly of Jews, Muslims, and Christians reuniting for this expedition (digging side by side) represents a "high water mark" for an epic story of hope, discovery and friendship in the Middle East. In what may prove to be the "real treasure" discovery, we intend to document this untold story of camaraderie and unity on film. By chipping away at the myths surrounding unfavorable media portrayals, we hope to shed light on true regional potentials such that the world may gain a new perspective of the beliefs, the cultures, and the humanity of the people that represent the key players for peace in this notorious, yet historic, part of the world. 

Won't you join us?

To all our fellow adventurers; come join us! Take your place in history and become a part of our epic quest of a lifetime! Your valued contributions will make this dig possible. Certainly, the hope of finding King Solomon's lost temple treasures is real, but so also is the conquest of portrayal, among people with diverse religious and cultural roots, to realize the harmony that can be cultivated from the cooperative efforts in coming together for a common goal. We graciously thank you - in advance - for your continued support and spirit of adventure as we dig for the truth of what is, and what certainly could and should be.


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET 

What We Need; $38,500 US Dollars to pay for anticipated archaeological expenses for excavations planned for December, 2015. Excavations are only planned for the first of the two tunnel discoveries, and are located at an undisclosed location within the Occupied Territories of the West Bank. Expenses include licenses, permits, fees, professional services, security, filming, equipment rental, meal preparation, dig materials, fuel, water, manpower, local transportation costs, and other associated expenses. If together, during this campaign, we are unable to raise the entire amount needed, we should be able to continue with skeleton efforts from other donor commitments, but if shortfalls prove significant, funds will be returned to all contributors with our thanks.

What You Get; Perk benefits that have been created to compliment your spirit of adventure. Of course we want you to be closely connected to our great endeavor, so what better way than to actually introduce you to the preeminent Israeli archaeologist, author, and our excavation director, Dr. Oren Gutfeld. In that vein, listed below find a sampling of the unique benefits you can enjoy:

1. Exclusive Archaeological Insights; we have included podcast downloads and access to Dr. Gutfeld’s library of lectures.

2. The Inside Scoop; you can join our planning conferences plus question & answer sessions with Dr. Gutfeld.

3. Team-Member Benefits; shirts and hats are the norm, but we can also memorialize your participation with a signed certificate of support, and books authored and signed by Dr Gutfeld.

4. Escorted Archaeological Tours; Dr. Oren Gutfeld will host individualized tours and dining experiences in the old city of Jerusalem and also a tour of the Copper Scroll tunnel dig site for Partner level contributors and their guest.

5. Come Dig with Us; At the Participant level, you and a guest will be invited to join us for an adventure of a lifetime by spending a minimum of a two days with the Antiquity Quest dig team in the Judean Desert as we film and conduct actual tunnel excavations in search of the lost Copper Scroll treasures.


THE IMPACT

Mildly stated, the potential impact of this endeavor is epic! It is difficult to imagine the magnitude of effect upon the archaeological community, not to mention the rest of the world if this effort leads to a discovery of King Solomon’s Temple Treasures! Archaeologists, scholars, universities, organizations, governments and media outlets alike will be clamoring for access to the site, the discoveries; all wanting to learn more of the story. The value of the treasures is another matter since estimates could run in the billions of US dollars, and the priceless nature of its historical and religious significance would be off the charts. Perhaps the most immediate and significant impact of this endeavor will come from capturing this epic on film. Whether treasures are discovered or not, creating a reality format documentary will only pave the way to tell an important and timely story of cooperation and friendship. In a part of the world, where hope is thought to be as dry as the desert, this story of humanity (among Jews, Muslims and Christians alike) is a message the world desparately needs to hear.  


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Because of the confounding nature of this endeavor, there is a low probability of success in finding relics or treasures from Solomon’s temple. Moreover, the political instability in the area could adversely affect the excavation schedule and ultimately prevent excavation work at this proposed dig-site. Potential military conflict, in the region, could also make the proposed site a high-risk area to excavate and could lead to delays, or even cancellation of the excavation effort itself. There is always the potential for injury and even death for those who choose to take part in the excavation efforts as the structural integrity of these ancient tunnels is unknown and the overall effort itself represents an inherently dangerous activity. Finally, the ownership, of any treasure or relics discovered during this endeavor, is unknown due to the potential for multiple governmental claims to whatever our team may uncover. The good news is that, based on Israeli dig permit provisions, the exhibition, display, and publicity rights, are nevertheless to be awarded as the property of Knight’s Antiquity Quest, LLC.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't join our quest as a financial contributor, please let others know about us. Tell your family and friends about our adventure and direct them to our website, or our facebook and Indiegogo pages. You can help us by getting the name of our endeavor out to the public. No matter how you choose to support us, we want you to join our quest and partner with us in making history!

www.antiquityquest.org

www.facebook.com/knightsantiquityquest

story:
Short Summary

Imagine a life where you wake up with no one to take care of you. When the road is your bathroom and the drains are your water supply. No one to give you clean clothes or hot breakfast. When you have to sell random stuff, sometimes beg and sometimes make deals with unknown adults to buy your next meal. That is the life of a child on the streets.

We help these children to move to the security of a 'Rainbow Home'. A home, which is place of love and security. A place where the child is taken care of in the way a family would take care of her. She has to a school to go to, friends to play with, hot food to eat. Most importantly, she can make her own choices in life and we help her fulfil her aspirations.

What We Need

“We only have what we give.” 

Support the cost of feeding a girl child in a 'Rainbow Home'. Help us raise funds so that we can keep serving hot cooked meals to our children. Help us so that they keep getting the best possible care and the best possible life.

We need support for giving nutritious hot cooked meals 3 times a day to 100 children for the next 2 months.

  • One Day Food Cost per child Rs. 50 (0.80$)
  • One Day Food Cost for 100 Children of 1 home Rs. 5000 (80$)

"Let us join hands to give food with dignity to nurture responsible citizens"

What You Get

We have some awesome perks to thank you for your support! Some of the highlights include: 

  • We will include you name in a post on Facebook/Twitter to show our gratitude! 
  • We will send you hand made greeting card by children online
  • Thank you video by children with Donor message
  • Lovely clap to Donor
  • Skype call with children and sharing your life values with them

The Impact

Every day, we send 3500 children to schools and ensure they get the best possible education. A hungry child can't study, can she? A hungry child will go back to streets in search of food, won't she? 

Your generous support will help us feed 100 children and ensure they go to school and remain in the safety of a home.

Other ways to get involved:

1. Share our campaign with family and friends.  We need your help in spreading the word. Please use the resources available to share through Email, Facebook, Twitter, etc.

2. Contribute in kind: If you want to donate dry ration, we'll be happy to use to provide nutritious meals to our children. Contact us through email/phone (details below)

If you have any questions, or need additional information, please contact Mr. Grace at +91 814-314-1666 or email us at reach@rainbowhome.in and we will be happy to talk with you!

story:
This Crowdfunding Campaign is aimed at raising $ 25000 to buy a former hunting camp and transform it into a Permaculture Center (Farm and Institute) that will be the first in this part of West Africa.

This Permaculture Center which will be in Kedougou in the south eastern part of Senegal will train farmers and students from all West Africa in Permaculture.

We already had a PDC (Permaculture Design Course) in 2012 with Robyn Francis in Domain du Pan at Limousin France.

Our objective is to have the first PDC (Permaculture Design Course) in this part of West Africa, with an international Permaculture trainer next summer with participants coming from all around the world and notably the sub region.

For that purpose we would like to raise this amount within 60 days.

- Those who will donate $ 25 will be given a personal letter of thanks from Kédougou.

- Those who will donate $ 100 will be given a personal letter of thanks from Kédougou so as has his/her name graved at the entrance of the center.

·- Those will donate $ 500 or more will be given a personal letter of thanks from Kedougou so as has his/her name graved at the entrance of the center and will pay 50% for the next summer’s PDC.

-²Those who donate  $ 1000 or more will participate in the coming PDC for free , they will just pay the flight ticket between his city and  Dakar, The transportation from Dakar so as the accommodation in Senegal will be taken in charge by the organization,

Médoune Niang

medoune2520@gmail.com

+22177 9083838

Skype mezzoniang

story:
So what's our idea?

  • Construct a quality school building 
  • Provide world class secondary education
  • Create sustainable employment
  • Promote environmentally sustainable practices

Quality secondary education with an emphasis on language, planning, sustainability, technology, and short and long term job creation. Xanadu Academy aims to provide the next generations with the skills to improve the future of Nigeria. We will adopt a holistic approach to education that internalizes culture, economy and nature to empower generations of game changers as they enter the global playing field. Xanadu Academy will be a private boarding school located in Lagos, Nigeria, the fastest growing international megapolis in Africa. Due to the high level of growth and entrepreneurial grit in the country, Lagos will become the future engine of Africa's economic presence in the world and we believe education is the gateway to mobilize human capital.

"We invite you in to be part of an ambitious project with far reaching impact". 

The planned facade of  our main school building.

Why Our Campaign is Important 

We started Xanadu Academy because at the very core, we are creators and entrepreneurs keen to build something from the ground up. Having travelled the world, we know that education makes a direct and significant impact on socio-economic growth and progress, which promotes freedom and equality. We believe that education in Nigeria can be greatly improved by incorporating a comprehensive curriculum. We believe that the secondary school curriculum in Nigeria is not well-balanced as it focuses solely on academic achievement at the expense of arts, sports, and creativity and thereby limits the student's potential. At Xanadu Academy, there will be no trade-offs, we will encourage each student to maximize their full potential in all fields.

Environment

A strong environmental profile mixed with interactive learning will ensure critical knowledge and respect for our planet. We will achieve this by taking full advantage of:

•  Solar Power- Our location has tremendous potential in photovoltaic.

•  Waste Water Filtering- Critical for human health and the environment.

•  Composting of Organic Waste- Briliant way to get rid of waste safely and teach kids about nature and chemistry.

"We want to give Nigerian youths the tools to maximize their potential so Nigeria can be all she can be and more".

Xanadu Academy is our way of positively impacting on future generations through education at a delicate time in Nigeria where the southern regions are making significant sociocultural and economic progress while simultaneously, human rights are been violently challenged in the north.  We want to educate students who will go on to become inventors, scientists, free thinkers, writers, teachers, doctors, composers, planners, athletes, activists, entrepreneurs or environmentalists, equipped with the skills to improve society. We believe that Africa is central to the future, education is the key and we are honored to play this part, no matter how small, in guaranteeing quality education to youths.

 

Construction in Nigeria is extremely labor intensive and a construction project like Xanadu Academy is creating a considerable amount of local jobs. Here, our Builders are pouring concrete into the foundation. 

Job Creation

Jobs are essential. Without jobs and a source of income, affording basic life necessities is impossible. Without an income, we most likely cannot feed our children and send them to school. 

Given this, we are proud to be able to create a substantial amount of jobs to construction workers, planners, service providers, teachers and more. Below, we present our current achievements and future estimates in job creation.

In other words, your donations enable us to pay our construction workers and bring us one step closer to hiring the rest of the faculty and staff that will facilitate the smooth operation of the school, now and for years to come.

In addition to providing quality education, job creation is a very important aspect of this project, at the same time it´s what makes this project such a good investment. We plan to continue to expand and grow Xanadu Academy over the coming years, meaning that we will provide job opportunities for up towards 100 people annually. Not bad for a semi-crowdfunded project!

What We Need 

There are three levels to construct for Xanadu Academy's school building. Presently, we have secured funding that makes this project realistic and within reach. So, your contribution will ensure that construction is completed and that Xanadu Academy is operational by the Fall of 2016.  During this campaign, we will continue to work as far as our funding can reach and your support will guarantee that the construction of Xanadu Academy is finished.  We are still working very hard to reach our goal, and for this reason, we turn to you, to support us in raising $25,000.00. 

Of the $25,000.00 that will be raised, $7,000.00 will be used to pay our local superstar construction workers; and $18,000.00 will go towards purchasing the building materials that will be used to complete the construction of this groundbreaking institution.

  • In the event that we do not reach our fundraising goal, 25% of what we raise will still go towards paying workers; and 75% towards purchasing building materials.

The Impact

We are well aware that Xanadu Academy is an ambitious project, but we undoubtedly believe that it is not impossible.  Upon completion of construction, Xanadu Academy will  provide valuable and comprehensive education for each student. Our reputation of successfully inspiring students to reach their full potential will speak for itself. We will pride ourselves in developing each student - irrespective of age and capabilities - with the tools and skill-set they need to have to proceed and thrive in today's society. 

Xanadu Academy will strive for excellence in learning and academic achievement by providing:

  • Lifelong learning and curiosity 
  • Challenges so each student can reach their full potential in whichever field they choose 
We will achieve the aforementioned with special emphasis on:
  • Creativity
  • Equality
  • Environmentalism
  • Power of languages 

We know that with your contribution, Xanadu Academy (XA) will become a world-class educational facility in Nigeria.

Setting up XA transcends our entrepreneurial needs as we believe that upon completion, XA will have countless spillover effects that will benefit society for generations to come. We hope to inspire future Nigerian leaders at XA. Even a small contribution from you will go a long way in helping us achieve quality education at our school and in Nigeria. In addition, for every $25,000.00 we raise during this campaign, we will offer a student, a full scholarship for six years. 

Chisom our Founder and Chika Udeze our Construction Project Coordinator on the ground, inspecting the completion of the foundation during our last visit to the site. 

Perks

This is not one of those projects that produces "things" that can easily be given away as gifts, the result of our ambitious endeavor is intangible but extremely valuable.  We ask you to support an idea that has countless spill over effects, and will continue to impact future generations to come. Nonetheless, we want to show our appreciation for your support by offering some African sculptures, handcrafts, artworks, as well as the chance to be eternalized in our school's engravings. The total budget on this project is quite large and our ideas and plans are extremely ambitious, but we believe that with resources such as Indiegogo and people like you, we will make Xanadu Academy a reality. The donor tree and wall that we offer as a 'perk' will be part of our school's permanent interior decoration and will be a beautifully crafted piece of art that will remain a unique part of the school. We believe that out donor tree and wall will definitely be a worthy place to have your name engraved :).
Furthermore, we offer some of our donors the chance to have a classroom or student house named after them or a name of their choice--naturally within reasonable limits and suitability :).

Risks & Challenges

While Nigeria currently has the honor of being a MINT country and boasts a booming economy of almost miraculous proportions, starting a business in an emerging market country does not come without risks. We would be remiss to not mention the current political conflict in the north of Nigeria where access to education is restricted. Xanadu Academy will highlight the importance and value of education for both boys and girls.

Who We Are

We are three young professionals who are passionate, ambitious, hopeful, realistic-optimists, daredevils and brave in-spite of fear. It was through international higher education  in the Netherlands, that we met, became great friends, and found our common dream of making the world a better place through education. We feel part of a global community, aware of the indispensable value of education and opportunity.

Chisom Udeze, Founder and CEO, has a B.A. in Economics (University of Mississippi); a B.A. in International Studies with a focus on Global Economics and Business (Croft Institute of International Studies); a MSc. in International Economics and Business with emphasis on Globalisation and Development (Utrecht University); and M.A. (2016) in International Education Management (Middlebury Institute of International Studies). Chisom has a varied work experience in the Non-profit, Oil and Gas, Higher Education, Financial Services, and Research industry. Xanadu Academy is her brain child.

Christian Lervik, Co-founder and Managing Director, started out as a craftman, went to the army and later on to university for a BA in Geography at NTNU, Norway and Utrecht, The Netherlands. He is currently finishing his MSc in Human Geography at Lund University, Sweden. The combination of practical construction experience and theoretical education will prove usefull in a project like this and is the driver for our ambition on the practical environmentalism initiatives.

Kim-Andre Nikolaisen, on-board as our Operational Director. He graduated with his Bachelors in Human geography from NTNU in Norway and Utrecht University in the Netherlands. Following this he worked with establishing a Fish Smokery Restaurant in Drøbak, Norway, for three years, simultaneously getting more involved with Xanadu Academy. He has travelled extensively and lived abroad on several occasions, obtaining experience from International Schools.

To Learn more about us and our plans, click here.

Ways You Can Help

We are always grateful for any form of support we receive

  • Spread the word about Xanadu Academy to friends and family

  • Share #XanaduAcademy on your social media pages and on Facebook

  • If you have any insight or ideas for us, we would love to hear from you! Please contact us at xanaduacademy@gmail.com

  • Please like and follow us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/XanaduAcademy and visit our blog at www.xanaduacademy.blogspot.co.uk 
Cover image photo: Courtesy of Giuseppe Milo

Our loyal work-horse, the old Land Rover, being loaded with the last delivery of cement and steel from the local  hardware store to complete the foundation.

Picture taken from one end capturing the workers at the other end, with Chisom trying to grasp the sheer size of this school! She's standing in the middle of the building entry hall looking towards what will become classrooms.

Chisom (the CEO and Founder) and Christian (the Managing Director and Co-Founder), sharing some serious thoughts in the shed provided for our very own block-making machine. This machine produces a minimum of 300 blocks a day!

So what's our idea?



Construct a quality school building 
Provide world class secondary education
Create sustainable employment
Promote environmentally sustainable practices

Quality secondary education with an emphasis on language, planning, sustainability, technology, and short and long term job creation. Xanadu Academy aims to provide the next generations with the skills to improve the future of Nigeria. We will adopt a holistic approach to education that internalizes culture, economy and nature to empower generations of game changers as they enter the global playing field. Xanadu Academy will be a private boarding school located in Lagos, Nigeria, the fastest growing international megapolis in Africa. Due to the high level of growth and entrepreneurial grit in the country, Lagos will become the future engine of Africa's economic presence in the world and we believe education is the gateway to mobilize human capital.


"We invite you in to be part of an ambitious project with far reaching impact". 



The planned facade of  our main school building.

Why Our Campaign is Important 
We
started Xanadu Academy because at the very core, we are creators and entrepreneurs keen to build something from the ground up. Having travelled the world, we know that education makes a direct and significant
impact on socio-economic growth and progress, which promotes freedom and equality. We believe that education in Nigeria can be greatly improved by incorporating a comprehensive curriculum. We believe that the secondary school curriculum in Nigeria is not well-balanced as it focuses solely on academic achievement at the expense of arts, sports, and creativity and thereby limits the student's potential. At Xanadu Academy, there will be no trade-offs, we will encourage each student to maximize their full potential in all fields.
Environment
A strong environmental profile mixed
with interactive learning will ensure critical knowledge and respect for our
planet. We will achieve this by taking full advantage of:
• 
Solar Power-
Our location has tremendous potential in photovoltaic.
• 
Waste Water
Filtering- Critical for human health and the environment.
• 
Composting of
Organic Waste- Briliant way to get rid of waste safely and teach kids about
nature and chemistry.
