story:
Short Summary

MoLab, Inc., a 501(c)3 not-for-profit corporation, was founded by two passionate women who shared a vision to go beyond the confinement of a physical location to offer  exciting experiences that promote curiosity and understanding of the sciences. With over 27 years of combined science center experience, the founders of MoLab are knowledgeable informal educators who will be able to drive science education to schools, after-school activities, community events, and drive home the importance of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) education.

Mission Statement: To provide on-the-go, dynamic, hands-on and inquiry-based science experiences through a mobile laboratory that promotes discovery. 

Vision Statement: MoLab's vision is to provide resources that cultivate and inspire a greater understanding of the role of sciences in our world.

Philosophy: MoLab's philosophy is based on equal access to hands-on science education and expertise – creatively and positively impacting those we serve.

The goal of MoLab is to enhance student achievement in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) in a fun, interactive setting that allows students to realize career paths in STEM related fields. All of MoLab's programs assist in developing 21st Century learning skills through project-based education and help promote digital literacy through programs that enable youth to think, create, and communicate effectively.

Based on successful models throughout the country and a member of the Mobile Laboratory Coalition, MoLab provides a vehicle for onsite and offsite interactive engagement. The founders share an excitement for increasing hands-on inquiry in education, for creating the “aha” moments, and for inspiring the next generation of innovators.

Recently, MoLab purchased a 1994 Fleetwood Flair Diesel Pusher. The vehicle needs to be retrofitted to transform it into a mobile discovery center we call MoBus. The vision for MoBus is for it to be a cutting-edge vehicle utilizing environmentally friendly technologies and advancements to demonstrate how science innovations can be applied to our daily lives. MoBus will run on veggie waste oil, as biodiesel, in order to lessen its carbon footprint and reduce its environmental impact. MoBus will evolve to always be fuel efficient and be a model of sustainability. MoBus will additionally be powered by solar panels located on the roof. The innovations that will be incorporated will make it a learning experience in and of itself.  

Inside MoBus, MoLab will have state-of-the-art equipment featuring microscopy stations, an entomology and biology wall, works stations, and televisions throughout for microscope projections and demonstrations. Outside, utilizing environmentally friendly paint, MoBus will be bright, colorful, and inviting as well as incorporate fun science facts. MoLab will work with the Mobile Laboratory Coalition to gain insight on best practices and designs for fitting a mobile science laboratory. 

This science-to-go format allows MoLab to serve a broad, diverse audience over a large geographical region, both in rural and urban environments. MoLab's effectiveness in serving science educators and students has no limits or boundaries. 

This Indiegogo campaign will help provide the necessary funds in order to meet MoBus's retrofitting needs. This is vitally important to MoLab's mission of providing on-the-go, dynamic, hands-on and inquiry-based science experiences through a mobile laboratory that promotes discovery. We need MoBus!

In one year's time, MoLab was launched; provided innovative, hands-on programming; executed its camp program, Camp Spark - Igniting Knowledge!; created community partnerships; received grants; purchased an RV; and positively affected the lives of the children we served. Contributors to this campaign will help achieve another success for MoLab - the opportunity to properly outfit our mobile science laboratory - MoBus! The magnitude of having our vision become a reality, through the generosity of others, is immense! Your contributions will have a wide impact.

What We Need & What You Get

MoLab is looking to obtain $70,000 to completely overhaul our RV. MoLab is committed to using environmentally friendly products during this process. Whenever possible, MoLab will also seek in-kind services to help offset costs. Funds are needed for the following:

Painting/Wrap of MoBus: ................................................................................... $18,000

Solar Panels: ................................................................ In-kind donation worth $5,000

Solar electric (sine wave inverter, solar charge controllers, batteries).......... $5,000

Roof and Exterior improvements/updates: ..................................................... $10,000

8 modular adjustable height extruded Al workstations made from 80/20.... $5,500

8 Flat Screen Displays and Mounts: .................................................................. $2,400

16 Laptops: .......................................................................................................... $6,400

8 Digital Microscopes and Cameras: ................................................................ $13,000

Entomology Wall and Storage Unit: .................................................................. $2,750

Discussion Area Bench and Storage Unit: ....................................................... $2,000

Discussion Area Flat Screen Display and Mount: .............................................. $300

Discussion Area Mounted Dry Erase Board: ....................................................... $200

Non-Slip Flooring: ................................................................................................. $1,500

Overhead Lighting: ................................................................................................... $350

More Storage Areas: ............................................................................................. $1,500

10 Stackable Stools: ................................................................................................ $400

Wall Mount Whiteboard............................................................................................ $100

Folding tables and chairs for outside setup.......................................................... $350

Portable wheel chair ramp....................................................................................... $250

Much like the food truck craze that created an excitement for something new and different in food service based on convenience and access, MoBus will offer an exciting alternative to traditional locations for informal science education, bringing the experiences to the audience. Parked at schools or other outreach events, students will be able to hop on board, interact with our state-of-the-art science equipment, and be introduced to a range of scientific topics such as entomology and biology.

For the communities MoLab will impact, the uniqueness of mobile educational resources creates a heightened awareness of “science is all around us.” MoLab’s MoBus will help break the barriers that science is not for everyone, making  science education accessible through its mobility, and creating an opportunity for students to interact with science equipment that is not available at their schools. It is through education that we progress and MoLab's fun, engaging platform will ensure we continue to move forward scientifically, further enhancing our next generation of innovators!

All of the awesome Indiegogo contributors will receive the good feeling of knowing that their contribution made a difference in providing equal access to science education. Additionally, supporters at the following levels will receive these Perks: $25 donors will receive a special THANK YOU shout out on all of MoLab's Social Media outlets; $50 contributors will receive name recognition on the special Indiegogo page of MoLab's website, www.tallymolab.org; $100 contributors will receive name recognition in a designated area inside MoBus; and $1,000 contributors will receive name recognition on a designated area on the exterior of MoBus.

If MoLab is unable to secure the entire goal of $70,000 the funds obtained will be restricted to MoBus and used strategically for the most critical components and equipment.

The Impact

Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) are the fundamental building blocks for modernization. A thriving 21st century community is made up of educated and engaged citizens. Educating students and introducing them to STEM topics promotes career development and supplies the future workforce of scientists, technologists, engineers, and mathematicians. MoLab is committed to providing engaging programming to create the next generation of innovators and inspired learners.

The tools needed to progress our students forward are lacking. More and more students are seeking degrees in fields other than STEM, while at the same time more jobs are available in areas of STEM. Scientific investigation and education create groups of inquiry-minded individuals. These individuals will seek to find answers to some of our most important questions in health, national safety, and the environment. Instilling this sense of inquiry at an early age ensures that our next generations to come will continue to grow our industries, responsibly. Your contribution, no matter at what level, will help MoLab inspire students to become engaged individuals who want to seek the answers to solve the world’s scientific problems.

MoLab has been in existence for a little over two years now and we have experienced how our unique platform successfully meets the needs of students. Through our Camp Spark – Igniting Knowledge! program, our Investigation Workshops, our participation in community events, and through funds received from grants and partnerships, MoLab has served 15,389+ students and families with project-based, hands-on STEM curriculum. With MoBus, the opportunities are endless as we drive science education to the surrounding communities and across the State of Florida. 

Risks & Challenges

In the beginning, the idea of actually having an RV that could be transformed into a mobile science and technology lab of discovery was just that – an idea. But, here we are and we have jumped the first hurdle. As we begin the retrofit process we understand that there will be many challenges. We have never completely gutted and converted an RV into a mobile science lab before; however, we have many resources from which to pull.

MoLab is a member of the Mobile Laboratory Coalition. The current membership list consists of many reputable national and international organizations providing valued resources in their respective communities. The Coalition’s goals are to:

·  Develop and disseminate a national network of mobile science laboratory programs with a common vision and shared curriculum to inspire an appreciation and knowledge of science and scientific inquiry. 

·  Provide equal opportunities in science education for ALL students and teachers consistent with state and national standards.

·  Assist and advise developing mobile laboratory programs.

Being a member provides MoLab an opportunity to learn from those who have been providing mobile learning for years. In preparation for this campaign, we reached out to the Founder of BioBus (biobus.org) to ensure our equipment list was accurate and true. MoLab has a pool of wonderful resources through the Mobile Laboratory Coalition.

Tallahassee is home to two universities, Florida State University and Florida A&M University. MoLab has reached out to faculty and staff for assistance with the retrofit process. MoLab will consistently reach out to individuals and entities for answers to any arising issues. MoLab surrounds itself with experts and these experts are willing to assist MoLab in successfully reaching its goals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to help MoLab Get Its MoBus On The Road! Consider giving what you can, no amount is too small.

Please share our campaign with everyone you know and ask them to share the campaign with everyone they know. Let’s create a domino effect!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

If you know people or have resources to donate equipment or assist with the retrofit process – contact us – we would love the expertise, insight, and support!

By helping MoLab to get MoBus on the road – YOU are positively affecting our next generation. YOU are helping to provide the fuel to ignite excitement and curiosity for the sciences. Help make our vision a reality.

served. Contributors to this campaign will help achieve another success for
MoLab - the opportunity to properly outfit our mobile science laboratory -
MoBus! The magnitude of having our vision become a reality, through the
generosity of others, is immense! Your contributions will have a wide impact.




What We Need & What You Get
 


MoLab is looking to obtain $70,000 to completely
overhaul our RV. MoLab is committed to using environmentally friendly products
during this process. Whenever possible, MoLab will also seek in-kind services
to help offset costs. Funds are needed for the following:
Painting/Wrap of MoBus: ................................................................................... $18,000

Solar Panels: ................................................................ In-kind
donation worth $5,000
Solar electric (sine wave
inverter, solar charge controllers, batteries).......... $5,000
Roof and Exterior improvements/updates: ..................................................... $10,000
8 modular adjustable height
extruded Al workstations made from 80/20.... $5,500
8 Flat Screen Displays and Mounts:
.................................................................. $2,400

16 Laptops: .......................................................................................................... $6,400

8 Digital Microscopes and Cameras:
................................................................ $13,000
Entomology Wall and Storage Unit: .................................................................. $2,750

Discussion Area Bench and Storage
Unit: ....................................................... $2,000

Discussion Area Flat Screen
Display and Mount: .............................................. $300

Discussion Area Mounted Dry Erase
Board: ....................................................... $200
Non-Slip Flooring: ................................................................................................. $1,500
Overhead Lighting: ................................................................................................... $350
More Storage Areas: ............................................................................................. $1,500
10
Stackable Stools: ................................................................................................ $400
Wall Mount Whiteboard............................................................................................ $100
Folding tables and chairs for
outside setup.......................................................... $350
Portable wheel chair ramp....................................................................................... $250
Much like the food truck craze that created an
excitement for something new and different in food service based on convenience
and access, MoBus will offer an exciting alternative to traditional locations
for informal science education, bringing the experiences to the audience. Parked
at schools or other outreach events, students will be able to hop on board, interact
with our state-of-the-art science equipment, and be introduced to a range of
scientific topics such as entomology and biology. 
For the communities MoLab will impact, the
uniqueness of mobile educational resources creates a heightened awareness of
“science is all around us.” MoLab’s MoBus will help break the barriers that
science is not for everyone, making  science
education accessible through its mobility, and creating an opportunity for
students to interact with science equipment that is not available at their
schools. It
is through education that we progress and MoLab's fun, engaging platform will
ensure we continue to move forward scientifically, further enhancing our next
generation of innovators!


All of the awesome Indiegogo
contributors will receive the good feeling of knowing that their contribution made
a difference in providing equal access to science education. Additionally,
supporters at the following levels will receive these Perks: $25 donors will
receive a special THANK YOU shout out on all of MoLab's Social Media outlets; $50
contributors will receive name recognition on the special Indiegogo page of
MoLab's website, www.tallymolab.org; $100
contributors will receive name recognition in a designated area inside MoBus;
and $1,000 contributors will receive name recognition on a designated area on
the exterior of MoBus.
If MoLab is unable to secure the
entire goal of $70,000 the funds obtained will be restricted to MoBus and used
strategically for the most critical components and equipment.




The Impact 
Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics
(STEM) are the fundamental building blocks for modernization. A thriving 21st
century community is made up of educated and engaged citizens. Educating
students and introducing them to STEM topics promotes career development and
supplies the future workforce of scientists, technologists, engineers, and
mathematicians. MoLab is committed to providing engaging programming to create
the next generation of innovators and inspired learners. 
The tools needed to progress our students forward
are lacking. More and more students are seeking degrees in fields other than
STEM, while at the same time more jobs are available in areas of STEM.
Scientific investigation and education create groups of inquiry-minded
individuals. These individuals will seek to find answers to some of our most
important questions in health, national safety, and the environment. Instilling
this sense of inquiry at an early age ensures that our next generations to come
will continue to grow our industries, responsibly. Your contribution, no matter
at what level, will help MoLab inspire students to become engaged individuals
who want to seek the answers to solve the world’s scientific problems.


MoLab has been in existence for a
little over two years now and we have experienced how our unique platform
successfully meets the needs of students. Through our Camp Spark – Igniting
Knowledge! program, our Investigation Workshops, our participation in community
events, and through funds received from grants and partnerships, MoLab has
served 15,389+ students
and families with project-based, hands-on STEM curriculum. With MoBus, the
opportunities are endless as we drive science education to the surrounding
communities and across the State of Florida. 

 
  
Risks & Challenges 
 



In the beginning, the idea of
actually having an RV that could be transformed into a mobile science and
technology lab of discovery was just that – an idea. But, here we are and we
have jumped the first hurdle. As we begin the retrofit process we understand
that there will be many challenges. We have never completely gutted and converted
an RV into a mobile science lab before; however, we have many resources from
which to pull.
MoLab is a member of the Mobile Laboratory Coalition.
The current membership list consists of many reputable national and
international organizations providing valued resources in their respective
communities. The Coalition’s goals are to:
· 
Develop
and disseminate a national network of mobile science laboratory programs with a
common vision and shared curriculum to inspire an appreciation and knowledge of
science and scientific inquiry.  
· 
Provide
equal opportunities in science education for ALL students and teachers
consistent with state and national standards.
· 
Assist and
advise developing mobile laboratory programs.
Being a member provides MoLab an opportunity to
learn from those who have been providing mobile learning for years. In
preparation for this campaign, we reached out to the Founder of BioBus
(biobus.org) to ensure our equipment list was accurate and true. MoLab has a
pool of wonderful resources through the Mobile Laboratory Coalition.
Tallahassee is home to two universities, Florida
State University and Florida A&M University. MoLab has reached out to
faculty and staff for assistance with the retrofit process. MoLab will
consistently reach out to individuals and entities for answers to any arising
issues. MoLab surrounds itself with experts and these experts are willing to
assist MoLab in successfully reaching its goals. 

  

Other Ways You Can Help 
There are so many ways to help MoLab Get Its MoBus
On The Road! Consider giving what you can, no amount is too small. 
Please share our campaign with everyone you know and
ask them to share the campaign with everyone they know. Let’s create a domino
effect! 
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.
If you know people or have resources to donate
equipment or assist with the retrofit process – contact us – we would love the
expertise, insight, and support!
By helping MoLab to get MoBus on the road – YOU are
positively affecting our next generation. YOU are helping to provide the fuel
to ignite excitement and curiosity for the sciences. Help make our vision a
reality.

story:
“The fate of millions of people—indeed the future of the black community itself—may depend on the willingness of those who care about racial justice to re-examine their basic assumptions about the role of the criminal justice system in our society.” 

― Michelle Alexander, The New Jim Crow: Mass Incarceration in the Age of Colorblindness

              In the United States, many of us go about our lives with the naïve notion that we live in a “post-racial” society. Indeed, we hear this phrase from the mouths of powerful politicians and influential community leaders. The truth, unfortunately, is that today’s America is still fighting for true equality. The murders of Michael Brown in Ferguson, MO, Eric Garner in Long Island, NY and so many more unnamed people prove that racism is still thriving in our society. 

            Known as the “school to prison pipeline,” the experience of many African Americans is one of unjust punishment, prolonged incarceration, and limited opportunity. Because of existing prejudice in the minds of so many citizens, we have reintroduced the ways of the old “Jim Crow” laws. We are perpetuating the existence of “second-class citizens,” and relegating their lives to that of criminals and delinquents. Gideon’s Army, a grassroots army for children, has committed itself to dismantling the school-to-prison pipeline and empowering the lives of every child, no matter their race.

             Our organization seeks to intervene at the earliest point in this system of injustice: the school. Through the means of Restorative Justice, Gideon’s Army trains schools, parents, students and community members to create spaces of opportunity, accountability and pride for their young people. Additionally, we employ the techniques of the Theatre of the Oppressed to embolden students to express themselves through creative performance. Through our interventions, we create sustainable, cohesive communities of care that will work to end the pipeline at its earliest stage. Students learn to be effective agents of change, mentors to their peers, and advocates for their community.

             We need your help. Any and every donation will put us closer to a better future for our community’s children. We ask you to make a commitment to our organization, just as we have made one to the Nashville community. Help us, with a donation of any amount, to stop the school-to-prison pipeline in its tracks.

story:
What is the GMC15?

The Global Millennial Conference is the premiere event for Millennials (those ages 18-34) to learn from each other, network with one another, and enjoy the impact Millennials are making world-wide. This event is being held in Columbus, OH on May 15-16, 2015 at the Hyatt Regency Columbus, Downtown. 

While this event is geared toward Professional and Entrepreneurial Millennials, it's also a fantastic conference for college students and that's where you come in! 

I'm Amber Aziza, Chair and Producer of The Global Millennial Conference 2015 (GMC15). I, along with the GMC Advisory Board, would like to send 20 students to the conference with no cost to them! With this campaign, we hope to raise the funds needed to send students from various universities, studying a diverse array of majors, to learn from our generation's greatest leaders

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds we receive from contributors will go directly toward the conference, food, materials, hotel, and travel for the students.
  • This will allow these students to attend the conference without the worry of how will they pay for it.
  • By funding this campaign, you have the opportunity to receive perks including: Your name in the program as a donor, video diary of the students able to attend as a direct result of your contribution, and even a full sponsorship listed on the website.
  • If the funding for this campaign falls short, we will use the money that we were able to raise to cover as much of the cost as possible for these 20 students.

The Impact

With your contribution, you will help GMC send 20 college students to the conference. This includes: 

  • Hotel for 2 nights at the Hyatt Regency Columbus Downtown
  • Full conference tickets which provides access to 35+ sessions, workshops, and trainings
  • Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner for both days
  • Admission to all of the networking events, including our private, invite-only Speaker's Dinner and Ones to Watch Awards Banquet,


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone may be able to contribute and that's ok! We ask that you share our efforts with your network, family and friends!

story:
Yavneh School is an elementary school in Raanana, central Israel. It serves pupils aged 6-12 drawn from the local community, including a mix of longtime local residents and new immigrants or "olim" from all over the world. In particular it has a large English-speaking community and a growing number of families from Europe, especially France. The school runs special Hebrew classes or "ulpan" for children who have recently arrived in the country to assist with their integration into the school. The school has a special language unit which caters for all types of difficulties, especially language. A department has also been set up to enhance gifted children who require more challenging work and an enrichment program for students who need additional help. The school prides itself on providing a warm educational environment for all of its pupils based on their needs and abilities. In addition to its regular classes, it also has 3 smaller classes for children with learning difficulties which provide a special learning environment within the broader framework of the school.

The socio-economic environment is difficult as there are many children who come from a range of backgrounds. The school welcomes each child with love and devotion and tries to invest in each child according to their needs and potential.

As of now we have raised $10,000 for this project and we are aiming to raise an additional $25,000 to complete the refurbishment of the school's library.

We will also arrange tax deductible donation slips for whoever requires it

Here's a link to the school's website:

http://www.tik-tak.co.il/webPro/index.asp?codeClient=941

story:
Lets Empower with Sewing Machines 

We are in need of Sewing Machines! This will empower a big community in Kisoro, Uganda, giving the possibility to make cloths, fix cloths and create items them selves. Small amount from you makes a BIG difference to us. 
I am Ida, and I live in Norway. My friend Mark is the founder of Peace Friends of Hope Foundation, and lives in Kisoro, Uganda. He is responsible of over 400 kids, and his work is to help the community grow in a good way and build schools for the kids. 
It is important for me to help other people when I can, and when Mark asked me to help him with organizing sewing machines for his community I thought that it would be such a great idea to ask friends, family and others with a big heart to donate money here, where the salaries are way higher. Considering the amount we are asking, its pretty cool to see what a great value it will transfer into when it reaches Kiroso in Uganda. Imagine just a small amount of your monthly salary will make a huge different!! You will help empowering people on an other continent. They will have a tool to create value for them selves. 
You will help the people in Kisoro, Uganda to grow and become more self empowered with the possibility to make there own cloths, repair cloths, make school uniforms and other things that can be made with a sewing machine. 
We are so grateful for your contribution!!

What We Need & What You Get

We need at 1,710$ to buy 15 sewings. Each sewing costs $ 114 dollars. All the required funds is 2000 dollars, and everything we get abowe that amount will go to building Friends of Peace and Hope Foundation, buying materials and education.

The perks in this is that you will get a great thank you with your name. You will get pictures of what you have contributed to creating. We also give local things made here in Kisoro T shirts, Bango, nickless, patchwork and bags.

All the funds goes to Peace Friends of Hope Foundation so that they can buy 15 Sewings, have some extra for materials and education. 

If We dont reach the goal, the money will still go to buying sewings. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot contribute with money, I kindly ask you to consider Sharing this with friends and family. Maybe you have resourceful people around you that can contribute without feeling it compromises their own way of life. In this case, Give a little equals a lot.
  • Plis use the Indiegogo share tools and share this crowdfunding campaign in your other social network platforms.
  • "The way to happiness: keeping your heart free from hate, your mind from worry. Live simply, expect little, give much.  Fill your life with love."

Blessings and love. 

Ida, Mark and Peace Friends of Hope Foundation.

story:
Hi! I'm Kate, the creator of GoBreastfeed.com. 

I firmly believe that no parent who completely understands the power of breastfeeding would choose any other way to nourish a child. 

That is why my husband and I combined our experiences in breastfeeding training and counseling, digital media and web development to launch GoBreastfeed.com on Mother's Day this year.

We hope for the site to be a reliable resource for breastfeeding education and support. 

Our goal for this campaign is $5,000. If we achieve it, we will allocate the funds to the following:

  • 60% for production of training videos
  • 30% for web development and hosting
  • 10% for marketing

If we don't hit the goal, we will still have a similar allocation but the quantity and quality of the training videos might be sacrificed, which we do not want. So please help us reach our goal!

Breastfeeding has multiple life-saving benefits. It serves as a newborn's first immunization. It reduces the risk of babies and moms from acute and critical illnesses, even cancer.

Please contribute to the fundraiser and/or share with your friends. 

With your help, we can teach and support more people to reap the benefits of breastfeeding. With your help, we can save more lives.

story:
Once upon a time there was a fair lady. She was not a princess nor was she a pauper. Hers is the story often overlooked by the fairy-tale books. Though she aspired for more, she was of no more than average status or attention. I am here to tell her story.

With the dramatic introductions aside, I would like to introduce myself as the girl in the above narrative. I would consider myself a very blessed person in that I have always had a roof over my head, food in my belly, and love in my home. This is not a rags-to-riches request but a campaign of the heart.

For the past decade I have found myself - in one way or another - in a Spanish class. While others struggled, I found myself enjoying every minute of it. Truly the Hispanic cultures and its language are close to my heart. This Spring I had many doors open, but the one that captured my attention was the possibility to travel abroad and study in Spain for the Fall Semester of 2015. With this opportunity, I would be able to experience firsthand the language that I have grown to love.

So why a campaign?

Like the maiden in the fairy tale, I am not a pauper nor am I a princess. I have gotten by over the years with the help of scholarships and hard work - as I receive no financial aid from the government. Similar to most college students, I take care of the cost of my undergraduate education through loans. Due to the nature of this program, my university requires that I make all payments up front this semester. Without this fundraiser, my only other option is to create even more debt as I add on another loan. I'm asking for a little help and a whole lot of love to make this dream a reality in just a few short months.

In order to further explain, I have created a very basic breakdown of cost. The financial goal was set through the addition of a couple expenses:

Remainder of tuition due upfront: $4,500

Plane Ticket round trip to Madrid: $945

Indiegogo 5% charge: $305

All donations are received with a gracious heart, no matter the size. I hope to arrive in Spain without the weight of financial stress on my shoulders. If that becomes a reality, I hope that I can bring a bit of Spain back to you and let you experience the beauty of this culture.

Gracias!

story:
Short Summary

This is hard - to give you all of the important information, without potentially boring the pants of you all! You can get the full breakdown by clicking on the link below.

http://mediasavvyghana.org/pr_information.pdf

First and foremost, we have a small team of people giving absolutely everything they can give to make this a success. We just need that little extra help in these early stages, to get up and running.

In short, Media Savvy is our highly successful and innovative social enterprise, based in the North East of England. We specialise in a learning by stealth approach, delivering digital arts and media based provisions, whilst promoting core employability skills.  The company has been highly commended with awards and achievements since we began in 2010.

Due to very specific links in Ghana, and due to a high market demand, we are launching a similar venture in one of the largest cities over there. Sunyani is significant in size and population and is comparable to a City such as Sunderland, where Media Savvy is based.  However, there are limited opportunities for the local people to engage with, compared to other cities in the county.

Africa is the continent that can sometimes be mistaken for a country; a land of billions which is primarily characterised by famine or poverty. West Africa, in particular heavily embraces emerging technologies and all things ‘digital’. Formal training for the next generation in media, film making, journalism etc. is vital in telling the stories of the varied countries and cultures.  It is also important to let the the wider world know that Ghana is a great place to visit and invest in. In a nutshell, there’s a critical element of ‘giving a voice to the voiceless’ in the same way that Media Savvy does in the UK.

Image: Taken at our open day in May

We want to make a real difference out in Sunyani and Ghana, and not just in the short term. Success  will not only mean we have helped make a positive social difference out in Ghana, but ultimately ensuring Media Savvy is sustainable so we can continue our important work helping the marginalised groups we focus on here in the UK.

We must stress that this is a not-for-profit venture and any surplus income will be ploughed back into making the venture bigger and better. At the same time, we have done our research and it is a sustainable venture - not just a romanticised 'pie in the sky' idea of 'making a difference in Africa'.

What We Need & What You Get

We have very specific sponsor and partner options that are highlighted on our homepage:

http://mediasavvyghana.org/

However, we are also aware that there are a lot of folks out there who want to help and contribute, but maybe on a smaller scale. Therefore, we have come up with some smaller Perks for individuals and also Perks that are specifically linked to Media Savvy providing a service to your business.

  • If we exceed our funding requirements, this does not mean there will be spare funds going into the organisers pockets - it will simply mean we can add a few desirable extras ... not so much 'bells and whistles', but maybe a bow and a bit of fairy dust
  • Not only do we permit you shouting about how you've helped us - we actively encourage you to do so
  • If we do not reach our target, all funds raised will still contribute towards our cause, and if all else fails, we will find a way to self-fund any shortfall
We've already had some kind cash donations to-date and we will acknowledge absolutely all contributors once our fundraising is over.

Social Impact

There are significant opportunities to develop new and grow existing businesses within the Media sector in Sunyani. Growing these digital-orientated businesses will have a huge positive impact on the economy of the region, the skills development and employment opportunities.

Local knowledge and specific market research tells us there is a high demand for the types of creative digital skills that we are planning to deliver. We are in a unique position to fulfil this market need, due to our expertise, local knowledge and previous track record of delivering highly commended courses in this sector.

Images: Taken at a visit to the Queen of Peace School in May


Risks & Challenges

We have already invested a considerable amount of time, money and effort on the project, to get to this stage. 

We WILL be successful, but with your help we will be successful much sooner, and so, we can start making a difference now.

We have 5 years of experience running our successful social enterprise in the UK and this experience will certainly help us make our Ghanaian venture become a success.

More incentive?

A small group of us are (attempting) the 3-Peaks 24-hour challenge in early July. We feel its only right that along with all of the hard work evolving the project, we also embrace some physical pain to boot to help persuade you to part with your hard earned cash! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute £, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE
  • https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/media-savvy-ghana-training-academy/x/3681539#/story
  • http://mediasavvyghana.org/partner_flyer.pdf

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Si quieres ver el video en español haz clic acá...

We are a not-for-profit organisation which, since 2007, has been working on projects to include children in the process of transforming Colombian society into a pacifist and non-violent society.

We are convinced that boys and girls are also capable of leading us towards building a peaceful country. We can work with the excellent ideas they bring in order to generate real and sustainable cultural change.

In order to achieve this, it is vital that we help strengthen and empower children in the most vulnerable and affected communities to have their voices heard and have them accompany adults in forming part of the peacebuilding process.  We aim to do this by using specific tools which are presented in our unique methodology which, through the medium of art and games, allows boys and girls to build and develop projects which can break the cycle of violence and convert their communities into peaceful territories.

In the Buenaventura Project, we want that community leaders can learn and apply our methodology so that it can have the greatest level of impact and reach a larger number of children. Through this project, we aim to reach 400 boys and girls who, through 80 projects can transform their reality. And you can help us achieve this too... 

IF WE EXCEED OUR GOAL WE CAN TRAIN MORE LEADERS AND THEREBY WE COULD IMPACT MORE CHILDREN. REMEMBER EACH LEADER WILL INFLUENCE 20 BOYS AND GIRLS AT LEAST. 

Training agents of peace in Buenaventura, Colombia.



Why Buenaventura?

The municipality of Buenaventura, in the region of Valle de Cauca, is one of the most important ports of Colombia and is considered to be one of the most biodiverse areas in the country. However, it is currently an area where illegal armed disputes, drug cartles and crime is rife. News reports are constantly filled with daily stories regarding attacks on rural communities or the dimemebering of community members.  There are even specifically designated houses existing within the community where people are taken to be dismembered and body parts are hidden leaving no traces. People living in these communities have to confront poverty, violence, fear, listening to screams of torture  and total abaondment from the State on a daily basis. Men, women, girls and boys are not able to speak up about what is happening in their communities for fear of becoming victims of violence. Empowering the population to become agents of peace will lead to the creation of a unified voice aiming to break the cycle of violence and build a culture of peace.


What do we want to achieve?

* Build the capacity of 20 community leaders and teachers in the most violent areas of Buenaventura to develop peacebuilding processes and initiatives  specifically tailored to the context of their community using the Fuente de Paz methodology.

* Establish these inbuilt capacities so that each participant can replicate the methodology process with 20 boys and girls in their community which will impact a total of 400 children living in their communities to continue the peacebuilfing initiatives and involve adults in the process.


How we do this – a guide through the Fuente de Paz Methodology

1.  Experience: During the first stage of the training process, the participant will be able to experience, through interactive and artistic activities, the Fuente de Paz methodology. The aim of this stage is for participants to better understand the methodology by experiencing firsthand how the children build their capacities to create peacebuilding initiatives and solutions within their communities. Participants will take part in this experience in order to reach a collective solution for the targeted community which can be converted into a collective action.

Duration: A total of 20 hours. 5 days: 4 hours per day.

2.  Comparative theory: In the second stage of the training process, participants will be able to compare what they have learned in the first stage of the training with the more practical and theoretical aspects of the methodology. This stage in the training will present to participants the importance and effectiveness of the specific tools used within the methodology in addition to developing indicators and evaluation tools for the project.

Duration: A total of 20 hours.  5 days: 4 hours per day.

3.  Collective project building: In the third stage of the training process, participants will build the project using the learned methodology and apply it to the context or environment within which they will carry out the workshop. During this stage, participants will develop specific activities, think of tools which can be used based on those demonstrated in the methodology.  Finally, participants will develop tailored monitoring and evaluation tools to ensure project sustainability and maximum impact.

Follow up: At the end of the project, staff at the head office in Bogota will continue to provide support and maintain contact with the trainers on post project progress to ensure continued impact.

Duration: A total of 40 hours. 10 days: 4 hours per day.


Who are our partners?

In the region:

Fundación Carvajal, have been working in Buenaventura since October 2010. Their work has been fundamental in bringing about social and community development programmes within the municipality. Our strong and long lasting partnership with Fundacion  Carvajal allows us to build a trusting bond with members of the community, select the most relevant leaders for the workshop and have the appropriate spaces for the workshops to be carried out including the provision of refreshments.

In Bogotá:

The Impact Hub in Bogotá, provides the space for us to carry out our monthly event “Expo Regala Paz” (Expo Giving Peace) with the aim of raising funds to implement this project. Equally, everyone participating in the Expo, including assistants and entrepreneurs, form part of our group of collaborators.

The National Association of Businesses in Colombia  (ANDI), are one of Fuente de Paz’s strategic fundraising partners for this project. ANDI is responsible for providing and ensuring that there is a corporate social responsibility component during corporate events held with businesses across Colombia.

Become one of our partners and TOGETHER we can build peace within the most vulnerable communities!

story:
The Problem

In the present day, technological innovation is forever changing the world we are living in. Nowadays, the majority of our personal information is collected, stored and analyzed through various devices such as mobile phones, tablets and personal computers. With the assortment of private information, virtual profiles are being created that identify our personal tastes, preferences, track our current locations and monitor how we spend our free time.

These virtual profiles that contain sensitive private information is being sold to third party venders without our knowledge, consent or financial compensation in exchange. Advertisers who obtain this data target us as future consumers by personalizing their marketing mix to match our desires. 

Our Goal

Our goal at We Love Data is to provide every multimedia user the opportunity to capitalize on their own personal data. By downloading our well-developed application for various mobile devices we enable you, the user, to manage your own data output and make it publically available for compensation at your discretion. All data collected by the app is saved centrally which makes it easier to create comprehensive personal profiles that truly reflect who you are.

Furthermore, the application provides the user to be rewarded for sharing his personal information. If his data is sold three different times to third party venders (which we will track), he will receive three times an X amount of money. Any earnings made on the transactions are paid at the end of each month they accrue in.

Lastly, the application offers the user transparency and control over his data, not some advertiser. This is achieved by giving the user full ability to manage which data he wants to make publically available and which data he wants to remain private. In other words, each individual has the opportunity to determine their own earnings for data that is public while safeguarding any data they deem to be private.

The Project

Specifically, the project consists of the development and commercialization of an application that is readily available on mobile devices, as well as, browser plugins that users can freely download. Each of the applications or user plugins was designed to be user friendly and have attractive features. The simple to use interface in the application helps track, as well as, manage your personal tastes and preferences. All in all, we believe that this application will help bridge firms and consumers closer together by offering each party not only financial compensation, but security as well.

This is why we are here today to help illustrate the true potential of this project through your investment in our company.

Where Did the Idea Come From?

As a current marketing student it has become apparent how technology is changing the way we live our lives, do business and communicate with one another. Having done my research and following the market trends currently being observed it is evident that big data, especially, personal information is the next big thing. As a result, I came up with this idea to provide people like myself the opportunity to sell data of my choosing to companies in exchange for financial compensation. With the ever changing digital environment and its influence on marketing I was eager to join the competition. Through this application I feel that companies will be able to better suit my needs through targeted and effective marketing campaigns that are not only tailored for me, but by me. In doing so, I provide users like myself the awareness and ability to make my information a tradable commodity. Not only will this application offer that, but it will compensate people for it.

Risks Faced

With anything in life, there are many risks and challenges that lie ahead. Currently, our biggest risk is the making sure the safety of our user’s data is protected. Additionally, the largest challenge we face is commercializing this application and making both firms and consumers aware of it. With the right leadership, execution and financing, we can make this a reality. As early adoption becomes more main stream, the goodwill will give both consumers and firms the chance to profit. By investing in the launching of this app we will all be a part of something truly rewarding, but also personally unique.
